1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
3
Recommand√©
29.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 19 avril 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é, –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–π —á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å!

–í 80-—Ö –≥–æ–¥–∞—Ö, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ RPG —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ-—Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∏ –ø–æ—è–≤–ª—è—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ –Ω–∞—à–∏—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø—å—é—Ç–µ—Ä–∞—Ö, –æ–¥–Ω–∏–º –∏–∑ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–æ–≤ –±—ã–ª dungeon crawler. –ù–µ–∑–∞–º—ã—Å–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ç—ã–π —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç, –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç –Ω–∞ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏, –±–æ—è—Ö, –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –≥–µ—Ä–æ–π –∏–ª–∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—è, –≥–¥–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å —Å –Ω—É–ª—è - –µ–≥–æ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ò —Ö–æ—Ç—è —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –∏–≥—Ä—ã —à–∞–≥–Ω—É–ª–∏ –Ω–∞–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ, –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–µ, –ø–æ–±—Ä–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ –±–µ—Å–∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–º –ø–æ–¥–∑–µ–º–µ–ª—å—è–º, –ø–æ–±–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö –Ω–µ—Å—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π.

–ù–µ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä—è –Ω–∞ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–≥–∏—è –≤ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–∞, –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–æ–ª–µ–≤—ã—Ö dungeon crawler —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫ —É–∂ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ: Legend of Grimrock –¥–∞ –Ω–µ —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º —É–¥–∞—á–Ω–∞—è The Bard‚Äôs Tale IV. Operencia: The Stolen Sun –±–µ–∑—É—Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ—Ç —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫, –Ω–æ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –º–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞ –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞: –≤–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç —Ñ–∏–∫—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—É—é –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—é, –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç —É–ø–æ—Ä –Ω–∞ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é –∏ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π, –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã–µ ‚Äú—Ñ–∏—à–∫–∏‚Äù —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–≥—Ä –∫–∞–∫ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—É. –¢–µ–º –Ω–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ, —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ-–ø—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–µ–º—É dungeon crawler, –ø—É—Å—Ç—å –¥–∞–∂–µ –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–æ–π —É–ø–∞–∫–æ–≤–∫–µ, —Ç–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ –∂–µ–ª–∞—é—â–∏–µ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–æ–∫, –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è, —Ç–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –±–æ—ë–≤ –Ω–∞–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—è–∫–∞ –æ—Ü–µ–Ω—è—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç –ø–æ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤—É.

–ü–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—Å—è –æ–±–∑–æ—Ä? –•–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ —á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Ç–∞–∫–∏–µ –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ–π –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ? –ü–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –Ω–∞ –∫—É—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ YroMIR ReviewS, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —É–≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–Ω–∑–∏–π –≤ Steam!

–°—é–∂–µ—Ç –∏ –º–∏—Ä –∏–≥—Ä—ã

–ú–∏—Ä - –æ–¥–Ω–∞ –∏–∑ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω –∏–≥—Ä—ã. –†–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∏ –∏–∑ Zen Studios –Ω–µ –ø–æ–¥–¥–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –∏—Å–∫—É—à–µ–Ω–∏—é —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–æ–π –±–µ–∑–ª–∏–∫–∏–π —Å–µ—Ç—Ç–∏–Ω–≥ —Å –æ—Ä–∫–∞–º–∏ –¥–∞ —ç–ª—å—Ñ–∞–º–∏, –∞ –≤–¥–æ—Ö–Ω–æ–≤–ª—è–ª–∏—Å—å –º–∏—Ñ–∞–º–∏ –¶–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –ï–≤—Ä–æ–ø—ã.
–í—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑ —Ç—Ä—ë—Ö –º–∏—Ä–æ–≤: –≤–µ—Ä—Ö–Ω–µ–≥–æ, –≥–¥–µ –æ–±–∏—Ç–∞—é—Ç –±–æ–≥–∏, —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≥–æ, –Ω–∞—Å–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ª—é–¥—å–º–∏, –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–º–∏, ‚Äú–≤–æ–ª—à–µ–±–Ω—ã–º –Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥—Ü–µ–º‚Äù, –∏ –Ω–∏–∂–Ω–µ–≥–æ - –¥–æ–º–æ–º –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω–æ–≤, –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–≤. –ï—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, –∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –≥–ª—É–±–∏–Ω —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ –ø—ã—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –∑–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —Å–æ—Å–µ–¥–µ–π ‚Äú–ø–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å—Å—è‚Äù —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–µ–π. –í–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –∏–∑ —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–∫ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞—à–∞ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è: –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—ã –ø–æ—Ö–∏—Ç–∏–ª–∏ –±–æ–≥–∞ —Å–æ–ª–Ω—Ü–∞ –∏ –∑–∞—Ç–æ—á–∏–ª–∏ –µ–≥–æ –≤ —Å–≤–æ—ë–º —Å—Ç–µ–∫–ª—è–Ω–Ω–æ–º –¥–≤–æ—Ä—Ü–µ. –ë–µ–∑ —Å–≤–µ—Ç–∞ –∂–∏–≤–æ–µ –≤ –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ–≥–∏–±–∞–µ—Ç –∏–ª–∏ –æ–±—Ä–∞—â–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ, —Ö–∏—â–Ω—ã–µ –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–∏ —Å–∞–º–∏—Ö —Å–µ–±—è, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –º–µ–¥–ª–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è.

–î–ª—è —Å–ø–∞—Å–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–∏—Ä–∞ —Å—É–¥—å–±–∞ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–ª–∞ –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –≥–µ—Ä–æ—è (–∏–ª–∏ –Ω–∞—à—É –≥–µ—Ä–æ–∏–Ω—é, –ø–æ–ª –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω –Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–∫—É–ø –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫—É). –ü–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂—É –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –Ω–µ–ª—ë–≥–∫–∞—è –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞: –ø–æ–¥–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –∑–µ–º–ª–∏ –±–æ–≥–æ–≤, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —É–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–∫ –æ–¥–æ–ª–µ—Ç—å –Ω–µ—É—è–∑–≤–∏–º–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∞, –ø—Ä–æ–±—É–¥–∏—Ç—å –¥—É—Ö–∏ –≥–µ—Ä–æ–µ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–≥–æ, —Å–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, –Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω–µ—Ü, –≤ —Å–∞–º—ã–µ –≥–ª—É–±–∏–Ω—ã –Ω–∏–∂–Ω–µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –æ—Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –±–æ–≥–∞ —Å–æ–ª–Ω—Ü–∞. –ö —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å—é, –≤ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –º—ã –æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º—Å—è –Ω–µ –≤ –æ–¥–∏–Ω–æ—á–∫—É.

–ü—Ä–æ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–π—Ü—ã —Å–æ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º–∏ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è–º–∏, —Ö–∞—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏ - –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–∞—è –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞. –•–æ—Ç—è –≤ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç—å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —á–µ—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–æ, –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≥–µ—Ä–æ–∏ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç —Å –Ω–∞–º–∏, –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ —Å–ø–æ—Ä—è—Ç, —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—è –±–∞–π–∫–∏ —É –∫–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞. –ï–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–∫ –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ —Å–ø—É—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ—Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, –∞ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å—ã —É –Ω–∏—Ö –∑–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω—ã. –í—ã—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏ –∏–≥—Ä—ã –≤—ã –±—É–¥–µ—Ç–µ —Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –±–µ–∑ –º–∞–≥–∞ –∏ –¥–æ –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω—ã –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ - –±–µ–∑ ‚Äú—Ö–∏–ª–∞‚Äù. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —á–∞—Å—Ç—å –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –∏–º–µ—Ç—å ‚Äú—Ä–µ–∑–∏—Å—Ç—ã‚Äù –∫ —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∞–º, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–µ–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞–µ—Ç –±–æ–π —Å –Ω–∏–º–∏ –≤ —É–Ω—ã–ª–æ–µ –∫–æ–≤—ã—Ä—è–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Å–µ—Ä–≤–Ω–æ–π –±–∞–Ω–∫–∏ –≤–∏–ª–∫–æ–π. –ö —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å—é, —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö —Å—Ö–≤–∞—Ç–æ–∫ –Ω–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ.

–ö–∞—Ç—Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ñ–æ–Ω–µ –∑–∞—Ç–æ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–º–∫–∞, —Å —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞—à –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –∫–≤–µ—Å—Ç. 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : Larreate


–ì–µ–π–º–ø–ª–µ–π

–í –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã –ª–µ–∂–∏—Ç –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ dungeon crawler: –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ ‚Äú–∫–≤–∞–¥—Ä–∞—Ç–∞–º‚Äù, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–µ —Å –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–∫–∏ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Ä–∞–∑–¥—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç, –ø–æ—à–∞–≥–æ–≤—ã–µ –±–æ–∏ —Å –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –ª–∏–Ω–∏–µ–π –Ω–∞–ø–∞–¥–∞—é—â–∏—Ö. –•–æ—Ç—è —Å—Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∫–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–æ—Ä–∞—á–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–µ, –æ–Ω–∏ –≤–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–º —Å—Ö–æ–∂–∏ —Å –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω—ã–º–∏ –Ω–∞–º:
  • –æ—Ç —Ç–æ–≥–æ —Å –∫–∞–∫–æ–π —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã –≤—ã –∑–∞–π–¥—ë—Ç–µ –∫ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫—É, –∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏—Ç –∫—Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ —É–¥–∞—Ä–∞. –°—Ç–∞—Ä–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∏–≥–∞—Ç—å –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ —Å–æ —Å–ø–∏–Ω—ã, –Ω–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–µ–º —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–π—Ç–µ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å —Å–µ–±—è –≤—Ä–∞—Å–ø–ª–æ—Ö!
  • —É –≤—Å–µ—Ö –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π –µ—Å—Ç—å —à–∫–∞–ª–∞ –∏–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∞—Ç–∏–≤—ã - —É –∫–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω–∞ –≤—ã—à–µ, —Ç–æ—Ç –Ω–∞–ø–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–º.
  • —É –ª—é–±—ã—Ö –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–æ–≤, –∫—Ä–æ–º–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∏, –µ—Å—Ç—å ‚Äú–∫—É–ª–¥–∞—É–Ω‚Äù, –≤ —Ç–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –∏—Ö –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è - –¥–∞–∂–µ –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç—É.
  • —É—Ä–æ–Ω –¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∏—Ö–∏–π–Ω—ã–π (–æ–≥–æ–Ω—å, –ª—ë–¥, –º–æ–ª–Ω–∏—è), —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∏ —É—Ä–æ–Ω –æ—Ç —è–¥–∞. –ú–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –∏–º–º—É–Ω—ã –∫ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–º –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∞–º.
  • –≤–æ–∑–ª–µ –∫–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—è –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∫—Ä–∞—Ñ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∑–µ–ª—å—è –ø–æ –Ω–∞–π–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç–∞–º. –ü—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç–≤–∞—Ä–∞ - –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–∞—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∞, –≥–¥–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —É–≥–∞–¥–∞—Ç—å –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏–Ω–≥—Ä–µ–¥–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤.
  • –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –≥–µ—Ä–æ–π –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –≤–∑—è—Ç—å —Å —Å–æ–±–æ–π –Ω–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –¥–≤—É—Ö –∑–µ–ª–∏–π. –ü–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –∑–∞–ø–∞—Å —É –∫–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤, –æ–Ω–∏ –∂–µ –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± ‚Äú—Ä—É—á–Ω—ã—Ö‚Äù —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ —Ç–æ—á–∫–∞ –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö–∞, –≥–¥–µ –≤–æ—Å—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∞–≤–ª–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤—å–µ, —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—è.

–°–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —É –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ –≤–ª–µ–∑—É—Ç –≤ ‚Äú–∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—É—é‚Äù –ø–∞–Ω–µ–ª—å –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–æ–≤ - –ø—Ä–∏–¥—ë—Ç—Å—è —á–µ–º-—Ç–æ –∂–µ—Ä—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å. –í–ø—Ä–æ—á–µ–º, –ø–æ–º–µ–Ω—è—Ç—å –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–∏ –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤–Ω–µ –±–æ—è, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Å–±—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å —Ö–∞—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∏, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å –æ—á–∫–∏. –≠—Ç–∞ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏—è –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–∞ –∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–∞ –≤ –ª—é–±–æ–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç.

–í–Ω–µ –±–æ—è –≤ –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å —á–µ–º –∑–∞–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è: –≤ –∏–≥—Ä–µ –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω–æ–µ –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–æ–∫ - –æ–ø—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º—ã—Ö –ø–æ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–º—É —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç—É. –î–ª—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö –∏–∑ –Ω–∏—Ö –ø–æ–Ω–∞–¥–æ–±—è—Ç—Å—è –æ—Å–æ–±—ã–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ø—Ä–∏–æ–±—Ä–µ—Ç–∞–µ–º—ã–µ –ø–æ —Ö–æ–¥—É –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–µ –ª–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ —É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ–π–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ë–æ–ª—å—à–∞—è —á–∞—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞–≥–∞–¥–æ–∫ –Ω–µ —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–∞—è, –≤ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–º –∑–∞ —Å—á—ë—Ç –∑–∞–±–æ—Ç–ª–∏–≤–æ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏ –ø–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–æ–∫: –≤ –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏, –≤ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏—è—Ö –Ω–∞—à–∏—Ö —Å–æ–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–π—Ü–µ–≤. –¢–µ–º –Ω–µ –º–µ–Ω–µ–µ, –ø–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –µ—â—ë –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É —à–µ–≤–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å –º–æ–∑–≥–∞–º–∏ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ.

–ü—Ä–∏ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∞ –º—ã –≤—ã–±–∏—Ä–∞–µ–º –º–µ–∂–¥—É —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–º–∏ –≤–æ–∏–Ω–æ–º, –º–∞–≥–æ–º, –ª—É—á–Ω–∏–∫–æ–º, –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è–µ–º —Å–≤–æ—é –±–∏–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏—é, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –≤–ª–∏—è–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä—ã, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∫–ª–∏–∫–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–≤—à–∏–π—Å—è —Å–ø—Ä–∞–π—Ç –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≥–µ—Ä–æ—è. –û–Ω–∏, –∫—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏, –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –¥–ª—è —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤: –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –≤–æ–∏–Ω—ã –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –º—É—Å–∫—É–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã–µ, —á–µ–º –º–∞–≥–∏. –ß—Ç–æ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ, —ç—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –∫–∞–∫ –≤ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ —Å –º—É–∂—Å–∫–∏–º–∏, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –∂–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∞–º–∏.

–û—Ç–º–µ—á—É —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ, —á—Ç–æ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –¥—Ä—É–∂–µ–ª—é–±–Ω–∞ –∫ –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫—É - –≤ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–µ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –æ–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–º –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∞–º: –≤–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—É—é –≥–∏–±–µ–ª—å –≤ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è; –æ—Ç–∫–ª—é—á–∏—Ç—å –º–∏–Ω–∏-–º–∞—Ä–∫–µ—Ä—ã –Ω–∞ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–µ; –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏—Ç—å –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π. –í –∏—Ç–æ–≥–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –∫–æ–º—Ñ–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è –≤–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–∞–Ω–æ–≤, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –∫–∞–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–æ–≤.

–í—Å—è –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—è –≤ —Å–±–æ—Ä–µ —É –∫–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : Larreate


–í–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å—Ç–∏–ª—å

–î–≤–∏–∂–æ–∫ Unreal Engine 4 –¥–∞—ë—Ç —Å–æ—á–Ω—É—é, –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—É—é 3D-–∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–∫—É. –î–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω–µ—Ä—ã –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ä–∞–ª–∏—Å—å, —Ç–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥ –Ω–∞ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞: –Ω–∏ –∑–∞ —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å–ø—É—Ç–∞–µ—à—å —Å—Ç–∏–º–ø–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π –º–µ–¥–Ω—ã–π –ª–µ—Å —Å –∂—É—Ç–∫–æ–≤–∞—Ç—ã–º –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–∏–º –ª–µ—Å–æ–º; —Å –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –≤–∑–≥–ª—è–¥–∞ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏—à—å –∑–∞—Ç–æ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∑–∞–º–æ–∫ –Ω–∞ –æ–∑–µ—Ä–µ –ê–Ω–Ω—ã –æ—Ç –∑–∞–ø—É—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ª–æ–≤—É—à–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ –≤–æ–ª—à–µ–±—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –∑–∞–º–∫–∞ –ë–∞–ª–≤–∞–Ω—å–æ—Å. –ß—Ç–æ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ, –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–º—É –º–µ—Å—Ç—É —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª–∏ —Å–≤–æ—é –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ—á–µ—Å—Ç—å –≤ –º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–º –∫–æ–¥–µ–∫—Å–µ.

–ü–æ–º–∏–º–æ 3D-–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∏, –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è —Ä–∞–∑–≤–æ—Ä–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∫–∞—Ç—Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ö, –Ω–∞—Ä–∏—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —É–∂–µ –≤ 2D. –≠—Ç–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ –∞–Ω–∏–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–æ–ª–∏–∫–∏, –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏, –≥–¥–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è —Å–ø—Ä–∞–π—Ç—ã –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π: –≤—Å–µ –æ–Ω–∏ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω—ã –Ω–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ, —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç —Å—Ç–∏–ª—é –∏–≥—Ä—ã.

–ú–µ–¥–Ω—ã–π –ª–µ—Å, –æ–¥–Ω–∞ –∏–∑ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–π –í–µ—Ä—Ö–Ω–µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞ 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : Larreate


–ú—É–∑—ã–∫–∞ –∏ –æ–∑–≤—É—á–∫–∞

–ü—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –æ–∑–≤—É—á–µ–Ω –∏ —ç—Ç–∞ –æ–∑–≤—É—á–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ —Å –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∏–≥—Ä–æ–π. –ù–∏–∫–∞–∫–æ–π –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–π –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å–∏, –Ω–µ—Å–æ–≤–ø–∞–¥–∞—é—â–∏—Ö –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤, –∞–∫—Ç—ë—Ä–æ–≤, –Ω–µ —É–º–µ—é—â–∏—Ö ‚Äú–∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ç—å‚Äù —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ - –≤—Å—ë —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω–æ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ. –£ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö —Å–ª—ã—à–∏—Ç—Å—è –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç, –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–∫–æ—Ä–µ–µ –∫–∞–∫ –∑–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω–∞—è –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å, –Ω–µ–∂–µ–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–∫.

–ú—É–∑—ã–∫—É –¥–ª—è –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä –ê—Ä—Ç—É—Ä –ì—Ä–æ—Å, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —É—Å–ø–µ–ª –ø–æ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞–¥ —Å–∞—É–Ω–¥—Ç—Ä–µ–∫–∞–º–∏ –∫ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏–º —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º–∞–º. –ò–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –æ–Ω —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª –¥–ª—è –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã–µ, –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–µ. –ú–Ω–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –º—É–∑—ã–∫–∞ –∏–∑ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–µ–Ω—é - –ø–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–µ, –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–¥—ã –æ—Ç —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π, –ª–∏—Ä–∏—á–Ω–æ–π –º–µ–ª–æ–¥–∏–∏ –¥–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Ä–∏—Ç–º–∏—á–Ω–æ–π –±–æ–µ–≤–æ–π.

–ò—Ç–æ–≥

Operencia: The Stolen Sun - —ç—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä –∫—Ä–µ–ø–∫–æ–≥–æ, —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —Ö–æ—Ç—å –∏ –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –∑–≤—ë–∑–¥ —Å –Ω–µ–±–∞, –Ω–æ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∏—Ç—å –¥–≤–∞–¥—Ü–∞—Ç—å-—Ç—Ä–∏–¥—Ü–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —á–∞—Å–æ–≤. –ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –æ–Ω –≤–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–º –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω –Ω–∞ ‚Äú–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–≥–∏—Ä—É—é—â–∏—Ö —Ñ–∞–Ω–∞—Ç–æ–≤‚Äù, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤—ã—Ä–æ—Å–ª–∏ –Ω–∞ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö, ‚Äú—Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö‚Äù –∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ö, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–π —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –±–∞–Ω–∞–ª–µ–Ω, –∞ –±–æ—ë–≤ –ø–æ—Ä–æ–π —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ. –ù–æ –≤ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º —ç—Ç–æ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é —è –≤—Å–µ—Ü–µ–ª–æ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é.

–î–æ –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á –∏ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏—Ö –∏–≥—Ä!
 
Larreate
752 produits enregistr√©s
7
123 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
5
Recommand√©
18.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 mars 2020
Operencia is a 1st person dungeon crawler when it comes to gameplay, however there's one major difference between this game and the usual metric of the genre: the focus of the game. where's usualy these games are centered around exploring, combat and progression the main focus is here is clearly the characters and the story.
the production quality is actualy quite impressive. pretty much every dialogue line is voiced, there's even a narrator and most of the voice-acting is quite good (there are some misses). what is even more impressive is the amount of voiced lines.
not just the plot is fully voiced, but your party comments pretty much on everything, either with one-liners or full on conversations. find a locked door? comment.
find a new enemy? comment. combat? comment. rest at a camp? comment. you get the picture.
the writing is quite endearing and pretty upbeat most of the time.
adin well crafted ingame cutscenes and hand-drawn (very pretty) stop-motion-movies and you get the most story heavy 1st person dungeon crawler...like ever.
while the grafic won't win any prices, the art-design is top notch. enviroments, 2d portraits, 3d enemy models (especialy bosses) and npcs are very nice to look at. the presentation just flows very well.
the soundtrack helps to carry the mood of the game and the ambient work is phenomenal (from nature sounds in forests, to cracks and rumbels in caves and dungeons).

where the game is a bit lacking is the depth of other similiar games (like Wizardy or Might&Magic). character progression is based around attribute, 3 "skill-trees" per character, which consist of active abilities and passive buffs. there's also kinda like a perk-system.
crafting evolves around "brewing" things in a couldron, which works through unique recipes you gotta find. it's kinda like a neat little minigame, design around a puzzle approach.
everything neccessary is here, it just looks/feels a bit lacking compared to the big names in the genre.
combat is turn based, which i personaly prefer to what some other games did.

the game world itself is not just stunning, but also filled with secrets, metroidvaniaesque backtracking and puzzle (which are nice little diversion unlike what Bard's Tale 4 did, it's nowhere near as puzzle heavy...thankfully).

i can fully recommend the game. you get alot for the price and most (nearly all) of it is defintily quite competend.

however the negative i got to mention is the way your party evolves:
you get to create 1 character after the tutorial/story-introduction, choosing between 3 classes.
from there on out you find new npcs in a linear manner. these npcs kinda follow similiar "classes", and while offering more variety than your own innitial choices there's not a lot you can change build wise.
so if you don't choose a mage at the beginng you will be stuck without a mage for quite a while and even when your party gets full: you get a druid and a healer, but no dedicated elemental mage.
so if you want the "best" advice i can offer you: choose a mage.

if Operencia had more depth when it comes to build variety and character progression it would definitly be an absolute highlight, but as it stand it's a very good 1st person dungeon crawler, which focuses on story/characters and will net a great a playtrought, but lacks in replayability.

i usualy avoid all the "epic"-exclusive games (even the timed ones), but this one is my guilty pleasure....sue me ;)
 
rasabt

78.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 juillet 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Operencia: The Stolen Sun

A beautiful dungeon crawler which requires regular inventory and character attribute changes to succeed.

First Impressionsü§î

The game looks and sounds wonderful with colourful backgrounds and a haunting melody playing throughout. Voice acting ranges from okay to excellent and special effect noises are loud, brash and attention seeking. It all culminates into quite an exciting experience.

Perseverance is needed as some battles almost appear impossible at first but you‚Äôll need to think about your enemy‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses and tailor your team to win. Your party is customizable throughout the game and the line up can be changed also. You‚Äôll be able to equip different items, potions, special skills and reassign your skill tree and attribute points. I spent quite a lot of time configuring characters to try and beat bosses. Some boss battles took me numerous attempts to win. It feels very rewarding to finally beat an opponent.

The puzzles are quite difficult in places but mostly enjoyable to work out and in the main they felt logical. There is a lot of exploration plus loads of hidden treasure, secret passageways and items to find. As you progress, you‚Äôll acquire special party skills which aid you in solving some of these puzzles.

The story was okay. It kept the adventure ticking along. I mostly enjoyed the banter between characters and learning more about their backgrounds. Each party member had a back story which was discussed and developed throughout, and at the end I felt like I knew the characters quite well and wanted them to succeed.

I really enjoyed Operencia:The Stolen Sun. I found it quite challenging in places, whether it was a difficult puzzle or a seemingly impossible battle, but it always kept me coming back for another try. I think you do need a bit of patience in this respect but it‚Äôs perfectly achievable.

More Information
Storyüìï
The Sun King Napkiraly has been abducted and consequentially the land of Operencia is plunged into darkness. It won‚Äôt be long before the Underworld is unleashed bringing about the fall of mankind. After a recurring dream you are compelled to set out on a journey to release the Sun King.

Cut scenes look and sound great and appear after each level developing the story further. 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : janner66


Gameplay üïπÔ∏è

Operencia is split into three main areas. Battles, exploration and puzzles.

Battles
Each party member has up to nine active skills they can use in battle with three basic skills identical to all characters. The rest are unique to each party member. Each character has a skill tree with three branches determining their skills.

Each battle arena has three combat lines ‚Äì Front, middle and back. Some skills and weapons are more effective depending on the distance of the enemy.

Each character has a varying number of hit points and energy points determined by their core skills and the way you configure the character‚Äôs attributes. Other attributes include intelligence, wisdom and vigor. Certain weapons and magic skills can only be wielded with a certain number of points.

Solving puzzles, defeating enemies, locating secrets etc. earns you XP, EP and HP which levels you up. At each level you get one skill point and three attribute points to spend.

The interesting thing about this game is that you can re-allocate all the points you have accrued at ANY point in the game changing the character completely and the way they fight. This is crucial for success, and not just their attributes but their skills, weapons, armour etc. There is an automatic method to fit out your companions to their maximum potential if you so wish.

Using unique abilities uses up energy. Without energy you won‚Äôt be able to use any skills and must rely on you three basic skills. You can refill your energy bar through potions or other characters special skills, or after battle at camp fires.

Battles are turn based and you can gain initiative and the first blow by sneaking up on enemies. Enemies can stun, fear or place you in a state of sleep meaning you will miss your turn. Enemies can drain your energy or taunt you meaning you have to attack that particular enemy. There is a lot of variation in tactics and sometimes you‚Äôll have to fight three battles in a row before you can replenish your potions, health and energy at camp fires. Luckily you can save the game at any time.



Exploration
There is always a map available to help you navigate the area you are in. As you move, the map is revealed, making it easy to pinpoint where you haven‚Äôt been. Once discovered, objects of particular use will be highlighted on the map.

Movement is tile based although you cannot move diagonally. The camera is completely free and can be moved around at your discretion. It is surprisingly easy to move around at pace using the camera and map as a tool.

On each level there are chests, secrets, percentage of map and campfires to reveal. Secrets include gaining access to locked doors or finding secret passageways; Campfires let you replenish everything at the cost of one firewood. You can also fast travel anywhere, and change your line up. You can buy and sell goods with the merchant and even brew potions in a mini game.

The Cauldron is an interesting mini game where you have to follow the clues to choose the correct ingredients for the potion. 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : janner66


You can find chest keys which open certain chests revealing goodies, collect gold, potions and weapons along the way.

There are thirteen levels to explore and some areas are inaccessible until later so you‚Äôll need to return with a special skill or item.

There is a wealth of information in your journal detailing monsters you have encountered, notes you have found, dialogues, and a really useful guide detailing everything you‚Äôll need to know.

Puzzles
Puzzles are an integral part of the game and you won‚Äôt be able to advance without solving some of them. Puzzles include searching for objects around the map, pressing levers or avoiding traps, re-arranging mixed up pictures or just navigating across inaccessible areas.

Throughout the game new skills are revealed. There are seven in total. Spade (Finds chests); Feather (lifts heavy objects); Stoneheart (builds bridges); magic beans (grows plants to climb); nimble boots (can run fast); magic wand (can freeze objects); rooster (can go through holes). You will use all of these or a combination of these to solve puzzles.

There are a lot of clever puzzles in Operencia. This one is not original but still difficult to complete considering you cannot skip puzzles 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : janner66


Graphics üì∫

The visuals were gorgeous and the game felt very colourful for a dungeon crawler. Characters were drawn beautifully and enemy encounters were interesting. With over fifty different types of enemies, battles never seemed repetitive. Each enemy had their own battle stances, personalities and special moves.

Sound üéµ
There is a beautiful orchestral score playing throughout the game which fits into the look and feel of the game perfectly. Battles are loud and exciting and dramatic music and effects are played at all the right times to create mood and atmosphere.

Conclusion
Operencia:The Stolen Sun is a varied and interesting dungeon crawler with great visuals and sound. Puzzles are quite difficult in places and boss battles can be particularly challenging.

I really enjoyed the amount of configuration you can do with your characters and the amount of tactics needed for certain battles. I think it is great value for money and I would certainly recommend.

Curator Info:
Follow our curator page: OCG-Curations if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.

This game was received for free through curator connect.
 
janner66

√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 novembre 2020
I love this game. ! I`ve played through it twice , -( and a half way through once, when I chose permanent death , and everyone of course died :( )
Here is what you get :
The Good :
The story is based on Hungarian folklore, and is very well written .
Great customable options to choose from the start.
Different areas to go to, outdors, dungeons, castles , dungeons , etc - and you get fast travelling between them , early into the game.
Puzzles - great puzzles ! And nice secrets to find !
Character customisation is great, and you have the option to change it at any time , if you should want to .
Lots of dry humour :)
Combat is turn based, and since you have so many different skills to choose from, you can make it into a lot of fun .
Lots of items to find , and a vendor who travels with you .
Lovely graphics !
Lovely music !

The little ! tiny ! not so good ;
Item findings, and the vendors collection - it isn`t always that balanced, imho. It is a bit disappointing sometimes, when the vendor announces she has new items - and they are all worse than everything you already have . And you might be in great need for a good armour or weapon. Mostly armours - especially for the mages.
But when that`s said ; late game item sets are Fabulous !
Next little ! tiny ! complain is :
It is a bit tricky, - (at least it was for me ) - to figure out all the mecanics of the game . I had a few ! " Oh ! I can do that ! I wish I knew before ! "

Lastly , a suggestion : Playing a mage as your main character is recommended, since another mage wont show up until rather late in the game. But really, Operencia is fully playable without a mage .
 
Talana üíÉ

77 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
2
Non recommand√©
31.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 aout 2020
Operencia is an old-school "blobber" style RPG. I'm on the final level of it and at this point I'm just finishing it to finish it. The game began very promising, it's colorful and nice to look at, and your party banters frequently and amusingly throughout, there are fun secrets to discover, and early on the systems for combat and character advancement are interesting enough.

Unfortunately, the end of the game is where things start to fall apart. While the exploration remains strong, combat become much more of a slog; enemies gradually gain more HP and become mostly immune to your powerful insta-kill attacks that you've invested in, and you party's damage output doesn't really rise enough to match it.

Some can charm or sleep your party members with little chance to resist and very few powers that can remove these conditions, causing many irritating lost turns. Others will immediately open a battle with an area attack that KO's your weaker party members before they can act. These setbacks, while often not enough to cause you to lose the battle, mostly just cause them to drag out needlessly and grow boring.

That's a shame, because the game makes a great first impression, but the late game fighting really hurts it and the story, while charming in a folklore-ish way, isn't enough to keep me invested.
 
Grimshackle
0
38 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
2
Recommand√©
3.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 avril 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Einleitung

Mit Operencia: The Stolen Sun haben wir eine kleine Rollenspielperle vor uns. Es handelt sich um einen Dungeon Crawler. Statt eine offenen 3D Welt gibt ein 2D Raster mit vorgefertigten Laufwegen und einzeln abzuschlie√üenden Dungeons. Bei der Rollenspiel typischen Story gilt es das B√∂se in Form von Unterweltmonstern zu besiegen. Die Drachen der Zwischenwelt wollten einen Platz an der Sonne, wurde aber zur√ºckgeschlagen. Und wie der Titel es schon andeutet ...

Gameplay

Das Spiel beginnt mit einem kurzen Tutorial, in dem vor allem die Kampfsteuerung genau erkl√§rt wird. Schwer w√§re die Bedienung aber auch ohne Tutorial nicht. Wichtiger dabei ist allerdings, das vermittelte Grundwissen zur Story von Operencia. Man sieht hier mal wieder, fr√ºher war halt doch alles besser!

Nach den ersten leichten K√§mpfen gilt es einen Charakter zu erstellen. Zwar gibt es nicht viele verschiedene Klassen, durch kleine Boni aufgrund der Herkunft unseres Recken sollte man allerdings acht geben, dass die gew√§hlte Klasse auch zu den Bonuswerten passt. Ein Krieger muss schlie√ülich zuschlagen k√∂nnen, Intelligenz wird hierf√ºr nicht so sehr gebraucht. Optisch l√§sst sich der eigene Recke jedoch nicht anpassen. Zu sehen bekommt man ihn oder sie, im Spiel ja eh nicht. Weitere K√§mpfer sto√üen dann im Laufe des Spiels zur Gruppe und st√§rken so die Kampfkraft, zus√§tzlich gibt es Storyinfos und Hintergrundgeschichten zu den Personen.

Lest euch die Einstellungen zum Schwierigkeitsgrad genau durch, diese k√∂nnen nicht mehr ge√§ndert werden, machen aber einen sehr gro√üen Unterschied!

Anfangs mag das umherlaufen in vorgegeben Pfaden etwas seltsam sein, ich selbst bin gerne gegen Pfeiler gelaufen, mit der Zeit gew√∂hnt man sich aber an alles. Bevor es zu einem Kampf kommt, macht es einen Unterschied, ob ihr euren Gegner √ºberrascht, dies gibt einen kleinen Bonus im Kampf, oder ob er euch von hinten attackiert. Das macht es f√ºr euch dann etwas schwerer. Im Kampf gibt es die klassische Unterteilung von Angriffen und z.B. Unterst√ºtzungszaubern und Tr√§nken. Alle Aktionen richten sich entweder gegen einen Gegner oder Mitstreiter oder nur gegen einen. Wichtig ist hier noch, dass es drei Entfernungsebenen gibt.

Die Dungeons sind sehr unterschiedlich gestaltet und sind nicht nur mit vielen R√§tzeln und Geheimg√§ngen gespickt, es gibt auch ne Menge zu Pl√ºndern. Gefundene Ausr√ºstung kann entweder per Hand oder automatisch ausger√ºstet werden. Und nun will ich euch nicht mehr mit schn√∂den Details bel√§stigen, genie√üt einfach die sch√∂ne Geschichte.

Kurzinfo

Positiv
+ sch√∂ne Story
+ einfach aber umfangreich erz√§hlt
+ gutes Kampfsystem
+ eine Welt in der die Realit√§t mit der Fantasie kollidiert

Negativ
- leider keine deutsche Sprachausgabe
- etwas wenig Ausr√ºstung

Wertung
  • Musik/Sound: 7/10
    Technisch kann Operencia nicht mit den Gro√üen des Genres mithalten, es bewegt sich aber auf einem guten Niveau.
  • Grafik 6/10
    F√ºr die Optik gilt dasselbe wie f√ºr Sound und Musik, es gibt bessere. Die Texturen sind allerdings etwas matschig und detailarm.
  • Spielspa√ü 7/10
    Operencia ist ein grundsolides Rollenspiel mit kleinen technischen Schw√§chen aber eine guten und spannend erz√§hlten Story.

Prolog und Charaktererstellungl:
Vid√©o YouTube‚Ñ¢: Story/Prolog und Charaktererstellung - Let's Play - Operencia 01/01 [Gameplay Deutsch/German] 
Vues : 231
Im Video: Story/Prolog und Charaktererstellung! Version: 1.3.0 Bei Operencia: The Stolen Sun handelt es sich um einen klassischen First-Person-Dungeon-Crawler im Stil von Wizardry, The Bards Tale...

Fazit

Wer auf der Suche nach einem einfachen aber sch√∂nen Rollenspiel, ich habe mich voll an "Might and Magic 4: Clouds of Xeen" erinnert gef√ºhlt. Und ja, das war 1992... Findet bei Operencia: The Stolen Sun jede Menge Rollenspielfutter. Von mir gibt es auf jeden Fall einen Daumen nach oben.

Kleiner Tipp

Es ist immer ratsam ein paar Holzscheite dabei zu haben. Ohne diese ist keine Rast und somit auch keine Erholung m√∂glich. Auch solltet ihr immer mal gegen die ein oder andere Wand laufen. Manch eine k√∂nnte sich als Illusion herrausstellen.

Review Info!
  • Testzeit: ca. 4 Stunden
  • Version: 1.3.0
Mir sind weder Bugs aufgefallen noch kam es zu Spielabst√ºrzen.

Hat dir diese Review gefallen? Dann zeig es doch mit einem Like oder einem Kommentar. Mehr Reviews wie dieses findest du auf unserer Kuratorenseite.

28 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1
Recommand√©
17.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 13 juillet 2020
I am about 11 hours into the game and have been enjoying it so far. If you enjoy dungeon crawlers like Legend of Grimrock, Wizardry and similar titles there is very little reason to not pick up this game. It "feels" short so maybe try to get it on sale.

Great quality of life information:

The game allows you to reset all your skill points and stat points at any point to try new things. Talent trees and everything can be swapped around and redone at any time and any place outside of combat.

Early into the game you get the ability to fast travel to any map or area you have been to before. This allows you to not have to get too concerned about making sure you have every nook and cranny checked for secrets on the way through. FYI: Some secrets require later items to gain access to.

Biggest thumbs down so far for me:

A large portion of the enemies in the game can summon minions. The minions act as soon as they are summoned which means there is no lost "action economy" for the creature. He uses his action to summon and the summon immediately acts. You do not get extra experience, loot or gold for killing summoned monsters.

Sometimes a normal pack turns into a long boring drawn out battle because the summoned creatures use skills to protect their summoner. Which means you need to try to kill the monster faster than they can summon. This can get very tedious and I only had it happen a total of 3-4 times in the 11 hours. Every time it did happen just took me out of so much that I can basically remember each time.

That's all I really have to say. Thanks!

 
LordsBreed
0
32 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
2
Recommand√©
67.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 juillet 2021
I am happy to give Operencia: The stolen sun the thumbs up. I thoroughly enjoyed the story, which is loosely based on Hungarian/Slavic folklore, and the challenging puzzles and fights. That being said, Operencia is not a game for everyone, so let's dive into the good and bad and see what's up with it.

The GOOD:

1. The Story and the world - the story is great, with voice-acted dialogue and very high stakes. The Sun is gone and it's down to our motley crew of heroes from all walks of life - from peasants and thieves to knights and demi-gods to go and find it. Along the way they will face a variety of challenges and fights which will really test their mettle. The maps are beautifully crafted, colorful and detailed, as well as pretty big and full of secrets, puzzles, and hidden things, which demand careful and prolonged exploration. Enemies lurk everywhere - so be careful and try to surprise them - or be surprised yourself! And about that...

2. The Combat - the combat is extremely engaging and should not be taken lightly as it is extremely challenging as well. Tactical thinking and party composition is paramount here unless you want endless amounts of frustration during your gameplay. As the adventure progresses, you will have 4 main + 3 extra heroes to swap in and out between fights which is absolutely required. The developers created a number of different areas which demand that you rotate your roster - as you will find that some of your heroes do better than others on various maps. And about that...

3. The Heroes and their abilities - I am in love with the fact that instead of classes, you have 6 companions that you can find, each of them with different skills and then you have 3 archetypes for your main protagonist to choose from (Warrior, Hunter, Mage), also with their own abilities. While the basic Melee-Ranged-Spellcaster system is still in effect, the heroes you are given will keep you tinkering with their skills for a good long time. And about that...

4. RE-SPEC!!! - no, RE-SPECT to the devs who, while making the combat extremely challenging, allowed us to re-specialize the heroes - BOTH SKILLS AND STATS (!!!) at will and at any point of the game. This is so good and so liberating,

5. The puzzles - the puzzles are creative and interesting, with sufficient amount of challenge. Additionally, the devs actually encourage backtracking and revisiting areas that you have already completed (usually to a certain extent). You can be sure I will talk about this some more soon...

The BAD:

1. The MAPS - while I enjoyed the exploration aspect of the game, I cannot say I enjoyed the huge amount of backtracking involved. The ability to leave notes on the map was sorely needed, as sadly, I was forced to resort to online guides to remind myself where what was on the next play session - especially if you want a completionist playthrough.

2. The Puzzles - some puzzles are a clear exercise in frustration until you discover the patterns AND get used to the game movement as you might find yourself stepping a tile too short or a tile too far and botching the whole thing.

3. Replayability - while starting with another Hero class might sound enticing, be aware that everything in the game is static and there is no randomized loot. You will always find a specific item in the same spot in each consecutive playthrough.

4. More Heroes and rebalancing - Get this, unless you start as a Mage, you will not find another decent nuker in the game. Some heroes come close if you spec in Intelligence, but not close enough to satisfy your elemental damage needs. A second nuker close to the Mage in abilities was sorely needed. Also, I am somewhat underwhelmed by the Hunter protagonist, as I felt Sebastian was better in almost every aspect - but it could be down to me not speccing him right. more testing is needed...

NOTE: I saw many people having issues with framerate drops, bugs, etc... I had none, probably because the game has been sufficiently patched during the last year, and in all fairness, I do have a relatively beefy laptop.

Conclusion:

At 50-60% off, as the game usually goes nowadays when on sale (10‚Ç¨) it is a great buy. You can expect to triple or quadruple your money in gameplay hours, which is greatly appreciated. While I had my fair share of emotions with the game - ranging from appreciation to flat out raging at the infuriating aspects of it, the game kept me coming back for more and that's a good thing in my book. While in my opinion, it embraces the notion that "a hard-earned victory is way sweeter" a bit too tightly, it is still a very solid game with great visuals, engaging story and interesting combat. I felt thoroughly entertained. Damn my girl knows me too well to get me this game...

All that taken into consideration I am issuing Operencia: The Stolen Sun the following verdict:

7/10

Follow Masafors Group of Friends, if you want to read more reviews like this one in English, German, French or Belgian Dutch.
 
DG Dobrev

√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 octobre 2020
Operencia embarque le joueur dans un monde fantastique, √† travers des environnements vari√©s, color√©s et r√©ussis.

Apr√®s avoir choisi sa classe de personnage et ses caract√©ristiques, le joueur d√©couvre cet univers via un d√©placement qui se fait case par case, en vue √† la 1√®re personne. Une vue que l'on peut orienter autour de nous comme on le souhaite et ainsi observer le monde qui nous entoure, ou d√©couvrir certains secrets, comme un objet, un interrupteur discret, ou encore un passage cach√©...
Une agr√©able bande son et un doublage de qualit√©. Les illustrations qui ponctuent l'histoire sont magnifiques.

Des puzzles et √©nigmes sont √† r√©soudre tout au long de l'aventure. L'exp√©rience nous permet de faire √©voluer les personnages de notre groupe, des personnages que l'on d√©couvre progressivement dans le jeu. A chaque gain de niveau, des points sont √† partager entre diff√©rents attributs ou comp√©tences.
Plusieurs niveaux de difficult√© sont propos√©s, √† travers 4 param√®tres de jeu que l'on peut d√©finir sur un mode difficile ou non. N'h√©sitez pas √† en r√©gler 2 sur "difficile" d√®s le d√©but si vous souhaitez obtenir tous les succ√®s, l'un d'eux n√©cessitant de finir le jeu avec 2 param√®tres d√©finis sur difficile. Autrement, vous devrez recommencer le jeu pour d√©bloquer ce seul succ√®s.

Les combats sont en tour par tour, face √† des ennemis qui n√©cessitent de bien pr√©parer son groupe, son √©quipement, ses potions et ses comp√©tences. Les combats ne sont pas gagn√©s d'avance et c'est une bonne chose, cela implique de bien r√©fl√©chir √† la formation du groupe selon les ennemis que l'on affronte.

Une tr√®s bonne dur√©e de vie, j'ai termin√© mon aventure apr√®s environ 37 heures de jeu, en ayant vaincu chaque ennemi, perc√© tous ses myst√®res, d√©couvert l'ensemble des tr√©sors et d√©bloqu√© toutes les recettes du jeu. Il n'est pas n√©cessaire de tout accomplir dans le jeu pour le terminer, mais le joueur a tout int√©r√™t √† le faire afin de faire √©voluer au maximum ses personnages et appr√©hender au mieux les combats. Le jeu motive d'ailleurs le joueur dans ce sens, puisqu'√† travers les feux de camps diss√©min√©s un peu partout dans monde, il est possible de voyager vers des zones d√©j√† explor√©es. De plus, certains secrets ne peuvent justement √™tre d√©couverts qu'apr√®s avoir d√©bloqu√© certains art√©facts.
Une mise √† jour r√©cente et gratuite a ajout√© un mode VR au jeu. C'est une r√©ussite, l'immersion n'en est que renforc√©e et l'interface est parfaitement int√©gr√©e.

Operencia est un excellent dungeon crawler qui offre un certain challenge et propose une histoire int√©ressante √† suivre. A d√©couvrir, que l'on soit nostalgique du genre ou non.

Non recommand√©
8.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 aout 2020
As someone who loves grid crawlers in the vein of the early Might and Magic games, something about this one just failed to grab me. The more I attempted to give the game a chance to draw me in, the more it would push me out...
The characters would quip at me one too many times...
The combat just felt off...
The music was bland and repetitive...
I had to pixel hunt for one more secret lever than I wanted to...

It continued on this way until I found myself just not very interested in turning the game back on. It is a shame because everything says I should enjoy this game but I just didn't.
 
Vejita

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
3
Non recommand√©
9.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 janvier 2021
A great game held back by a major oversight.

I played the demo for this game and really enjoyed it, the perspective, intreresting puzzles and exploration were great. The fights were a bit tough but I imagined I would be able to revisit this area and grind some levels before heading to the next.

And there is the major flaw in this game, you cannot grind, you will always be a low level because there is no way to build up your character. And if you happen to miss any encounters for XP in the game you'll end up like me stuck in an empty dungeon except for a boss I'm under leveled for with no way to advance.


 
Jester

Wer sich wundert, warum Einzelspielertitel eine Verbindung ins Internet und damit Firewallfreigaben ben√∂tigen, bekommt hier die Antwort.

Das Review selbst ist kurz, aber mit einigen Codebeispielen zwecks Verst√§ndnis angereichert, sodass sich jeder ein eigenes Bild von dem Titel machen kann.

# Edit 04.04.2020:
Dem Entwicklerfeedback nach ist alles in Ordnung und sie beharren auf Anonymit√§t und Sicherheit trotz widerlegten Fakten. Das Gute dabei ist, dass eine Diskussion stattfindet. Das Schlechte? Dass noch nicht ganz durchgesickert ist, dass sie nachbessern m√ºssen.

Wem f√§llt hier etwas auf? Richtig! F√ºr ein "s" hinter dem Http scheint das Budget von Epic Games wohl nicht mehr gereicht zu haben. Unsere Daten gehen ohne SSL Verschl√ºsselung auf Reisen \^.^/

Unencrypted data mining 
Cr√©ation de la communaut√© pour Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : „Éö„É≥„ÇÆ„É≥
Links to reviews below the comment box


Eula
Eine Eula und damit verbundene Datenschutzerkl√§rung gibt es nur in englischer Sprache auf der Produktseite in Steam. Insbesondere der nichts sagende Punkt 3.

Alternativ gibt es eine detaillierte Version auf der Webseite von Zen Studios Ltd.[blog.zenstudios.com]

Was steckt denn nun drin im Spiel?
Livetracking oder wenn man so will eine Kamera, die einen auf Schritt und Tritt verfolgt und jede Spieleraktion und Fortschritt aufzeichnet. Mitsamt einmaligen Identifier, wie einer NutzerID und Ger√§teID. Weitere Werte sind z.b. Levelids, Itemnamen, Kampfids, Zeitstempel und einige weitere Dinge. Spieler sind komplett gl√§sern.

Werte sind durch entnommene Trackingdaten ersichtlich. Schwer ist es f√ºr Operencia nicht. Selbst Unerfahrene k√∂nnen hier sehen was von Statten geht ;]

Codebeispiele und Kurzbeschreibung

Headerbeispiel
POST /1/ HTTP/1.1 Host wt.zenstudios.com URL http://wt.zenstudios.com/1/ Accept */* Accept-Encoding deflate, gzip User-Agent X-UnrealEngine-Agent Content-Type application/json Content-Length 333 Connection keep-alive Remote Address wt.zenstudios.com/94.130.71.66:80 und Response HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: nginx Date: Thu, 02 Apr 2020 00:48:08 GMT Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Transfer-Encoding: chunked X-Powered-By: PHP/5.6.30-0+deb8u1

Das Spiel startet - erstmal werden Hard,- Softwaredaten mit eindeutigen Identifier vom Spieler abzockt ;]

So wirklich passen die Werte zwar nicht, aber gut, will mich nicht beklagen.

Fazit
Der Dienst aktiviert sich nat√ºrlich in jeder Spielsitzung und sammelt unerm√ºdlich neben Daten auch noch eine Menge Hintergrundtraffic an.

Immerhin gibt es bei der Steamversion von Operencia: The Stolen Sun nicht noch die Schn√ºffelei des Epic Game Launcher als Bonus mit dazu

--

Wer in Ruhe zocken will ohne sich um derlei Kram Gedanken zu machen kann wahlweise die Ipv4 Adresse inkl. hostnamen bei Bedarf und zum Schutz eigener Privatsph√§re w√§hrend des Spielens blockieren. Die Funktionalit√§t des Produktes wird dadurch nicht beeintr√§chtigt.
 
„Éö„É≥„ÇÆ„É≥
5,901 produits enregistr√©s
0
84 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
5 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
13.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 avril 2020
Review by Gaming Masterpieces - The greatest games of all time on Steam.

Is this game a masterpiece? YES. At least for fans of classic dungeon crawler RPGs like me.

One of the most influential gaming experiences for me was Interplay's Bard's Tale: Tales of the Unknown from the mid-80s. It introduced me to the RPG genre and provided me with endless hours of fun. Operencia is the first game that evokes a similar feeling in me again, 35 years later. It is a dungeon crawler with tile-based movement and turn-based combat. Like Bard's Tale was. The only striking difference is the quality of the graphics. Operencia is gorgeous. And, contrary to Bard's Tale, your mouse allows you to look around freely and interact with hotspots. Additionally many QoL improvements make the whole experience more casual. For example, you don't need to draw your own map on graph paper anymore, there is an automap. The game is saved easier, not only when you reach the Adventurer's Guild. If you prefer it the old way, you can turn off the minimap & the objective markers and then turn on permadeath. I like a challenge, but this is a bit too hardcore for me.

After creating your character out of 3 classes you begin your adventure in a cursed underwater castle where you find the first (of 6 possible) of your additional party members, an old thief who was just robbed. He writes a journal of your adventure, which you can read anytime. There is also a guide available, detailling stuff you discovered and new gameplay mechanics. Quite helpful if you don't want to write down everything. And there is a LOT of lore in the game. I would not recommend the game to anyone who hates reading. Character management offers you an equipment screen, one for your talents, one for your skills, one for your attributes. Quite complex, while the character creation of your main character was ok but not of Baldur's Gate complexity.

You manage your whole party, but your main character is a young hero/heroine who had a recurring dream and sets off to adventure just because of this. Quite an idiot, if you ask me. The other characters comment on the story or your decisions or make fun of you, but you decide on their equipment, upgrades and of course you give them orders during the fights. Fights are turn-based with the usual options, like attack, defend, use spells, skills or equipment.

The party can be healed when resting at campfires spread over the gameworld (even in a wet underwater castle...) as long as you have found a bit of firewood before. You can also save your game at a campfire, and there is an auto-save at certain moments during gameplay. The gameworld is big, besides the country of Operencia there is also the Underworld and an Upper World. To advance you have to find and solve puzzles, from pulling levers or finding keys to some more advanced ones. The first puzzle for example consists of moving mirrors to seal an exit of the Underworld.

The production values are rather high, apart from the stunning graphic you get to see many cutscenes, there is a lot of voice-acting through the game, my ultrawidescreen monitor shows the game in perfect 1440x3440 with 144 Hz, if you don't want to play with m+kb you can also use a controller.
Loving the details 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : svenevil

Conclusion:
Best Bard's Tale inspired dungeon crawler RPG available at the moment.

Ë≥ºÂÖ•„ÇíÊ§úË®é„Åó„Å¶„ÇÇËâØ„ÅÑ„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
 
Meat Man
810 produits enregistr√©s
0
38 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
2
Non recommand√©
8.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 septembre 2020
The best I can describe this game is "cargo cult dungeon crawler": the developers wanted to make a plane (an old-school first-person turn-based RPG) but only had the knowledge of working with straw (mobile ARPG tropes). The result flies just as well as you would expect a straw plane to fly.
For example, the developers apparently heard that a dungeon crawler should have puzzles, and even made some effort to make puzzle designs visually and mechanically varied. But all this effort goes to waste because of how easy puzzles are: most of the times you are told explicitly which item is needed for a particular puzzle, and even when you're not, the game is so linear that you rarely have more than two possibilities to exhaust. The result is that instead of puzzles (proper dungeon crawler design) you get fetch quests (mobile ARPG design). And if that wasn't enough to kill exploration completely, they landed a final blow by introducing quest markers and incessant party chatting to ruin the pacing.
A similar fate befell combat and character building. You get the classic melee/ranged rows, but they're meaningless because any weapon or spell can hit any row, only with somewhat different efficiency. Instead of fast-paced combat based around attrition and resource management, you get the rote MMO setup where everyone is a mage - i.e. has a small set of active abilities limited by cooldowns - and each round you just use whichever ability has returned from cooldown without much thought. On the upside, HP and energy don't regenerate on their own and you need limited camping supplies to rest, but on the downside, there are just too many of them strewn around the levels. Oh, and they are the only resource to manage since the game doesn't have consumables.
Yes you heard right - there are no consumables in the game. Instead, potions take the form of "skills" that can be used a limited number of times between rests. I'm in two minds about this mechanic. On the one hand, the potion brewing system where you have to decipher a recipe by solving a logical puzzle is the one thing I liked about the game. But on the other hand, consumables in RPGs typically serve as a way of compensating for you character's weaknesses - either when you're exploring a level-inappropriate area, or you have built your character improperly. So the lack of consumables means you can't make mistakes when developing your party, especially given that there are no random battles and you can't grind for levels. The developers solution to that? Free respeccing at any time, just like - you guessed it - every run-off-the-mill ARPG. Only while it make sense in ARPGs with their randomized and constantly respawning hordes of enemies, in a dungeon crawler with only fixed battles, it takes all fun out of character development as well.
The sad thing is that the game had potential to be fun if only it had a competent systems designer - the Hungarian folklore that informs the story is interesting, and so is the visual design of the levels. But as it is, it has no meaningful exploration, no meaningful combat tactics, and no meaningful character development. If you're looking for an old-school dungeon crawler with modern visuals, you'll be better served by 7 Mages, Might&Magic: Legacy or Legend of Grimrock 2.
 
zverlibre
3
22 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
2
Recommand√©
2.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 avril 2020
TL:DR; Pretty but unrewarding, slow progression and a game more focused on exploration than combat.


Have to recommend due to:
-Very pretty
-Runs well, no crashes or bugs
-Nice atmospherics for immersion, sounds music voice acting all well done
-Nice lore, using a mix of central european myths and legends adds some good quality and feeling to the background

However, game lacks depth. It's very simplified and there is little to no customization. There is no way to gain xp or gear beyond what you are provided by the very limited number of enemies, and leveling even at level 3 feels slow and unrewarding. It feels like an RPG with training wheels on that is targeted at a younger age group than I was expecting. Difficulty is set at the beginning of the game with no option to change during, so if it feels a bit easy or hard the only way to change this is to start from scratch. Explanations of what some of the buttons or effects do is lacking, eg the 'optimize all' button changes all your equipment to the supposed best fit-out, but doesn't explain why having a second weapon or shield equipped is not optimal (?). Some design choices are odd, such as having enemies move around the map in real time, going so far as running after the player if spotted, however all player movement and combat is grid and turn based.
 
Mdage
0
21 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0

11.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 mai 2020

–ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–µ, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞—Ç—è–Ω—É—Ç–æ–µ.

–ó–∞–≥–ª—è–¥—ã–≤–∞–π –≤ –ª–∞–≥–µ—Ä—å, –±–∞–±—É–ª—è-—Ç–æ—Ä–≥–æ–≤–∫–∞ —É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ø–∞—Å–ª–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ç–µ–±—è –∫–æ–µ-—á—Ç–æ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ...

–ò –≤–Ω–æ–≤—å –Ω–∞–º –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç —Å–ø–∞—Å–∞—Ç—å –º–∏—Ä –æ—Ç –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–æ–π –Ω–∞–ø–∞—Å—Ç–∏
–°—é–∂–µ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–≤–æ—Ä–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –¥–µ–∫–æ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è—Ö —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏, –Ω–∞ –º–æ–π –≤–∑–≥–ª—è–¥, –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –±–∞–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö. –û–≥–æ—Ä—á–∞–µ—Ç –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –±—ã –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø–æ–±—Ä–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å, –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ —Å–æ—é–∑–Ω—ã—Ö –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π (–Ω–µ –∑–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –º—ã –∏–≥—Ä–∞–µ–º, –∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–∏—Ä–∞). –û–Ω–æ, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ, –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –ø–æ –Ω–µ–∏–∑–≤–µ–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º –∑–µ–º–ª—è–º, –∫–∏—à–∞—â–∏–º –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–º–∏, –Ω–æ –≤—Å—ë —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ —á–µ–≥–æ-—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç, —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ –∫–∞–∫ –∏ —Ä–µ–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–∞. –í–º–µ—Å—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –º—ã –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ–º –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω—å–æ–Ω–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –æ—Ç –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –≤—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç —Å–≤–æ—ë —Å–ª–æ–≤—Ü–æ, –±–∞–±—É–ª—é-—Ç–æ—Ä–≥–æ–≤–∫—É, –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞—é—â—É—é –Ω–∞–º –∫—É–ø–∏—Ç—å –±–µ–∑–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ü—ã, —Å—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–µ –≤–µ—â–∏, –∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –∫–æ—Ä–∏–¥–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–π –º–∏—Ä, –ø—É—Å—Ç—å –≤ –Ω—ë–º –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç—ã: –æ—Ç –∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–∫–æ–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–π –∑–∞–≥–∞–¥–æ–∫.

–õ–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Å –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–æ–π –µ—ë –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–º–∞—Å–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å
–ù–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫ –Ω–∞–º –±—É–¥—É—Ç –ø—Ä–∏—Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ—é–∑–Ω–∏–∫–∏, –æ–±–ª–∞–¥–∞—é—â–∏–µ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º–∏ –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–∞–º–∏, –Ω–æ –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤–∞–º –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –±–∏–ª–¥, —Ç–æ –µ–≥–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å: –¥–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∫–Ω–æ–ø–∫–∞ "–ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª", –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—â–∞—è –≤—ã–±–∏—Ä–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –ª—é–±—É—é —Ç–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É. –ê –µ—ë –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –±–ª–∏–∂–µ –∫ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–¥—ë—Ç—Å—è –º–µ–Ω—è—Ç—å –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –æ–¥–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –Ω–µ—É—è–∑–≤–∏–º—ã –∫ –æ–≥–Ω—é, –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ –∫ —Ö–æ–ª–æ–¥—É, —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–∏ –∫ —è–¥—É, –∞ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ –∑–∞–∫–ª–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞–Ω–æ—Å—è—Ç —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏—á–Ω—ã–π —É—Ä–æ–Ω, –∏ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É –ø—Ä–∏ –Ω–µ—Ä–∞–∑—É–º–Ω–æ–º –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤—Ö–æ–ª–æ—Å—Ç—É—é.
–ù–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –≤—ã –¥–æ–≥–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç–µ—Å—å, —ç—Ç–æ —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ —Ä–æ–ª–µ–≤–æ–π –æ—Ç—ã–≥—Ä—ã—à. –ó–¥–µ—Å—å –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∑–∞ –≤–∞—Å –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ —Ç–æ—Ç, –∑–∞ –∫–æ–≥–æ –≤—ã –∏–≥—Ä–∞–µ—Ç–µ - –º–µ–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∑–∞–∫–ª–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è/—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã/–≤–Ω–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–ª–∏ –ª—É—á–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –∏ —Ö–æ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ –ø–æ—è–≤–∏–ª—Å—è –º–∞–≥, –ø—Ä–∏–¥—ë—Ç—Å—è –∂–¥–∞—Ç—å –¥–æ–±—Ä—É—é –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω—É –∏–≥—Ä—ã. –ù–µ—Ç –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å —Ä–µ–ø–ª–∏–∫–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –º–∞–Ω–µ—Ä—É –ø–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è - –º—ã –∏–¥—ë–º –≤–¥–æ–ª—å —É–∂–µ –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –≤—Å—ë —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—é.

–ù–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∫–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã
–•–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –∫–ª–µ—Ç–æ—á–∫–∞–º –≤ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –º–∏–Ω—É—Ç—ã –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–µ—Å–∫—É—Ä–∞–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç, –Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –∫ –Ω–µ–º—É –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã–∫–∞–µ—à—å –∏ –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∏–≤–∞–µ—à—å —É–¥–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–æ. –° –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã, —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–∞, –Ω–æ —Å –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π, –¥–∞—ë—Ç –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –†–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–æ–∫, –ø–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ–π —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏, –±–∞–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ "–∫–Ω–æ–ø–æ—á–Ω–æ–π" –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∫–µ (–Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –≤—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –Ω—É–∂–Ω—ã–µ –ø–ª–∏—Ç—ã/–Ω–∞–∂–∞—Ç—å –∫–Ω–æ–ø–æ—á–∫–∏ –≤ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–∫–µ) –∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–µ —á–µ–≥–æ-—Ç–æ —Å–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–≥–æ - –∫–∞–∫ —Ä—ã—á–∞–≥–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—ã, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å—Ç–µ–Ω –ø–æ–¥ —Å–≤–µ—Ç–æ–º –º–∞–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–æ–Ω–∞—Ä–∏–∫–∞. –í—Å–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –≤ –º–µ—Ä—É –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã –∏ —Ä–µ—à–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –µ—Å–ª–∏ –Ω–µ —Å –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ, —Ç–æ —Å–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–∑–∞ —Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ, –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–¥—ë—Ç—Å—è —á–∞—Å–∞–º–∏ –ª–æ–º–∞—Ç—å –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤—É –Ω–∞–¥ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º. –ë–æ–∏ —á–µ–º-—Ç–æ –Ω–∞–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞—é—Ç Heroes of Might and Magic, –Ω–æ –±–µ–∑ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–µ, –¥—É–º–∞—é, —Ç—É—Ç —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å —á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ. –°–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–µ–º –æ–Ω–∏ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–¥–æ–µ–¥–∞—é—Ç, –Ω–∞ —Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω: –æ–¥–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–∏–µ, –±–∞–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –Ω–µ–≤–µ–∑–µ–Ω–∏–µ (–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ–ø–∞—Å—Ç—å 95%, –∏ –≤—ã —Ç—Ä–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–∞ –ø–æ–¥—Ä—è–¥ –ø—Ä–æ–º–∞—Ö–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç–µ—Å—å), –æ–±–∏–ª–∏–µ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ –≤ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –º–µ—Å—Ç–µ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—ã, –Ω–µ –¥–∞—é—â–µ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ—Ö–Ω—É—Ç—å, –¥–∞–ª–µ–∫–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –±–ª–∏–∂–∞–π—à–∏–π –ª–∞–≥–µ—Ä—å. –ù–æ –Ω–µ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∞ –±—ã, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ç –≤–ø–µ—á–∞—Ç–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ.

–û–±—â–µ–µ –≤–ø–µ—á–∞—Ç–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ
–õ—é–±–æ–ø—ã—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç, –≤ –º–µ—Ä—É –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –∫–∞–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π, –≤ –º–µ—Ä—É –ø—Ä–∏—Ç—è–≥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π. –ú–∏–Ω—É—Å—ã –Ω–µ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç—è—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –Ω–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –∑–∞–º–µ—á–∞–Ω–∏–µ: —ç—Ç–∞ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ —Ä–æ–ª–µ–≤—É—é. –ó–¥–µ—Å—å –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç, —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–∫–∏, –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∞ –∏ —Å—Ç–∏–ª—å –∏–≥—Ä—ã - –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –ª–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –Ω–µ—Ç –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å –ø—É—Ç—å, –∞ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —Ä–µ–∏–≥—Ä–∞–±–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –∏ –Ω–µ –ø–∞—Ö–Ω–µ—Ç. –û–Ω–∞ –∏ –Ω–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–æ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–∞, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤—Å—ë —Ä–∞—Å—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–æ –Ω–∞ 30 —á–∞—Å–æ–≤.. –Ω–æ, –Ω–∞ –º–æ–π –≤–∫—É—Å, –¥–ª—è –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ —ç—Ç–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–æ.

–ü–ª—é—Å—ã:
+ –≤—Å—ë —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω–æ –¥–æ–±—Ä–æ—Ç–Ω–æ;
+ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–µ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ (–ø–æ–¥–∑–µ–º–µ–ª—å—è, –∑–∞–º–∫–∏, –ª–µ—Å–∞ etc.);
+ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏;
+ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–æ–∫ –∏ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–æ–≤, –≤ –º–µ—Ä—É –ª—ë–≥–∫–∏—Ö - –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –ª–µ–∑—Ç—å –Ω–∞ —Ñ–æ—Ä—É–º—ã;
+ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã –∏ –Ω–∞–≤—ã–∫–∏ –≥–µ—Ä–æ–µ–≤.

–ù–µ–π—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç—ã:
~ —è—Ä–∫–∞—è –∏ —Å–æ—á–Ω–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ - –∫–æ–º—É-—Ç–æ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è, —É –∫–æ–≥–æ-—Ç–æ –æ—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–æ–≥–æ –±—É–¥—É—Ç —É—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –≥–ª–∞–∑–∞;
~ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∑–≤—É–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ—Ç–µ, –Ω–æ –≤–æ—Ç —Å–∞–º –æ–Ω –±–µ–∑–ª–∏–∫ –∏ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è;
~ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è, –Ω–æ –±—ã–ª –æ–¥–∏–Ω –≤—ã–ª–µ—Ç.

–ú–∏–Ω—É—Å—ã:
- –æ—Ç–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ –Ω–∞ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π;
- –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ–µ –æ—Ç—Å—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ –Ω–µ–ª–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏;
- –æ–¥–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞;
- –±–æ–∏ —Å–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–µ–º —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—è—Ç—Å—è —Å–∫—É—á–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–¥—Ä–∞–∂–∞—é—â–∏–º–∏;
- –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –±–µ—Å–ø–æ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ª—É—Ç–∞.

–ò—Ç–æ–≥: –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –∑–∞—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è, –Ω–æ –≤—Å—ë –∂–µ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –æ–ø—ã—Ç –Ω–µ –¥–ª—è –≤—Å–µ—Ö. –í –Ω–µ–π –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–ª—é—Å–æ–≤, –Ω–æ –∏ –º–∏–Ω—É—Å–æ–≤ –Ω–µ–º–∞–ª–æ, —Ç–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–Ω–æ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É. –ë—É–¥–µ—Ç –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞ —Ç–µ–º, –∫—Ç–æ —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—á–∞—Ç—å —Å –∫–∞–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –∏–≥—Ä—ã –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Å –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–æ–º –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º.

–ö–æ–º—É –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è: –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º —Ñ—ç–Ω—Ç–µ–∑–∏ –∏ –ø–æ—à–∞–≥–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∏–≥—Ä.
 
ethersy

52.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 avril 2020
Operencia es un excelente tributo a los cl√°sicos dungeon crawlers de anta√±o y una compra obligada para fans del g√©nero.
A diferencia de la mayor√≠a de otros juegos de √©ste tipo (Eye of Beholder, Dungeon Master, Legend of Grimrock, etc), Operencia tiene una gran √©nfasis en historia y di√°logos como ning√∫n otro, teniendo un gran trasfondo en sus protagonistas y mundo, inspirado en mitolog√≠a de Europa Central especialmente leyendas h√∫ngaras. Pero por supuesto no faltan los combates, mucha exploraci√≥n y puzzles que cualquier habituado a √©ste tipo de juegos ya deber√≠a estar acostumbrado.

Pros:
- Excelentes gr√°ficos y ambientaci√≥n. Excelente dise√±o art√≠stico representando muy bien cuevas, bosques, r√≠os, etc, y dise√±o variado de enemigos.
- Toda l√≠nea de di√°logo tiene voces, incluso di√°logos en combate e incluye un narrador externo para situaciones especiales. Excelente calidad en sus voces.
- El escrito est√° muy bien hecho, siendo bastante carism√°tico, alegre y un poco c√≥mico por momentos.
- Excelente OST. Acompa√±a muy bien a la atm√≥sfera de √©ste juego, tranquilo y relajado, adem√°s de los muy buenos sonidos de ambiente en los diferentes biomas.
- Incorpora una caldera, d√≥nde preparas pociones y dem√°s gracias a recetas que vas encontrando, que funciona como una clase de minijuego y puzzle pues tratas de colocar los ingredientes correctos d√≥nde correspondan.
- El combate es por turnos. Aquellos que busquen combate en tiempo real como Grimrock, Eye of Beholder y otros, deber√≠an pasar por alto √©ste juego. Tiene magias/habilidades que dan mejoras al party, ataques a grupos enteros o debilitan al enemigo. Nada especial pero encajan muy bien ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• el mundo de Operencia.
- Puedes mover la c√°mara libremente en cualquier direcci√≥n, a diferencia de la cl√°sica c√°mara fija para adelante en el g√©nero.
- Personalizaci√≥n de la dificultad. Puedes quitar el automapa y jugarlo sin √©l (¬°como en los viejos tiempos!), limitar el salvado de partidas, dificultad de los enemigos y muerte permanente.

Neutral (√©sto depender√° de la tolerancia del jugador):
- Hay algunas zonas o puzzles que no puedes resolver en el momento o en √©se lugar, y tienes que volver atr√°s despu√©s de avanzar a otro mapa, una vez que hayas conseguido la habilidad o el √≠tem necesario para resolverlo. √âsto puede resultar molesto para algunos dependiendo de la paciencia que tengan ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• volver sobre sus pasos/lugares anteriores.
- No tiene salvado manual. Las partidas se salvan en las fogatas que est√°n esparcidas por los mapas (equivalentes a los cristales en LoG 2), pero puedes salvar todas las veces que quieras y adem√°s incluye checkpoints en algunas batallas contra jefes o despu√©s de alguna acci√≥n importante, por lo que es bastante flexible (al menos en dificultad Normal).
- Bastante lineal. A pesar de que algunos mapas son grandes y permiten tomar varios caminos diferentes, el juego a veces te fuerza a hacer ciertas acciones en un orden determinado para avanzar en la historia (a diferencia del "mundo abierto" de LoG 2).
- No hay grindeo. O sea una vez que matas a los enemigos, desaparecen para siempre y los mapas quedan vac√≠os, por lo que aquellos que quieran farmear niveles se van sentir decepcionados.

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
- Limitaci√≥n en la creaci√≥n de personajes. Mientras que puedes libremente levear y asignar puntos en habilidades como quieras, s√≥lo tiene 3 ramas de habilidades por personaje ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• algunos hechizos/poderes y aptitudes pasivas. Tampoco tiene pantalla de creaci√≥n de personajes para tu party, ya que exceptuando el protagonista, el resto est√°n prefijados y los tienes que ir encontrado por el mundo de Operencia.

Recomendando para amantes de los dungeon crawlers, que adem√°s de los cl√°sicos elementos de combates, puzzles y exploraci√≥n de √©ste tipo de juegos, quieran una hermosa ambientaci√≥n y una historia correcta pero divertida por momentos. Una compra segura, o por lo menos a precio descontado si les parece un poco alto el precio.

√âsas son mis observaciones hasta ahora en mis pocas horas jugadas, si llego a encontrar m√°s detalles, actualizar√© el an√°lisis.

ACTUALIZACI√ìN: Agregado algunos puntos en neutrales.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 janvier 2021
–ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è –ø–æ—à–∞–≥–æ–≤–∞—è –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–π–Ω–∞—è ¬´–∑–∞—á–∏—Å—Ç–∫–∞ –ø–æ–¥–∑–µ–º–µ–ª–∏–π¬ª –æ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –ª–∏—Ü–∞, –≥–¥–µ —Ç–æ–ª–ø–∞ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ—â–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ –∏–≥—Ä–æ–≤–æ–º—É –º–∏—Ä—É –∫–∞–∫ –µ–¥–∏–Ω–æ–µ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–µ, —ç–¥–∞–∫–∞—è ¬´–∫–∞–ø–ª—è¬ª (–æ—Ç—Å—é–¥–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–æ—è–∑—ã—á–Ω–æ–µ –∂–∞—Ä–≥–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–¥–∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞ ‚Äî Blobber).

Operencia: The Stolen Sun –±–µ—Ä—ë—Ç —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—É—é —Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É–ª—É, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é —É–∂–µ —Å —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–∏ —É—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ Legend of Grimrock –∏ The Bards Tale 4, –∏ –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ –µ—ë —É–ø—Ä–æ—â–∞–µ—Ç. –° –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã, —Ç—É—Ç –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–º–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –∫–ª–µ—Ç–æ—á–∫–∞–º, –∏ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏, –∏ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥—ã, –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–∞–ª—ã —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–ø–∞—Å–æ–≤, –∏ –Ω–∏–∫–∞–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ª–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è. –° –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π ‚Äî –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä–æ—Å –æ—á–∫–æ–≤ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –∏ —É–º–µ–Ω–∏–π, –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ —à—É—Ç—è—â–∏–µ –∏ –±–æ–ª—Ç–∞—é—â–∏–µ –º–µ–∂–¥—É —Å–æ–±–æ–π –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏ –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏ –∫ –∑–∞–≥–∞–¥–∫–∞–º –æ—Ç –Ω–∏—Ö –∂–µ. –í—Å—è Operencia ‚Äî —Ç–∞–∫–∞—è –≤–æ—Ç —Å–º–µ—Å—å –¥—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–µ–π ¬´—Ö–∞—Ä–¥–∫–æ—â–∏–Ω—ã¬ª —Å —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π ¬´–∫–∞–∑—É–∞–ª—å—â–∏–Ω–æ–π¬ª.

–í –∏–≥—Ä–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–µ–Ω—å–∫–∞—è, –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–∞—è —Å–∫–∞–∑–æ—á–Ω–∞—è –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è, –æ–ø–∏—Ä–∞—é—â–∞—è—Å—è –Ω–∞ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∏ –º–∏—Ñ–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–ª–æ—Ä–∏—Ç, —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–Ω–æ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–µ –¥—Ä—É–≥ —Å –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏ —Å —è—Ä–∫–æ–π –æ–∑–≤—É—á–∫–æ–π, –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–∏–µ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏, –∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–µ –≤–∫—Ä–∞–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–∏–¥–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –º–∞–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–¥–º–µ—Ç–æ–≤ —Å –ø–æ–∑–¥–Ω–∏—Ö —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–π –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –≤ –∑–∞–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã–µ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∫–∏ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—ã—Ö. –í–ø—Ä–æ—á–µ–º, —ç—Ç–∏ —ç–ª–µ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –Ω–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞—é—Ç –∏–≥—Ä—É —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π, –∏–≥—Ä–æ–≤–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å –≤—Å—ë —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ –∫—Ä–∞–π–Ω–µ –ª–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω—ã–π.

–†–æ–ª–µ–≤–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞—è, –¥–∞ –∏ —É–ø–æ–º—è–Ω—É—Ç–∞—è –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä–æ—Å–∞ –æ—á–∫–æ–≤ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–µ—Ç –º–µ–Ω—è—Ç—å —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ö–æ—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–º –±–æ–µ–º. –°—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–æ —Ç–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è –≥–ª—É–±–∏–Ω–∞ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞. –í –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∏ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—Ç –∏–∑–¥–µ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞–¥ –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–æ–º –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–º–∏ —Å —Ä–∞–∑–¥—Ä–∞–∂–∞—é—â–∏–º–∏ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏. –¢–æ –≤—ã–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–µ –ø–æ–¥–∫—Ä–µ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–æ–º–±–∏, —Ç–æ –≤—ã—Å–∞—Å—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–µ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—é —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç—ã, —Ç–æ –≤–∑—Ä—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–µ—Å—è —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–º—É—Ö–∏. –î–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å, –∞ –±–µ—Å—é—á–µ—Å—Ç—å. –ù–æ –∑–∞—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è—Ç—å —Å–∏–ª—ã –º–µ–∂–¥—É –ø—Ä–∏–≤–∞–ª–∞–º–∏, –∞ –Ω–µ –±–µ–∑–¥—É–º–Ω–æ –Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –ø–æ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–µ.

–ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ –±–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç —Ñ–µ–µ—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∫–∞–º–∏: –±—Ä–∏–≥–∞–Ω—Ç–∏–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –≤ –±—Ä–æ–Ω—é –Ω–µ–∫–æ–µ–≥–æ –ë—Ä–∏–≥–∞–Ω—Ç–∞, –∞ –∫–∞–º–µ–Ω—â–∏–∫–∏ ‚Äî –≤ –º–∞—Å–æ–Ω–æ–≤, –æ–π-–≤–µ–π. –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ —Ç–µ—Ä–ø–∏–º–∞—è, –º—É–∑—ã–∫–∞ –ø—É—Å—Ç–∞—è.

–ò–≥—Ä—É –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞ —á—Ç–æ —Ä—É–≥–∞—Ç—å –∏ –Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫ —É–∂ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞ —á—Ç–æ —Ö–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ç—å, –Ω–æ —Å–≤–æ—é –ø–æ—Ä—Ü–∏—é —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è Operencia: The Stolen Sun –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç. –¢–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–µ –∂–¥–∏—Ç–µ –æ—Ç –Ω–µ—ë –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π Legend of Grimrock.
 
Nicholas Protey daer Corrax
