ÂÖ¨Âºè„ÅßÊó•Êú¨Ë™ûË®≥„ÅåÂá∫„Åü„Å®„Åó„Å£„Å¶Â§ßÂñú„Å≥„ÅßË≥ºÂÖ•„Åó„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ
Ê©üÊ¢∞ÁøªË®≥„ÇíÂ∞ë„ÅóÊï¥„Åà„ÅüÁ®ãÂ∫¶„ÅÆ„É¨„Éô„É´„ÅßÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„Å´„Åô„Çâ„Å™„Å£„Å¶„Å™„ÅÑ„ÄÇ
„ÅÑ„Å°„ÅÑ„Å°Ëá™ÂàÜ„ÅÆ‰∏≠„ÅßÊÑèË®≥„Åó„Å™„Åè„Å¶„ÅØ„Å™„Çâ„Åö„Éó„É¨„Ç§„Å©„Åì„Çç„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„ÅèÂ§ßÂ§â„Åå„Å£„Åã„Çä„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
ÈñãÁô∫ÂÖÉ„ÅØ„Åì„Çì„Å™„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Çí„ÄåÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„Å´ÂØæÂøú„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Äç„Å®Ë®Ä„ÅÜ„Åπ„Åç„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÄÇ
 
syonbori
0
24 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
2
Non recommand√©
73.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 juin 2021
"Alas, some buried treasure!"

This game starts off in promising fashion with a well put together tutorial that has you playing a party of highly experienced characters through a short adventure so you can get a bit of background to the game and familiarise yourself with the controls and gameplay. You then roll up your own character, choosing from either warrior, hunter or mage classes, and after a short intro, find yourself exploring a mythical sunken castle. You find your first companion quite early in the game and at this point, the game is quite enjoyable. The Hungarian lore of the game is interesting and refreshingly different, combat is well balanced, the level design and hand drawn cut scenes are nice and colourful and wonderful to look at, and the game looks like a well polished product. However, by the time you reach the third main area in the game (the Deva Fortress), the difficulty seems to take a tremendous spike with some ridiculously tough opponents, and you then start really noticing how bad this game's combat mechanics are. I tried two playthroughs, firstly as a warrior and then as a mage. The mage I found could do better AOE damage but was flimsier than a wet paper bag. Regardless, I gave up with both at the Deva Fortress as the combat was just getting too frustrating.

So what's so bad about this game? Mostly it's the combat system (*** MINOR SPOILERS ***).
1. Lack of party formation in combat.
During combat, enemies can stand either right in front of your party, slightly further away, or the furthest possible distance away. Your party can attack any enemy on the screen with melee or missile weapons, but melee weapons are most effective against close enemies, and least effective against the furthest enemies. However enemies can seemingly attack anyone in your party of up to 4 characters without penalty, as your party seems to have no order, so mages cannot take cover behind sturdier fighter types, for example. Also, you cannot close with distant enemies - they just remain where they are.
2. Useless normal attacks.
Your characters' basic melee or missile attacks are really pathetic and do very little damage, so you have to use your special abilities when you want to do decent or AOE damage. The problem is that these have cooldowns and also use up your character's energy points, and these run out really quickly. The only way to restore energy is to either do nothing but defend for a turn (and this also has a cooldown so can only be used every 3 rounds) or else rely on other characters who may have a special ability that restores energy. Conversely, enemies seem to be able to spam their special abilities as they wish and are only restricted by their cooldowns.
3. Broken mechanics.
Your characters seem to miss most of the time even when their chances to hit an enemy are 70% or more, and some special abilities don't seem to work as they should. One companion has an ability which lets them go into stealth mode, yet they still take damage when an enemy performs an AOE attack. What's the point then? Another companion has this ability that lets them shoot a hail of arrows from their bow, and even though the ability description says "it MAY damage other enemies nearby", it only seems to damage 1 or 2 enemies in a group. Also your starting companion has a number of abilities that inflict poison damage yet at least 80% of the enemies in the first few areas are either resistant or immune to poison!
4. Lack of defensive options.
Lack of healing and defensive abilities in combat. The game has a weird potion system where you have to craft potions yourself and each character can only equip one type of potion; eg. you have this healing potion which you craft but you can only craft 2 at a time and only 1 character can equip and use it in combat. Another potion can be used as a bomb but again only 1 character can use it. Why can't I craft a number of healing potions and give them to all the party members to use in combat? Playing as a mage, you have virtually no defensive special abilities you can use - they are for inflicting damage. This makes it difficult to keep weaker characters alive in tougher battles as enemies tend to target the characters with the least hit points.
5. Enemies taunting your party.
Your characters have virtually no chance to resist enemy taunt abilities, so you can have these battles where 1 fighter who can taunt your party stands in front of a group of enemy spellcasters. Fighter taunts your party, and everyone can only target the fighter with their attacks, unless they use an AOE ability. Great fun as the spellcasters at the back then pelt your party with spells.
6. Ridiculous difficulty spikes.
In the third area, there's this frustrating battle which caused me to rage quit the game on two playthroughs. Basically you end up fighting two guys and a stone golem. Both these guys have more health than anyone in your party, are able to heal themselves, do more damage than any of your characters, and can summon more stone golems. The stone golems themselves have massive physical and elemental resistances which means they take about half damage from anyone who attacks them (a normal non-critical melee attack from your warrior will do probably between 4 and 8hp damage to the golem, who has about 150hp, and a fireball from your mage will maybe do about 10 to 15 damage), and an AOE attack which they can use periodically which can knock off about half the hit points of the weaker party members. Defeating them means any summoned golems vanish, but the golem they were originally with remains, and by then, your party is just too decimated to defeat it.

On the plus side, the game has some nice music, immersive ambient sounds, well polished visuals and a wondrous fairy tale feel owing to its rich Hungarian folklore. It's just such a shame that the combat mechanics are so frustrating. Sitting there chipping away at a 150hp stone golem for a couple hp of damage on most of your party's attacks is just no fun when it whacks your entire party with an AOE attack for 20 to 30 damage.
 
MR67
1
14 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
33.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 janvier 2022
"–ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –±–ª–∏–Ω" –¥–ª—è Zen Studios –≤ –†–ü–ì, –∏ —ç—Ç–æ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ —á—É–≤—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç—Å—è. –ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã –Ω–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–æ –∑–Ω–∞–ª–∏, –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—Ç –∫—Ä–∞—É–ª–µ—Ä—ã, –ø–ª—é—Å, —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞–ª–∏, —è–≤–Ω–æ —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤—ã–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª—Å—è –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –Ω–µ—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—ã–º. –û–ø—Ü–∏—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–∫–∞—Ä—Ç—ã, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –µ—Å—Ç—å, –Ω–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ç—å –∏ –±–µ–∑ –Ω–µ—ë. –í—ã –∂–µ, —Ö–∞—Ä–¥–∫–æ—Ä—â–∏–∫–∏, —Ç–∞–∫ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ, –ø—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞? –Ø –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª. –ù–µ—Ç, –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ç—å –±–µ–∑ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–∫–∞—Ä—Ç—ã, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã —è–≤–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –≤—Ö–æ–¥ –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω –±—ã—Ç—å —Ç–∞–º –∂–µ, –≥–¥–µ –∏ –≤—ã—Ö–æ–¥ (–µ—Å–ª–∏, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ –Ω–µ —Ç–µ–ª–µ–ø–∞—Ç). –í—ã–º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–ª –≤—Å—ë, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –∫—É—Å–∫–∏ —è–≤–Ω–æ –Ω–µ —Å–æ–≤–ø–∞–¥–∞–ª–∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥ —Å –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∏–ª –∞–≤—Ç–æ–∫–∞—Ä—Ç—É, –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–∞–∂–∏ –∏–º–µ—é—Ç —Å–æ–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ-–º–µ–Ω–µ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–∫–µ. –ù—É—É, –∫—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç-—Ç–æ?! –ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—É –Ω–µ –≤—ã–∫–ª—é—á–∞–ª.

–ò –≤–æ—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–∞—è –≤–æ—Ç —Ñ–∏–≥–Ω—è –ø–æ–≤—Å—é–¥—É. –ù–∞ –ª—é–±–æ–π –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å "—Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–∫–∏" –≤ –¥—É—Ö–µ –ú–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–∏–¥–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π, –∫—É–¥–∞ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø–∞—Å—Ç—å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∏–º–µ—è –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —É–º–µ–Ω–∏—è, –∏ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ —è–≤–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–º–µ–∫–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –≤–∞–º –ø–æ–Ω–∞–¥–æ–±–∏—Ç—Å—è - –Ω–æ —Å–∫–∞–∂–∏—Ç–µ –º–Ω–µ, –ø—Ä–æ–π–¥—è –ø–æ–ª-–∏–≥—Ä—ã, —è –≤—Å–ø–æ–º–Ω—é, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç—ã –∏ –≥–¥–µ —è –≤–∏–¥–µ–ª? –ú–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—ã –∏ –≤–µ—â–∏ –Ω–µ —Ä–µ—Å–ø–∞—É–Ω—è—Ç—Å—è - –∏ –±–æ–π —Å —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –±–æ—Å—Å–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–æ–π –ø–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é –∏–º–µ—é—â–∏—Ö—Å—è —É–º–µ–Ω–∏–π, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∫–∞—á–∞—Ç—å—Å—è. –ë–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–π –Ω–µ—Ç - –∏ –≤—Å–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ —Ä–µ—Å–ø–∞—É–Ω–∞ –∏ –±–µ—Å–∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥—Ä–æ–ø–∞ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –Ω–µ—Ç, –∞ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç, –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–≥–Ω–∞—Ç—å —Å–µ–±—è –≤ —Ç—É–ø–∏–∫ - –±–ª–∏–Ω, –Ω—É —è –∂–µ –Ω–µ –≤ Survival Horror –∏–≥—Ä–∞—é! –†–µ–∞–ª—Ç–∞–π–º–æ–≤—ã–µ –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—ã –∞-–ª—è EoB (–∏–ª–∏ –ì—Ä–∏–º—Ä–æ–∫) —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è —Å –ø–æ—Ö–æ–¥–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ –±–æ—è–º–∏...

–í —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º-—Ç–æ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–∞—è. –ù–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ, —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –ª—É—á—à–µ. –Ø, —á–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è, –∑–∞–¥–æ–ª–±–∞–ª—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ –∏ –±—Ä–æ—Å–∏–ª, –µ–¥–≤–∞ –≤—ã–π–¥—è –Ω–∞ –ú–∏—Ä–æ–≤–æ–µ –î—Ä–µ–≤–æ - –Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª —É –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã —è–≤–Ω–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å, —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –±—ã –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å.

L√§sst sich bisher in den ersten 10h toll spielen. Momentan bin ich sehr zufrieden und es passt irgendwie alles zusammen. Ein angenehmer Einstieg, der nach und nach spielerisch und funktional immer mehr M√∂glichkeiten bietet. Es handelt sich um einen Dungeon-Crawler, auch mit Abwechslung Oberwelt (√§hnlich Bards Tale IV ), Grafik ist zeitlos und sehr fl√ºssig, speziell die mobs sind sehr sch√∂n designed, K√§mpfe die nicht zu schwer und auch nicht zu leicht sind, sp√§ter aber auch einige Male herausfordernd. Wichtig, die K√§mpfe machen Spa√ü! Es gibt viele Geheimnisse zu entdecken, die R√§tsel sind bisher am Anfang nicht wirklich komplex, steigern sich aber mit der Zeit und bieten tolle Abwechslung. Mit etwas Kombinationsgabe und genau hinschauen klappt das aber alles und kein R√§tsel war bisher unfair.. Mal sehen ob das beim n√§chsten Spielupdate von mir noch so bleibt. Ich bin wirklich sehr positiv √ºberrascht und kann momentan auf jeden Fall Daumen hoch geben!

Nach knapp 20h Spielzeit: Was f√ºr ein tolles Spiel! Super Spielflu√ü, tolle R√§tsel und wunderbares Weltendesign! Ich hoffe dieses Spiel werden viele spielen und bekommt die W√ºrdigung in der √ñffentlichkeit die es verdient!

Èõ£ÊòìÂ∫¶„ÅØWiz„Å™„Å©„Å´ÊØî„Åπ„Çã„Å®„Åã„Å™„Çä„Éû„Ç§„É´„Éâ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„ÅÇ„ÇãÁ®ãÂ∫¶Á¥∞„Åã„Å™Èõ£ÊòìÂ∫¶Ë™øÊï¥„ÅåÂèØËÉΩ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

ÊÑèÂë≥„ÅØÈÄö„Åò„Çã„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„ÅÆ„ÄÅNPC„ÅÆË™û„Çä„ÇÑÊó•Ë®òÂ∏≥„ÄÅ„É¢„É≥„Çπ„Çø„ÉºÂõ≥Èëë„Å™„Å©„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà„ÇÇÂáù„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÊÄ™„Åó„ÅÑÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„ÅßÈõ∞Âõ≤Ê∞ó„ÅåÂ¥©„Çå„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜ„ÅÆ„ÅØÂ∞ë„ÅóÊÆãÂøµ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ

„Å®„ÅØ„ÅÑ„Åà3D„ÉÄ„É≥„Ç∏„Éß„É≥RPG„Å´„Å®„Å£„Å¶„Çπ„Éà„Éº„É™„Éº„ÅØ„Éï„É¨„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Åó„ÄÅÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„ÅåÂÖ•„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Å†„Åë„Åß„ÇÇÊú¨ÂΩì„Å´„ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Åü„Åè„ÄÅÈÅä„Å∂„ÅÆ„Å´ÊîØÈöú„ÅØ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ
Êó•Êú¨Ë™ûË®≥„ÅØÂâ≤„ÇäÂàá„Å£„Åü‰∏ä„Åß„ÄÅWizÁ®ã„Ç¨„ÉÅ„Å™3D„ÉÄ„É≥„Ç∏„Éß„É≥RPG„ÇíÊ±Ç„ÇÅ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åß„ÅÇ„Çå„Å∞„ÄÅÂçÅÂàÜ„Å´Ê•Ω„Åó„ÇÅ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´ÊÑü„Åò„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
‰∏çÂÖ∑Âêà„Å™„Å©„ÅØ‰Ωï„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
 
Milly
0
29 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1
Recommand√©
30.0 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 avril 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

Follow our curator page Alexander's Club Curations, if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.

OVERVIEW

Operencia: The Stolen Sun is a grid movement, turn-based dungeon crawlers set in the land of fairy tales. It is quite a decent addition to the genre overall, but didn‚Äôt really break any records in terms of complexity and depth. It‚Äôs fun, brief, well-made and polished. Any fan of turn-based dungeon crawlers should try it, with the expectations of a lighter experience compared to the classics.

The Good:
  • Great variety of locations to visit, from an underwater sunken fortress to a giant tree and forests made of copper.
  • Well-crafted dungeon, though not overly complex, the dungeons contain alot of clever secrets, fun puzzles that aren't repetitive or too much pixel hunting.
  • Decent combat, not too deep, but still got many options between different skill trees available and different characters you get.
The Bad:
  • Story is kinda meh. It doesn‚Äôt really do it for me. It isn‚Äôt bad, but just a generic fairy tale kind of story. I do like the banters between characters like in Dragon Age.
  • The second bad point is relative, but for some people it might matter a lot in a game of this genre. You can‚Äôt create your custom party. You only create the MC, and like Dragon Age games you recruit characters along the progress of the story. They have their own unique classes and skill sets.

Now I will talk about different parts of the game in greater detail.

PERFORMANCE

Specs: Ryzen 3700x and GTX 1080 and 1440p monitor.
The game mostly runs at 60 FPS in almost every location including combat, however when there are a lot of particle effects like using some magic spells, or this one area in chapter 5 that has elemental particle effects on-screen, the FPS dipped into the 40‚Äôs for me.

Other than that, the game runs pretty well on the highest setting, and my experience has been very polished so far. Don‚Äôt even notice any minor bugs.


GAMEPLAY

First of all, there is a customizable difficulty option in Operencia. They are chosen at the start of the game, and cannot be changed later.
  1. Map option: turning it to hard will restrict your access to the map screen. You don't have maps available. (I turned it to normal)
  2. Exploration difficulty: turning it to hard will restrict your save, as you can only save in campfires, also disables quest markers in your map. You still can access the map, but there will barely be any hint of your objective on the map. Turning it to normal will allow you to save everywhere and your objective is shown on the map (I use hard on this)
  3. Permadeath on or off (I didn‚Äôt use it)
  4. Combat difficulty: normal and hard. This affects enemy stats you encounter. On hard they will be hitting harder and have more HP (I played on hard.)
The next part to talk about is the combat. It‚Äôs turn-based, and the combat takes place in a different field from the dungeon like older games or JRPGs. When you reach the tile in the dungeon where the enemy is, you enter the combat screen. If you approach them from behind, you will ambush them with initiative bonus. The combat field is very simple. It‚Äôs in first-person view, and the enemies stand in 3 layers of area: near, medium, far. Your type of attacks correspond to the effectiveness.

Each of your characters have different skills and a single item slot you can equip. Some enemies have different resistances, and the strategy lies in resource management and figuring out enemies‚Äô weaknesses. In hard difficulty, there are quite a mix of easy and really hard encounters. There are also a limited number of enemies in the world. Once you defeat an enemy, it disappears forever, which means the number of EXP you can gain is limited. You can‚Äôt grind but you can be underleveled if you choose to not fight enemies.

Which brings us to the next point, the character system. You build your character with a set of 3 different classes: Warrior, Ranged, Mage. Each class has different skill trees. You also have basic attributes like STR, INT, VIGOR, AGI that correspond to your character‚Äôs status and skill damage. Each time you level up, you will gain 1 skill point and 3 attribute points.

Now this is the weirdest part of the character system. You can respec anytime, anywhere without any repercussions, including your party members. You cannot change class, but you can undo all skill points and attributes and reassign them freely. It seems like the game‚Äôs balance itself is designed around this system, because some encounters are impossible with the wrong skill sets, and I had to reassign some skills in order to defeat a boss or even regular encounters.

Now I will talk about exploration. In my opinion, the exploration is the best part of this game. The dungeons, while they aren‚Äôt enormous, are filled with tons of cleverly hidden secrets and puzzles. Unlike The Legend of Grimrock, the secrets aren't overly reliant on ‚Äúfind this slightly off piece of bricks to reveal a hidden door‚Äù instead, each door has a unique design, and puzzles that make up most of its secrets. The story puzzles are pretty entertaining too. They aren‚Äôt ridiculously hard, but fun to do.

You also obtain various artifacts that can open up new paths, similar to Zelda or Metroidvania type games. In campfires, you have the option to go back to previous areas you‚Äôve visited and unlock secrets you cannot obtain before you get certain items. The items you get from secrets are usually worth it, as the most powerful equipments are usually well hidden. You also have a store where you can buy or sell excess items, but compared to items you find in treasure chests, they are pretty weak.

GRAPHICS AND SOUND

The game‚Äôs graphic itself are nothing special technically, but it has great, consistent art style and paired with the fantastical locations in the dungeons you visit, it does make a pretty game. Enemies' models are quite detailed, well-animated and sometimes their animations telegraph their next attacks or stances. The skill effects are also well done and there are quite a lot of them. While it obviously is not a high budget game, the visuals do a very good job making the game look appealing.

The sound design is also pretty good. Soundtrack is decent, nothing to write home to, but each area‚Äôs theme song fits the locale. Different skills and attack types have different, recognizable sound effects. Different tile types have different sounds when you step on them, you can also hear enemies roaming in the world. Skeletons will crackle, robots sound like metal pistons pumping, etc. The ambient sounds are also very well done, from the sounds of insects in the wilderness, birds, or machineries, each area has their own unique set of sound.

STORY AND CHARACTERS

In my opinion, the story itself is really meh. It‚Äôs not terrible, but it doesn't really do anything to impress me. I do like some of the characters in your party, and they will often banter and joke around, and I really enjoyed those interactions. The story definitely isn‚Äôt why you're gonna play this game.

CONCLUSION

All things considered, Operencia is a pretty fun game, it does some things right but doesn‚Äôt really excel in most aspects of the game. I would recommend this to a fan of dungeon crawlers games, and I also think it is worth a try for a non dungeon crawlers fan looking into a new experience. The simplicity and various difficulty options feels like it would welcome newbie players well.
 
HoboForEternity
624 produits enregistr√©s
1
40 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
5 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
3.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 28 avril 2020
"–î–∞–≤–Ω—ã–º-–¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ, –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –¥–∞–ª–µ–∫–æ, –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º—É —Ñ–µ—Ä–º–µ—Ä—É —Å–Ω–∏–ª–∏—Å—å —Å–Ω—ã.
–ë–µ–ª—ã–π –æ–ª–µ–Ω—å... –í–µ–¥—ë—Ç –µ–≥–æ –∫ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –º–µ—Å—Ç—É...
–ö–∞–∂–¥—É—é –Ω–æ—á—å —Å–æ–Ω –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞–ª—Å—è, –ø–æ–∫–∞ –æ–Ω —Å–ø–∞–ª. –¢–æ—Ç –∂–µ –æ–ª–µ–Ω—å. –¢–∞ –∂–µ —Å–æ–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∞—è —Ç—Ä–æ–ø–∞. –¢–æ—Ç –∂–µ –∑–∞–º–æ–∫ –ø–æ–¥ –æ–∑–µ—Ä–æ–º...

Operencia: The Stolen Sun 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : …Üx‚±£…ç√∏m…®


+–í–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å—Ç–∏–ª—å.
–≠—Ç–æ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–µ, —á—Ç–æ –±—Ä–æ—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –≥–ª–∞–∑–∞ –ø—Ä–∏ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã.
–õ–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤—Å–µ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤—ã–µ, –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–µ (–≤ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏), –Ω–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –º—ã–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç—ã, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è.
–•–æ—Ç—å —Ç—ã –∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—à—å —Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –≤–ª–µ–≤–æ-–≤–ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ-–≤–ø–µ—Ä—ë–¥-–Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ –∫—É–±–∏–∫–∞–º, —Ç—Ä–æ–ø–∏–Ω–∫–∏ —Ç—É—Ç –Ω–µ –∫–æ—Ä–∏–¥–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–µ, –∞ –∏–∑–æ–≥–Ω—É—Ç—ã–µ.

+–°–∞—É–Ω–¥—Ç—Ä–µ–∫–∏.
–≠—Ç–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–µ, —á—Ç–æ –±—Ä–æ—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å–ª—É—Ö. –û–Ω–∏ —Ç–∞–∫ –∂–µ –∞—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–Ω—ã–µ (–≤ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏) –∏ –ö–†–ê–ô–ù–ï —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç –∫ –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∞–º –∏ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏—é –ø–æ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –û–Ω–∏ —É–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã.
–ë–æ–ª—å—à–∏–π –Ω–∞–∫–ª–æ–Ω —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—É –¥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏–∑–º–∞.

+–û–∑–≤—É—á–∫–∞.
–•–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –∞–∫—Ç—ë—Ä—Å–∫–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞. –ê–∫—Ç—ë—Ä—ã –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—é—Ç —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π.
–•–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–∞ (–∫–∞—Å–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–≤, –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–≤ –≤—Å—è–∫–∏—Ö).

+–õ–æ—Ä. –õ–µ–≥–µ–Ω–¥—ã.
–û–Ω –µ—Å—Ç—å. –û–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–º–µ—Ç–æ–≤. –û–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–∞. –†–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏ –æ—Ç —Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ –∂–∏–≤—à–∏—Ö —Ç—É—Ç –ª—é–¥–µ–π.
–ù–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –º–Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –ª–µ–≥–µ–Ω–¥—ã. –£ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å –æ–¥–Ω–∞ –æ–±—â–∞—è –ª–µ–≥–µ–Ω–¥–∞, –æ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –ø–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—á–∏—Ü–∞ –∏ –ø–∞—Ä—É —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö, –æ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –ø–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏.

+–î–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏.
–¢–µ–∫—Å—Ç–∞ —Ç—É—Ç –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –∏–≥—Ä –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞. –ò –≤ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∞—Ö –Ω–µ—Ç –≤–æ–¥—ã. –î–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏ –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –ø–æ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É.
–ò –µ—Å–ª–∏ —Ç—ã –Ω–µ —Ö–æ—á–µ—à—å –∏—Ö —Å–ª—É—à–∞—Ç—å, —Ç—ã –º–æ–∂–µ—à—å —Å–∫–∏–ø–Ω—É—Ç—å.

+–†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—á–∏—Ü–∞.
–≠—Ç–æ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∞. –≠—Ç–æ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ. –ò –∫–∞–∫ –≤ –ª—é–±–æ–π —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–µ –ø–æ–º–∏–º–æ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏—Ö –ª–∏—Ü –µ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫ –∏–∑–≤–Ω–µ.
–†–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—á–∏—Ü–∞ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–∏ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–∏ –∫–∞—Å–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ç–µ—Ö –∏–ª–∏ –∏–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏–π –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π –±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –ª–µ–≥–µ–Ω–¥—É.

+–°–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç—ã.
–û–Ω–∏ —Ç–∞–∫ –∂–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å. –ü—Ä–æ–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª–µ–≥–∫–æ –ø–æ –Ω–µ–≤–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ó–∞ —Å—á—ë—Ç —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ –∫–∞–º–µ—Ä–∞ –≤–µ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤–æ –≤—Å–µ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã, —Ç–≤–æ–π –æ–±–∑–æ—Ä –Ω–∏—á–µ–º –Ω–µ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω. –ö–Ω–æ–ø–∫–∞, –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∞—è —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –≤ –∫–æ—Ä–∏–¥–æ—Ä–µ –∏ –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –æ–±–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–µ–ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏–π –Ω–∞ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ —Ç–æ—Ä—á–∞—â–∏–π –∫–∞–º–µ–Ω—å –∏–∑ —Å—Ç–µ–Ω—ã.

–ü—Ä–µ–¥–º–µ—Ç –¥–ª—è –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏—è —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —Å–ø—Ä—è—Ç–∞–Ω –≤ —É–≥–ª—É –≤ –≥–æ—Ä–µ –ø–µ—Å–∫–∞.

+–ì–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏.
–û–Ω–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ. –û–Ω–∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ. –û–Ω–∏ –æ—Ä–∏–≥–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ. –ò —Ç–µ–±–µ –Ω–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –∫–∞–∫ –∏—Ö —Ä–µ—à–∏—Ç—å. –¢—ã —Å–∞–º –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—à—å –∫ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É.
–í –∏–≥—Ä–µ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏ –æ—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –ª—é–¥–µ–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –¥–∞—é—Ç –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–∏, –∫–∞—Å–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ç–æ–π –∏–ª–∏ –∏–Ω–æ–π –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏, –Ω–æ –Ω–∏–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ —Å–∫–∞–∂—É—Ç —è–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è.

+–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∞.
–ú–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å "–í–æ–∏–Ω/–õ—É—á–Ω–∏–∫/–ú–∞–≥". –°–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–∫–∞—á–∫–∞ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–º–µ—Ç—ã, –Ω–æ –∏ –ø–æ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º –∑–∞ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å.
–ò —Ç—ã —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—à—å —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –º–∞–≥–∞ —Å –ª—É–∫–æ–º –∏–ª–∏ –≤–æ–∏–Ω–∞, –±—å—é—â–µ–≥–æ –º–∞–≥–∏–µ–π. –¢—ã –Ω–∏—á–µ–º –Ω–µ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω.

+–°–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è.
–ó–∞–≤–∏—Å—è—Ç –æ—Ç –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏.
–í –æ–±—ã—á–Ω–æ–º —ç—Ç–æ –ø–æ—Å–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ª–∞–≥–µ—Ä—è, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤–æ—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Ö–ø, –Ω–æ –¥–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ 1 –±—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∑–∞–∂–µ—á—å –∫–æ—Å—Ç—ë—Ä.
–¢–∞–∫–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–æ—Å–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –ª–∞–≥–µ—Ä—è –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –æ–±—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –¥—Ä—É–≥ —Å –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º.

–ï—Å—Ç—å —Ä–µ–∂–∏–º —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –≥–¥–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–º–µ—Ä—Ç–∏ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å 0.

+–Ø –∏–≥—Ä–∞–ª –≤ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –∞ –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ-"Vaporum –∏ Legend of Grimrock". –ù–æ –∑–∞–±—Ä–æ—Å–∏–ª, –º–Ω–µ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ—Å—å —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ, —á—Ç–æ —è –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥ —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω–æ –≤—Ä–∞—â–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–º–µ—Ä—É, –∞ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –≤–ª–µ–≤–æ –∏ –≤–ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ.
–í "Operencia" –≤—Ä–∞—â–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–º–µ—Ä—É –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –Ω–∞ 360 –≥—Ä–∞–¥—É—Å–æ–≤ –≤–≤–µ—Ä—Ö –∏ –≤–Ω–∏–∑.

"–ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –ø–∞—Ä—É –ª–µ—Ç –∏—Ö —Å—Å–æ—Ä—ã, –í–∞–∫–∞—Ä —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –ë—Ä–µ–∫—É, —á—Ç–æ –µ–º—É —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –ø—Ä–æ–∫–ª—è—Å—Ç—å —ç—Ç–æ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ.
–í—Å—ë, —á—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ-—ç—Ç–æ —Å–ª—ë–∑—ã –º–æ–ª–æ–¥–æ–π –¥–µ–≤—É—à–∫–∏, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∑–∞—Ç–æ–ø–∏—Ç—å —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –∑–∞–º–æ–∫ –≤ –æ–∑–µ—Ä–µ.
–†—ã—Ü–∞—Ä–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—å –≤ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏—â, —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏—Ö –ø–æ –∫–æ—Ä–∏–¥–æ—Ä–æ–º –∑–∞—Ç–æ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–º–∫–∞, –∞ –∫–æ—Ä–æ–ª—å –ø—Ä–µ–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª—Å—è –≤ –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω—É—é –∂–∞–±—É, –≤ –º–∞–ª–µ–Ω–æ–º –ø–æ–º–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏, –∏–∑ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –≤—ã—Ö–æ–¥–∞, –∏ –ª–∏—à—å –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω –±—ã–ª –µ–≥–æ –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Å–æ–±–µ—Å–µ–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–º –¥–æ–ª–≥–∏–µ –≥–æ–¥—ã."

-–•–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Ç–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å–∞, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –Ω–∞—Å–ª–∞–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è–º–∏.

-–•–æ—á–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª –±–æ—è, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç—è–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –±–æ—è —è –º–æ–≥ –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä—ã, –∫–æ–º—É –∏ —Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —É—Ä–æ–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞–Ω–µ—Å–µ–Ω–æ, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ —Å–∫–∏–ª—ã –±—ã–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω—ã. –≠—Ç–æ –ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–∏—Ç—É–∞—Ü–∏—é.

-–ë–æ—ë–≤–∫–∞ —Å–∫—É—á–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ç–∞ –∏ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω–∞. –ö–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ XCOM. –®–∞–Ω—Å –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è —Å–∫–∏–ª–∞ 83% –æ–Ω 2 —Ä–∞–∑–∞ –º–∞–∂–µ—Ç. –®–∞–Ω—Å –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è 50% –æ–Ω –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç.
–í—Ä–∞–≥–∏ –≤–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ, –Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É—é—Ç –æ–¥–Ω–∏ –∏ —Ç–µ –∂–µ –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∏ –∏ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ø—Ä–∏—á—ë–º –Ω–µ–ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∑–∞ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Ç.–∫. –Ω–∏–≥–¥–µ –Ω–µ –ø–∏—à–µ—Ç—Å—è.
–°–∫–∞–∂—É —Ç–∞–∫, –æ—â—É—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ, —á—Ç–æ –±–æ–∏ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω—ã –¥–ª—è –≥–∞–ª–æ—á–∫–∏, —Ç.–∫. –¥—Ä–∞–∫ —Ç—É—Ç –º–∞–ª–æ, –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –≤—Å—è–∫–∏—Ö –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–π —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö, –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è.

Recommand√©
37.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 10 mars 2021
If you like games like Legends of Grimrock, this game is for you.

It's better than Grimrock in every aspect:
- graphics
- great puzzles
- characters development
- story line

Regarding the review where guy told he could not grind and eventually stuck with the boss he can't defeat. You can ALWAYS respec all of your chars and try new tactics. If you stuck and can't defeat enemy, just go to the camp and try different chararacters/skills combinations. You'll succeed eventually.

I bought this game for a full price and did not regret.
 
Giperborey

16 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1
Recommand√©
36.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 11 janvier 2021
Operencia: The Stolen Sun is doing a good job in bringing the old-school dungeon crawling experience into modern gaming. It‚Äôs missing side quests and more RPG depth regarding character building, but all the in-game levels and whole world creation are good and unique enough to honestly recommend this game to all the RPG fans.

Pros:
  • Interesting setting inspired by Hungarian (mostly) mythology,
  • Great design of all 12 in-game levels,
  • Possibility to customize difficulty with 4 different settings,
  • Clean equipment UI and cool puzzle-like alchemy system,
  • Convenient backtracking mechanic helpful in uncovering all the secrets,
  • Many different enemies and bosses with unique skills,
  • Around 35h of enjoyable gameplay.
‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
  • Grid-based movement, which is okay after the first 2-3 hours, but still, free roam is way better,
  • All the options around characters and their attributes/skills are very basic,
  • Many lines and dialogues are just meh,
  • With all the battles-related difficulties set on ‚ÄúHard‚Äù, I found this game to be very easy while using utility/AoE damage focused party (ended up having ~25 firewoods).
Summary

Operencia is definitely bringing back memories of the classic Might and Magic franchise. We‚Äôre missing more small gems like this in this niche genre. Looking forward to the sequel!

7+/10

PS I haven‚Äôt played the VR version of this game.

EDIT: Formatting.
 
wcis

Recommand√©
16.0 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 4 avril 2020
–ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ Story-telling Adventure –Ω–µ–∂–µ–ª–∏ old school Dungeon Crawler. –ï—Å–ª–∏ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –µ—ë –≤ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–º –∫–ª—é—á–µ, —Ç–æ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö–∞. –ö–∞–∫ Dungeon Crawler –æ–Ω–∞ suke suke.

–û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–∞—è –Ω–∞ –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∞—Ö –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö, –∏–≥—Ä–∞ —Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∏—á–Ω–æ–π —Ü–µ–ª—å—é –∏—Ö –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—é —Å—Ä–µ–¥–∏ —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–∏—Ö –º–∞—Å—Å. –ù–æ, —Ç—É—Ç –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∞–¥–∏–∏ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è, –¥–µ–≤–µ–ª–æ–ø–µ—Ä—ã –¥–µ–ª–∞—é—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤—É—é –æ—à–∏–±–∫—É. –í—ã —Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª–∏ –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞-–Ω–∏–±—É–¥—å –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏? –ù—É –≤–æ—Ç, –∏—Ö –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å–ª—ã—à–∞–ª. –û–Ω–∏ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, –∏ –≥–∏–ø–µ—Ä—Ç—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ –≤–æ—Å—Ö–≤–∞–ª—è—é—â–∏–µ –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–µ –∫–æ—á–µ–≤—ã–µ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–∏. –í—Å–µ –∑–Ω–∞—é—Ç –∏ –ª—é–±—è—Ç –Ω–µ–º–µ—Ü–∫–∏–µ, —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–∏–µ, –∏—Ç–∞–ª—å—è–Ω—Å–∫–∏–µ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏ –∑–∞ –∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—É—é –º–æ—Ä–∞–ª—å, –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω—É—é –ª—é–±–æ–º—É. –ê –≤–æ—Ç –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏-—Ç–µ–ª–ª–∏–Ω–≥ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–µ–Ω, —Å–∫–æ—Ä–µ–µ –Ω–∞–æ–±–æ—Ä–æ—Ç. –¢–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä–∏–π, –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏, –ø–∞–Ω—á–∏ (–∞ –æ–Ω–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å?) –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ. –ù–µ –ø–ª–æ—Ö–∏–µ, –Ω–æ –∏ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞—é—â–∏–µ—Å—è. –û–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞—Ç—å –≤ –º–∞—Ä—à—Ä—É—Ç–∫–µ —ç—Ç–æ —Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç.

–í—ã–±—Ä–∞–≤ –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–æ–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞ Dungeon Crawler, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∏ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∏ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –æ—à–∏–±–∫—É. –ñ–∞–Ω—Ä —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à –±–µ–∑–æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ, –Ω–æ –≥–µ—Ä–º–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ–Ω. –í –Ω–µ–≥–æ —Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç —Ç–µ, –∫—Ç–æ –µ–≥–æ –ª—é–±–∏—Ç. –ê –ª—é–±—è—Ç –µ–≥–æ –∑–∞ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–∏—Ö. –ö–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö, –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –≤ Operencia: The Stolen Sun, –¥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–∞ –≤—Å–µ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–≤–µ–∑–ª–∏. –ò–∑ –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã—Ö –¥–ª—è –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å —Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –∫–ª–µ—Ç–æ—á–∫–∞–º –∏ –Ω–∞–ª–∏—á–∏–µ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–æ–≤. –ü–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–π –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä—ã –ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º –∏—Ö —Å–∫–∞–∑–æ–∫, –∂–∞–Ω—Ä –±—ã–ª –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–Ω –Ω–µ—É–¥–∞—á–Ω–æ. –ß–µ–º –º–∞—Å—Å–æ–≤–∞—è Adventure –Ω–µ –ø–æ–¥–æ—à–ª–∞, –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ.
–°–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ—é –ø–∞—Ç–∏ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è. –ù–∞–±–æ—Ä —Å–æ–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–π—Ü–µ–≤ —Ñ–∏–∫—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ –º–µ—Ä–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç—É. –í –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö 4, –µ—â—ë 4 –Ω–∞ –±–∞–Ω–∫–µ, –∂–¥—É—Ç –æ—Ç–º–∞—à–∫–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞, —á—Ç–æ-–±—ã –≤—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏—Ç—å –≤ –±–æ–π. –ß–µ–º —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π Dungeon Crawler –±—ã–ª –≤ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º –∞—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–µ? –≠—Ç–æ –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–∑ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞—Å—Ç–æ–º–Ω—É—é –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—É, –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –Ω–∞ —Å–≤–æ–π –∏–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –≤–∫—É—Å. –ù–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä: –ü—Ç–µ—Ä–æ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–∏–ª—å-–î–∏–µ—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥, –ò–Ω—Ñ—É–∑–æ—Ä–∏—è-—Ç—É—Ñ–µ–ª—å–∫–∞ –ø–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∫ –°–∫–∞–π–Ω–µ—Ç, –ë—Ä–∏—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–∫ —Å–æ —Å–ø–µ—Ä–º–æ—Ç–æ–∫—Å–∏–∫–æ–∑–æ–º, –∏ –ó–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–ø–æ—Å–ª—É—à–Ω—ã–π –í–∞—Ä–≤–∞—Ä —Å—Ä–∞–∂–∞—é—â–∏–π—Å—è –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω—ã–º –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∞. –ò–ª–∏: –ú—ã—à—å —Å—ä–µ–≤—à–∞—è —Ñ–∏–ª–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∏—é –î–∂–∞—Ä–∞–∫—Å–∞, –ë–∞–±—É–∏–Ω-–ò–Ω–∫–≤–∏–∑–∏—Ç–æ—Ä –≤ —Ç–µ–ª–µ —Ö–æ–º—è–∫–∞, –°–∏–∞–º—Å–∫–∏–µ –±–ª–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Ü—ã —Å–∫–µ–π—Ç–µ—Ä—ã, –∏ –°–∞–º—ã–π –°–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –ñ—ë—Å—Ç–∫–∏–π –î–∏—Å–∫ –í—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –Ω–∞ —Å–µ–¥–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–ø–∞—Ä–∞—Ç–∞—Ö. –ù–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤ –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ —Å–æ—Å—Ç—Ä—è–ø–∞—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è. –ü–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–∏ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω—ã –¥–æ –≤–∞—Å, –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å –Ω–µ –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å, –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä —É–º–µ–Ω–∏–π —Ç–æ–∂–µ. –¢–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∏ –æ—Å—Ç–∞—ë—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö, –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–∞—è –º–∞–≥—É —Å–∏–ª—É, –∞ –≤–æ—Ä–∞ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—è –≤–∞—Ä–∏—Ç—å —á–∞–π.
–†–ü–ì-–æ—Ç—ã–≥—Ä—ã—à–∞ –Ω–µ—Ç –∏ –≤ –ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–µ. –•–æ—Ç—è –≤ —Å–∏–Ω–æ–ø—Å–∏—Å–µ –∫ –∏–≥—Ä–µ, –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ä–∞—é—Ç –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–≥–æ –≤ —Ç.—á. –ú—ã –∂–µ –≤—Å–µ –≤–∑—Ä–æ—Å–ª—ã–µ —É–∂–µ, –¥–∞? –ü–æ–º–Ω–∏–º, —á—Ç–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ö–∞—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫ —ç—Ç–æ –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ –†–ü–ì, –¥–∞? –í–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –≤—ã–±–æ—Ä–∞ –¥–ª—è –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–π –Ω–µ—Ç, –≤–ª–∏—è—Ç—å –º—ã –Ω–∞ —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç –Ω–µ –º–æ–∂–µ–º –Ω–∏–∫–∞–∫. –û–Ω –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–∏—Ç–∫–∞ —Å –∑–∞–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–π —É–∑–µ–ª–∫–∞–º–∏, –ø–æ–∫–∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏–π –Ω–µ —Ä–∞–∑–≤—è–∂–µ—à—å, —Å–∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç-—Å—Ü–µ–Ω—ã —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–≥–æ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∂—É—Ç.
–ë–æ–µ–≤–∞—è —á–∞—Å—Ç—å –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–Ω–∞ –∏ –ø–æ—à–∞–≥–æ–≤–∞, –Ω–æ —É–∂ –¥—é–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞. –ù–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∂–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –ø—Ä–∏—à–ª–æ—Å—å —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ –±–æ—Å—Å–µ –∞–∂ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å–µ–≥–æ –∞–∫—Ç–∞. –ë–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–∞–∫–æ–≤ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ —Ä–∞–∑–±–∏—Ä–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–∞—Ç–∞–∫–æ–π –∏ 1-2 —Å–ø–µ–ª–∞–º–∏ –º–∞—Å—Å-–¥–º–≥. –®–º–æ—Ç —Å—ã–ø–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ –±–æ—è, –µ–≥–æ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –∏ –æ–Ω –≤–µ—Å—å –æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞–∫–æ–≤—ã–π. –ì–¥–µ —Ç–æ —Ñ–∞–Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ –±–µ–∑—É–º–∏–µ, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≥–æ–ª—ã–π –±–µ–≥–∞–ª –ø–æ –ø–ª—è–∂—É –æ—Ç —á–µ—Ä–µ–ø–∞—Ö –∏ –∫–∏–¥–∞–ª—Å—è –≤ –Ω–∏—Ö –ø–∞–ª–∫–∞–º–∏?
–ì–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏, –∑–∞–≥–∞–¥–∫–∏, —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç—ã –∏–º–µ—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ –Ω–∞–ª–∏—á–∏–∏. –ù–æ –∏—Ö –º–∞–ª–æ, –æ–Ω–∏ –ª–µ–≥–∫–∏–µ –∏ –Ω–µ—Ç –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ –¥–æ–ª–∏ –±–µ–∑—É–º–∏—è –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–∞ –≤ –∏—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–∏. –î–∞ –±–ª–∏–Ω, –¥–∞–∂–µ —Å–æ–∂—Ä–∞—Ç—å –ª–µ—Ç—É—á—É—é –º—ã—à—å, –≤—ã–º–∞–∑–∞–≤ –µ—ë –≤ –≥–æ–≤–Ω–µ –ø–∞–Ω–≥–æ–ª–∏–Ω–∞, —á—Ç–æ-–±—ã —É–Ω–∏—á—Ç–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å –≤–µ—Å—å –º–∏—Ä - —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—é. –¢—É—Ç —Å–∫–æ—Ä–µ–µ ¬´–Ω–∞–π–¥–∏ –∫–ª—é—á –æ—Ç –∑–∞–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–æ–π –¥–≤–µ—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–∞–∂–æ–º –Ω–∏–∂–µ¬ª –∏–ª–∏ ¬´–Ω–∞–¥–µ–Ω—å –∫–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—É –Ω–∞ –¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤—è–Ω–Ω—É—é —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—é –∫–æ—Ä–æ–ª—è, —É –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∫–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã¬ª. –ì–¥–µ –±–ª–∏–Ω, ¬´–Ω–∞–¥–æ —Å–∂–µ—á—å –º–æ—Ö –ø–∞–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º—É—Ö–æ–ª–æ–≤–∞ –≤ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—á—å –Ω–∞ 23 –¥–µ–Ω—å –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –ø–æ–µ–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –∞—Ä–±—É–∑–∞ –≤ –Ø–ª—Ç–µ, —á—Ç–æ-–±—ã –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—å —Å –Ω–µ–±–∞ –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑–Ω—ã–º —à–∞—Ä–æ–º, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ 20 —á–∞—Å–æ–≤ –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø—Ä–æ –Ω–µ–≥–æ –∏ –¥—É–º–∞—Ç—å –∑–∞–±—É–¥–µ—à—å¬ª?
–í–æ—Ç —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–æ—Å—å –Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ, —ç—Ç–æ –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–∞—è –∏ –∑–≤—É–∫. –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –ª—É—á—à–∞—è –∏–∑ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ–º–∞—Ä–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–∫ Dungeon Crawler. –î–ª—è –≤–æ–ª—à–µ–±–Ω–æ–π —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏ –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–º –í–µ–Ω–≥—Ä–∏–∏ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ. –ó–≤—É–∫ —á–∏—Å—Ç—ã–π, –Ω–∞—Å—ã—â–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π, –µ—Å—Ç—å —É –ª—é–±–æ–≥–æ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è. –û–∑–≤—É—á–µ–Ω—ã –∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏ –≤—Å–µ –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏. –ò –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–æ–∏–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —à–µ–ø–æ—Ç –≤ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–µ, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –∏–≥—Ä—É –¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ –≤—ã–∫–ª—é—á–∏–ª. –£ –Ω–µ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ —Å–∞–º—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —à–µ–ø–æ—Ç –∏ —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–π —Ç–µ–º–±—Ä.)

–ö–∞–∫ –∏–¥–µ–∞–ª –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞ Dungeon Crawler –µ—Å—Ç—å ¬´Legend of Grimrock¬ª, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ –∂–µ. –ï—ë –ª—É—á—à–∏–º –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∞—á–∏–≤–∫–∞ ‚ÄúFull Monty‚Äù, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–¥–æ –±—ã–ª–æ —É–±–∏—Ç—å –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞, —Å–Ω—è–≤ —Å —Å–µ–±—è —à—Ç–∞–Ω—ã –∏ –∫–∏–Ω—É–≤ –≤ –Ω–µ–≥–æ. –ù–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤ –û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–µ—Ç. –≠—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –ø–ª–æ—Ö–∞—è, –Ω–µ—Ç. –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –º–Ω–µ –∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç—Å—è, –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã –æ—à–∏–±–ª–∏—Å—å —Å –≤—ã–±–æ—Ä–æ–º –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞ –¥–ª—è –∏—Ö –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∏—á–Ω–æ–π —Ü–µ–ª–∏ –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤–µ–Ω–≥–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–π –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä—ã. –ó–¥–µ—Å—å –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –ø–æ–¥–æ—à–ª–∞ –±—ã –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è Adventure —Å –µ–µ —Ä–∞–∑–º—ã—Ç—ã–º–∏ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞–º–∏, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏-—Ç–µ–ª–ª–∏–Ω–≥ –ª–µ–≥ –±—ã –∫—É–¥–∞ –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–ª–µ–∫ –±—ã –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫—É—é –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é, –Ω–µ–∂–µ–ª–∏ –≥–µ—Ä–º–µ—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ã–π Dungeon Crawler.

Operencia: The Stolen Sun –ª—É—á—à–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–π–¥—ë—Ç –∫–∞–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–∞–º, –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞–≤—à–∏–º –∂–∞–Ω—Ä Dungeon Crawler –¥–æ —Å–∏—Ö –ø–æ—Ä. –ó–¥–µ—Å—å —Å–∏–º–ø–∞—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞, –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–µ –±–æ–∏, –Ω–µ–Ω–∞–≤—è–∑—á–∏–≤–æ–µ –∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ–µ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ, –Ω–µ –≤—ã–º–æ—Ä–∞–∂–∏–≤–∞—é—â–∏–µ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç—ã. –õ–∞–π—Ç–æ–≤–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ —á–∞—Å–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ 15-20.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 31 mars 2020
–ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –≤–ø–µ—á–∞—Ç–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ—Ç –∏–≥—Ä—ã –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã–µ. –ü–æ—à–∞–≥–æ–≤–∞—è –±–æ–µ–≤–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ —Å —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–∏–µ–º —É–º–µ–Ω–∏–π, —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç–Ω–∞—è –ª–∏–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ–∫–∞ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è, –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Ä–∞–¥—É—é—Ç –≥–ª–∞–∑. –ù–µ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–≥–∞–µ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ –∫–ª–µ—Ç–∫–∞–º, –Ω–æ, –ø–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–º—É —Å—á—ë—Ç—É, –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ –ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã–∫–∞–µ—à—å –∏ –Ω–µ –æ–±—Ä–∞—â–∞–µ—à—å –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ. –°—Ö–æ–¥—É –Ω–µ –ª–∞–≥–∞–µ—Ç, –Ω–µ –≤—ã–ª–µ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç. –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫ - —Å—É–±—Ç–∏—Ç—Ä—ã (–ø–æ–∫–∞ —Å –Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º–∏ –æ–ø–µ—á–∞—Ç–∫–∞–º–∏). –í—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –Ω–µ—Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏. –° –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–º —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º –±—É–¥—É –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –∏–≥—Ä—É, –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–µ–Ω–µ–≥ –Ω–µ –∂–∞–ª–∫–æ - –∑–∞—Ç—è–≥–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç. –ü–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º, —á—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 novembre 2020
Petit jeu sympas , les graphismes , la musique , l'ambiance , tout est au poil , seul petit b√©mole , j'ai jou√© clavier-souris , pour la maniabilit√© , c'est pas jouasse ! Sinon rien a dire !
Je recommande bien sur !
 
Chevalier Noob Cricri
207 produits enregistr√©s
0
20 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
1
Non recommand√©
29.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 janvier 2022
As a great fan of the Etrian Odyssey series for the Nintendo DS/3DS, I was looking for a similar experience on the PC. To be short: Operencia is not on the same level in terms of the total experience/package. The purchase of Operencia was also fueled by wanting to check out other works of Zen Studios, as I'm a great fan of their high quality Zen Pinball games. Operencia is not a bad game, but I would never recommend it to anybody when they would ask for a dungeon crawling experience. This is another game that suffers from poor choices in terms of game mechanics, wrapped in a shiny stylized package for the overall audiovisual design.

Pros:
+ Stylish handdrawn artwork. The world design is also done very well and convincing. The visual presentation is up there with the very best in the high-fantasy genres.
+ The Unreal engine makes this game look very nice. Quality textures and accompanying glittery effects for all kinds of spells and environmental interactions.
+ Fully voiced dialog. Mostly done very well, with the exception of the Asian party member.
+ A few memorable musical themes, aided by convincing environmental effects like nature sounds and echos while people talk in certain spaces.
+ The environmental puzzles are varied, and make sense most of the time. There is more here than just placing colored blocks in the right wholes. There are a few head scratchers here and there though, and the pipe based puzzle in the last dungeon is just annoying.
+ Skill points and abilities/spells, can be completely restructured at every point in time.

‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
- Mediocre storyline: form a party, fight through dungeons and defeat the final boss in the last dungeon.
- Very generic enemies: ghosts, mages, rats, robots, skeletons, spiders, etc. The usual, and only the usual. Especially the robots in the Copper Forest areas, look pretty ridiculous and have these long silly robotic animations. There is also one line in the game, where a character states something about fighting the same enemies over and over again. Therefore it seems to be that these game designers are not taking themselves very seriously.
- Not too many spells: only six can be active per party member, with not many more available for them in total.
- Slow and methodical saving process. Almost in the style of the type writer with ink ribbons from the classic Resident Evil games. You literally have to save before/after every fight. There is always a chance your party will be wiped out, even on normal difficulty and having high levels and the best possible gear.
- Some annoying difficulty spikes throughout the game. Normal difficulty should also be called Hard difficulty.
- The final boss in the Glass Palace is nearly impossible. An extremely annoying fight, due to the difficulty spike and the insane amount of enemies. This is the main reason why only a small percentage finished this game.
- Leveling the party does not feel very rewarding. It literally feels like the party is stuck at the first few levels, because the same enemies will keep popping up and they will also wipe the floor with your party when not careful.
- The gear management for your party, is pretty much non-existent. Most of the time, it is reduced to pressing the "Optimize" option.
 
Droomsfeer
0
12 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Non recommand√©
14.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 24 octobre 2020
–î–∞–≤–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –¥—Ä–æ–ø–∞–ª –∏–≥—Ä—ã –Ω–∞ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è, –Ω–æ —Ç—É—Ç –∫ 5 –≥–ª–∞–≤–µ –æ–∫–æ–Ω—á–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–¥–æ–µ–ª–æ, –Ω–µ —Å–º–æ–≥ –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏ –Ω–∏ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–ª—é—Å–∞ –≤ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –¥–æ–±–µ–∂–∞—Ç—å –¥–æ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–ª–∞. –ò–≥—Ä–∞ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –±–µ–∑–ª–∏–∫–∞—è –∏ –ª–µ–Ω–∏–≤–æ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∞, –¥–∞–∂–µ –æ–∑–≤—É—á–∫–∞ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π —Å–µ—Ä–∞—è –∏ –±–µ–∑—ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è, –Ω–µ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π —Å—É—Ö–∞—è, –∞ –≤–æ—Ç –ø—Ä—è–º –±—ã—Ç–æ–≤—É—Ö–∞ –∫–∞–∫–∞—è —Ç–æ.

–ü–æ–∫—É–ø–∞–ª —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è VR, –Ω–æ –æ–Ω –æ—á–µ–≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ —Ç—É—Ç –Ω–µ –º–æ—É—à–µ–Ω, –∞ —á–∏—Å—Ç–æ –≤–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π –∏ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ, —Ç.–∫. –¥–∞–Ω–∂–µ–Ω –∫—Ä–∞—É–ª–µ—Ä –≤ –≤—Ä–µ —Ä–µ–¥–∫–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ —Å–æ–π–¥—ë—Ç –¥–∞–∂–µ —Ç–∞–∫. –ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –≤ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–º, —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±—ã –ø–æ—Ö–æ–¥—É –≤—Ä –Ω–µ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–∞–ª–∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å –≤–∑—è—Ç –∏–∑ –ø–ª–æ—Å–∫–æ–π –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–∏ –∏ –∂—ë—Å—Ç–∫–æ –∑–∞–∫—Ä–µ–ø–ª—ë–Ω –Ω–∞ —ç–∫—Ä–∞–Ω–µ, –í –†–ê–ô–û–ù–ï **** –£–®–ï–ô, –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –±–æ–π –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –º–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –±–∞—à–∫–æ–π –∏–∑ –ª–µ–≤–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∏–∂–Ω–µ–≥–æ —É–≥–ª–∞ (—Å–∫–∏–ª–æ–≤) –≤ –ø—Ä–∞–≤—ã–π –≤–µ—Ä—Ö–Ω–∏–π (—Ö–ø –ø–∞—Ç–∏). –ù–∏–∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–∫ —é–∏ –Ω–µ—Ç—É –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ, –Ω–∏ —Å–∫–µ–π–ª–∞, –Ω–∏ –ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è, –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ—Å—Ç—ã–ª—å - –≤—ã—Ç—è–Ω—É—Ç—Å—è –≤–ø–µ—Ä—ë–¥->—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞–º–µ—Ä—É->–æ—Ç–∫–∏–Ω—É—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥.

–•–æ—Ç—å —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–∞–±–ª—ã –∏ —Ç–µ—Ä–ø–∏–º—ã, —Å–∞–º–∞ —Ä–ø–≥ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–∞—è —É –∏–≥—Ä—ã –Ω–µ–≤—ã–Ω–æ—Å–∏–º–∞, –∫–∞–∫ –±—É–¥—Ç–æ —Ä–µ–±—è—Ç–∞ –¥–µ–ª–∞–≤—à–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–∏ –≤ —Ä—è–¥ —Å–µ–ª–∏ –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å —Ä–ø–≥. –í –∏–≥—Ä–µ –Ω–µ—Ç —Å–æ–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–π—Ü–µ–≤ –º–∞–≥–æ–≤, —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –≤–∞—à –º–µ–π–Ω –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —á–∏—Å—Ç–æ –º–∞–≥–æ–º, –≤—Å–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø–µ—Ä—Å—ã –≥–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥—ã. –£–±–æ–≥–æ—Å—Ç—å –±–∞–ª–∞–Ω—Å–∞ –≤–∏–¥–Ω–∞ —Å —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞, –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä—Å –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –º—ã –±–µ—Ä—ë–º –≤ –ø–∞—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–º –∂–µ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ–±–∏–ª–¥ –Ω–∞ 2 –∞–±–∏–ª–∫–∏, —Ö–∏–ª –∏ –¥–æ—Ç –Ω–∞ —è–¥, –í–°–ï –≤—Ä–∞–≥–∏ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –≤—ã –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã—ã—Ö –¥–≤—É—Ö —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è—Ö –∏–º–µ—é—Ç –ª–∏–±–æ —Ñ—É–ª –∏–º—É–Ω –ª–∏–±–æ —Å–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫ —è–¥—É. –ü—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—É —Å–∫–∏–ª–æ–≤ —Ä–µ—à–∏–ª–∏ –∏–∑—è—â–Ω–µ–Ω—å–∫–æ, –º—ã –º–æ–∂–µ–º –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è—Ç—å —Ç–∞–ª–∞–Ω—Ç—ã –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –∏ –≤–µ–∑–¥–µ –∏ –±–µ–∑ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–π, –Ω–µ —É–±–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –±–æ—Å—Å, –∑–∞–≥—Ä—É–∑–∫–∞‚Üí—Ä–µ—Å–ø–µ–∫. –ò–≥—Ä–∞–ª –Ω–∞ –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ–π —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –Ω–∞ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª–µ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ, –Ω–æ —Ç–∞–∫ —Ö–∑. –° –≤—Ä–∞–≥–∞–º–∏ –≤—Å—ë –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø–µ—á–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ, –º—ã –∏–º–µ–µ–º –ø–æ 2 —Ç–∏–ø–∞ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å + –±–æ—Å—Å + —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ–≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –Ω–µ—â–∞–¥–Ω–æ —ç–∫—Å–ø–ª—É–∞—Ç–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç 2 –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∫–∏, —Ç–∞—É–Ω—Ç –∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–Ω. –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –≤—Å—ë –æ—Ç —Ç—Ä–µ—à–∞ –¥–æ –±–æ—Å–æ–≤ —ç—Ç–æ —Å–∞–º–æ–Ω–µ—Ä—ã –∏–ª–∏ —Ç–∞–Ω–∫–∏ (—É —Ç–∞–Ω–∫–æ–≤ —Ç—É—Ç –∞–æ–µ —Ç–∞—É–Ω—Ç —Å–æ 100% –ø—Ä–æ–∫–æ–º).

–ò –≤–æ—Ç –∫–∞–±—ã –≤—Ä–æ–¥–µ –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–º–µ—Ç–æ–≤ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏ –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ —Ç–æ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –º–∏—Ä–∞ –∏ –∑–∞–ø–∏—Å–æ—á–∫–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–¥–µ–∫—Å–µ –∏ –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–æ–≤ –¥–æ—Ñ–∏–≥–∞, –Ω–æ –≤—Å—ë —ç—Ç–æ –º–Ω–æ–∂–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –±–µ–ª–æ–≥–æ —à—É–º–∞.

–í —ç—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –±—ã –ø–æ–∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –º–æ–±–∏–ª–∫–µ –≤ –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–µ, –±—É–¥—å –ø–æ—Ä—Ç –¥–ª—è –Ω–∏—Ö, –Ω–æ –∫–∞–∫ –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –¥–ª—è –∫–æ–º–ø–∞ –æ–Ω–∞ —Ä–∞—Å—Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ –Ω—É –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ—Ç–ª–∏–≤—ã—Ö –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–æ–≤.

Wer Blobber / Dungeoncrawler wie Might and Magic X, Legend of Grimrock usw mag sollte hier zugreifen.

Pro:
- Story die √ºber "Hier Dungeon, geh rein und √ºberlebe" bzw. die das ganze Spiel im Vordergrund steht
- "Lebendige" Charaktere die immer mal wieder zu Wort kommen, sich gegenseitig Spr√ºche an den Kopf werfen (Joska is der Beste!)
- Charaktere k√∂nnen jederzeit umgeskillt werden (Stats und Skills)
- Sprachausgabe die trotz des Budgets echt gut ist.
- Tr√§nke Brauen als kleines R√§tsel
- Erkundung und Geheimnisse finden bringen auch EXP
- keine typische "EDO" oder Tolkien Fantasy. Die Welt basiert auf osteurop√§ischen Legenden was die Sache ungewohnt und neu macht



‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•:
- einige echt fiese "Spikes" im Balancing (hier hilft aber dann das re Skillen)
- ab ca der H√§lfte wird GIFT als DOT fast sinnfrei da die meisten Gegner dagegen immun sind
- keine wirklich "durchgehende" Welt wie z.b. Might and Magic X sondern eher "einzelne Level" die aber sp√§ter jederzeit wieder besucht werden k√∂nnen um die letzten Geheimnisse zu l√ºften.



Generell: Wenn ihr RPGs m√∂gt...kaufen :)

Non recommand√©
3.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 4 mai 2020
I don't really care for this game. In comparison to Legend of Grimrock for example this game restricts where you can rest and how often, and also locks you into the levels as you make your way through the game so that you cannot leave and go back to a previous area. The combat also locks you into place which is OK but there is no dodging around and it feels like the player is severely underpowered with attacks doing only tiny amounts of damage and the combats dragging on draining your strength and forcing you to rest. It all feels to restricting and regimented like you are fighting a spreadsheet to determine the optimal strategy or viable path rather than exploring an interesting world.
 
Brian
0

Just completed it (didnt technically take 90 hours, that includes a lot of baby cuddling time) and its a really nice casual game to dip in and out of. Worth the money

Non recommand√©
57.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 18 septembre 2020
During quarantine I've knocked out Vaporum and replayed Grimrock so I was pretty excited to give this game a try. I'd say the first 8 or so hours are what you'd hope for, but it's like they were worried the game wouldn't be long enough and they added these repetitive battles against high defense foes. Just long tedious grinds...absolutely boring and it's gotten to a point where I'm on my 5th (?) battle or so having to wade through golems. It's already a little dull pixel hunting for some various item and now combat is dull too.
 
xtechnox
0
7 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
11.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 juin 2021
Im leaning towards positive because the game is overall great... but if you are getting it because of VR maybe take pause.

100% of my gameplay was in VR.

The game has great graphics, great performance, the story is nice and entertaining, the voice acting is awesome, characters are kinda likable and enemies are greatly designed.

Played with an xbox controller and it worked perfectly, the turn based gameplay, and grid like movement, helps the control feel perfectly fine, VR gives a great sense of presence and of course immersion.

The only issue i have is that it feels a bit... Grindy? like at some point you do something and "a doors unlocks somewhere"
and you have to go back and search where it opened, and i dont mean go back 2 rooms, but the whole map undoing puzzles and going basically to the beginning, where, granted, it was pretty clear there was a room i couldnt access yet...

i did it once, then the next times i saw that msg if it wasnt clear what where the door was, i ignored it and the rewards because, it was too much of a pain to transverse through the level (in VR?).

And then there are these puzzles where you have to search for clues, and you need a "light" that only lights up for X moves and increases intensity the closer you are to the clue, sounds ok written up, but, it was a pain to do them, and those where not optional.

looking semi aimlessly for hidden clues that, feels like they its there to artificially extend the playtime.

Personally id be grateful if they could cut those parts and make the game 1/2 its lenght.

Aside from that, the game is really well done all around, i enjoyed thinking my moves, and tactically attacking enemies, boosting my abilities and getting stronger.

i definitively didnt like going back to the map looking for a door that opened somewhere.

I think on flatscreen this isnt much of an issue, but on VR, its a pain and feels ungratifying and a chore to do, i felt it was a waste of time at some point, just plain didnt enjoy it.

I still recommended this, because its well above the average quality of a usual VR game, and even with its issues, the game is worth your time if you are interested in turn based games in VR.

 
badillin [JoinUsInVr]

Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : –ê–Ω–Ω–∞—ç–π—Ä–∞
  • –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ –≥–µ—Ä–æ–∏. –í—Å–µ–≥–æ –≤ –Ω–∞—à–µ–º –ø–æ–¥—á–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —Å–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —à–µ—Å—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π, –∏ –≤—Å–µ –æ–Ω–∏ –æ–±–ª–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏–º–∏ —Ö–∞—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–µ—Ä–∞–º–∏ –∏ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º–∏ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏. –û—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π –Ω–∞ —è–∑—ã–∫ —Ä–∞–∑–±–æ–π–Ω–∏–∫ –Å—à–∫–∞, ¬´–∫—Ä—É—Ç–æ–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–∏–∫¬ª –°–µ–±–∞—Å—Ç—å—è–Ω, –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–¥—É—à–Ω—ã–π —Ä—ã—Ü–∞—Ä—å –ú–µ–∑–µ–π, —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∞—é—â–∞—è –ö–∞–º–µ–Ω—â–∏—Ü–∞ –ö–µ–ª–∞... –ö —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å —Å –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–º –ª–∏—á–Ω–æ, –∫–∞–∫ —ç—Ç–æ –±—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –≤–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö —Ä–æ–ª–µ–≤—ã—Ö –∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ö, –Ω–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—Å—è, –æ–¥–Ω–∞–∫–æ –∏ –±–µ–∑ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –±—É–¥—É—Ç —Ç–æ –∏ –¥–µ–ª–æ –≤—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞—Ç—å –≤ –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏, –≤–æ–≤–ª–µ–∫–∞—è –∏ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ–∂–µ, –≤—ã—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–µ –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ, —Å–ø–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ä—É–≥–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è. –ü–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –¥–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏ –º—ã —É—Å–ª—ã—à–∏–º —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–∞–ª–µ, –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö–∞—è —É –∫–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞, –Ω–æ –∏ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–µ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –Ω–∞—à–∏ —Å–æ–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–π—Ü—ã –±—É–¥—É—Ç –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–µ–µ... –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º, —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –∑–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ, –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –±—É–¥—É—Ç –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —á–ª–µ–Ω—ã –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø—ã, –Ω–æ –∏ ¬´–∑–∞–ø–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ¬ª, —Ç–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–µ–ø–ª–∏–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –≤—ã–π–¥–µ—Ç.
  • –†–∞–∑–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è, –ø–æ–¥–≤–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –ó–∞–º–æ–∫, –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥–∏—Ç –∫–∞–∫ —Ç–∏–ø–∏—á–Ω—ã–π –ª–∞–Ω–¥—à–∞—Ñ—Ç –¥–ª—è –¥–∞—É–Ω–∂-–∫—Ä–∞—É–ª–µ—Ä–∞, —Ç–æ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –Ω–∞–º –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –ª–µ—Å, –ø–æ–ª–∞–∑–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ –ø–µ—â–µ—Ä–∞–º, –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–∞–∑—Ä—É—à–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é –∫—Ä–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –≤–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ –≥–∏–≥–∞–Ω—Ç—Å–∫–æ–µ –¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≤ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–∞—Å –∂–¥—É—Ç —Å–≤–æ–∏ –æ—Å–æ–±—ã–µ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ ‚Äî –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –Ω–∞ –¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø—É—Ç–µ—à–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤ –ª–æ–¥–æ—á–∫–∞—Ö-–ª–∏—Å—Ç—å—è—Ö –∏ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –ª–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—Ä–µ–∑–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ö–∏—â–Ω—ã–º —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ–Ω–∏—è–º ‚Äî –∏ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–∏ ‚Äî —Ç–∏–ø–∞ –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑... –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏—Ç–µ, –º–µ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –¥—Ä–æ–≤–æ—Å–µ–∫–æ–≤ –≤ –ú–µ–¥–Ω–æ–º –ª–µ—Å—É, –≥–∏–≥–∞–Ω—Ç—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∂–∞–± –≤ –∑–∞–º–∫–µ –Ω–∞ –û–∑–µ—Ä–µ –ê–Ω–Ω—ã –∏ —ç–∫—Å—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–æ–∏–Ω–æ–≤ –ë—É—Å–æ —Ä—è–¥–æ–º —Å –í—Ä–∞—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤ –ü–æ–¥–∑–µ–º–Ω—ã–π –ú–∏—Ä.
  • –°–æ —Å–ø–µ—Ü—ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏ —Ç—É—Ç –≤—Å–µ –≤ –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–∫–µ. –°–∞–º–∏ –ø–æ—à–∞–≥–æ–≤—ã–µ –±–æ–∏ —á–µ–º-—Ç–æ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –ø–æ—Ö–≤–∞—Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å –≤—Ä—è–¥ –ª–∏ —Å–º–æ–≥—É—Ç (—Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ —á—Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å ¬´–∑–∞—Ä—è–∂–∞—Ç—å¬ª —Å—É–ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏), –Ω–æ –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥—è—Ç –æ–Ω–∏ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–æ, –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–∑–¥–Ω–∏—Ö —ç—Ç–∞–ø–∞—Ö –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∞—à–∏–º –≥–µ—Ä–æ—è–º —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—è—Ç—Å—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã —Å–∞–º—ã–µ –º–æ—â–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –∞ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–∏ —É–∂–µ –Ω–µ –ø–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç —Å –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏—Ö —É–¥–∞—Ä–æ–≤ –∏ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—Ç –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –æ–≥—Ä—ã–∑–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç. –û—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–º –ø–æ–ø—Ä–∏—â–µ –º–∞–≥–∏ ‚Äî –Ω–æ –∏–º –∂–µ –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è —Ç—â–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ —Å–ª–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å –∑–∞ —Å–≤–æ–µ–π —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–µ–π, –¥–∞–±—ã –Ω–µ –æ—Ç–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–Ω–∏–≥—É –∑–∞–∫–ª–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–π –≤ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∫—É –∏ –Ω–µ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—Ç—å –º–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ –≤—Ä—É—á–Ω—É—é.
  • –õ—é–±–æ–ø—ã—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏. –ù–∞–º —Ç–æ –∏ –¥–µ–ª–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∫–∏, –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –ø–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∏ –≤ –∏–≥—Ä–µ –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –ª–∞–∫–æ–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ, –∞ –≤–æ—Ç —Å–∞–º–∏ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–æ–ª–æ–º–∫–∏ –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—è—é—Ç—Å—è –∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—é—Ç —Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ–∫—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π, —Ç–æ —Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫–∏ —Ç–µ—Ä–ø–µ–Ω–∏—è... –∞ —Ç–æ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ò–∑ –∑–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω–∏–≤—à–∏—Ö—Å—è –Ω–∞–∑–æ–≤—É –∞–¥—Å–∫–∏–µ ¬´–ø—è—Ç–Ω–∞—à–∫–∏¬ª —Å –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º –≤ –°—Ç–µ–∫–ª—è–Ω–Ω–æ–º –¥–≤–æ—Ä—Ü–µ (–±–æ–∂–µ...) –∏ –∫–æ–º–Ω–∞—Ç—É —Å –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º –≤ –∫—Ä–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –î—ç–≤–∞, –Ω–æ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä—å—Ç–µ –º–Ω–µ –Ω–∞ —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ ‚Äî –∏—Ö —Ç—É—Ç –Ω–∞–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ, –Ω–∞–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ!
  • –ë–æ–≥–∞—Ç—ã–µ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –¥–ª—è –±—ç–∫—Ç—Ä–µ–∫–∏–Ω–≥–∞. –í —É–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ–π–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ (–∏ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ) –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞—Ç—å—Å—è, –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –±–ª–∏–∂–µ –∫ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ –∏–≥—Ä—ã, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –≤ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–µ –≤–∞—à–∏—Ö –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –Ω–∞–¥–µ–∂–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∏—à—É—Ç—Å—è –∏ –≤–æ–ª—à–µ–±–Ω–∞—è –ª–æ–ø–∞—Ç–∞, —É–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∞—è –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–≤, –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–æ –≥—Ä–∏—Ñ–æ–Ω–∞, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ–µ –ø–æ–¥–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å —Ç—è–∂–µ—Å—Ç–∏, –∏ –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –ø–µ—Ç—É—Ö, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å –≤ –Ω–æ—Ä–∫–∏ –∏ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞–∂–∏–º–∞—Ç—å –Ω—É–∂–Ω—ã–µ –∫–Ω–æ–ø–∫–∏. –í–æ–æ–±—â–µ, –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏ –≤—Å—é –∫–∞—Ä—Ç—É –Ω–∞ 100%, –æ—Ç—ã—Å–∫–∞–≤ –≤—Å–µ —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç—ã ‚Äî –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞ –Ω–µ –∏–∑ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã—Ö, –Ω–æ –∏ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞—Ç—å –µ–µ —á–µ–º-—Ç–æ —Å–≤–µ—Ä—Ö—Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–º —Ç–æ–∂–µ –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è: –∑–∞—á–∏—Å—Ç–∏–≤ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é –æ—Ç –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤, –≤—ã –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –º–∏—Ä–Ω–æ –∏ —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –µ–µ —Ö–æ—Ç—å –¥–æ –º–æ—Ä–∫–æ–≤–∫–∏–Ω–∞ –∑–∞–≥–æ–≤–µ–Ω—å—è, –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ –Ω–µ —Å–∫–∞–∂–µ—Ç/–ø—Ä–æ—Ä—ã—á–∏—Ç/–ø—Ä–æ—à—É—Ä—à–∏—Ç.
  • –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ –∏ –∑–≤—É–∫. –ù–µ —Å–∫–∞–∂—É, —á—Ç–æ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–∫–∞ –≤ –∏–≥—Ä–µ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç –≤–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –Ω–æ –æ–Ω–∞ —è—Ä–∫–∞—è –∏ –¥–µ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è, –Ω–∞—Ä–∏—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ—Ä—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—ã –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π –≤—ã–≥–ª—è–¥—è—Ç –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –¥–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π–Ω–æ, –∞ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–∏ –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏ –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ–∑–∏–Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∫—É–∫–ª. –¢–∞–∫–∂–µ —Ö–æ—Ç–µ–ª–æ—Å—å –±—ã –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—É—é –æ–∑–≤—É—á–∫—É –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π ‚Äî –¥–∞, —Ä–µ–±—è—Ç–∞! –í—Å–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –≥–µ—Ä–æ–∏ –æ–∑–≤—É—á–µ–Ω—ã, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ –∏ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π(–∞—è) –≥–µ—Ä–æ–π(–∏–Ω—è)! ‚Äî –∏ –Ω–µ–ø–ª–æ—Ö—É—é –∑–∞–∫–∞–¥—Ä–æ–≤—É—é –º—É–∑—ã–∫—É, —á—Ç–æ, –±—ã—Ç—å –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç, –∑–≤–µ–∑–¥ —Å –Ω–µ–±–∞ –∏ –Ω–µ —Ö–≤–∞—Ç–∞–µ—Ç, –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ –æ—Ç—Ç–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç –≥–µ–π–º–ø–ª–µ–π.
–ú–ò–ù–£–°–´
–ü–ª–æ—Ç–æ—è–¥–Ω–∞—è... –Ω–æ –ª–∞–ø–æ—á–∫–∞. 
Une capture d'√©cran de Operencia: The Stolen Sun
Par : –ê–Ω–Ω–∞—ç–π—Ä–∞
  • –ü–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥ –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Ö—Ä–æ–º–∞–µ—Ç. –†–µ–¥–∫–æ, –Ω–æ, —É–≤—ã, –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –æ–≥—Ä–µ—Ö–∏ —Å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥–æ–º, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—è –Ω–µ–ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞, –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Ä–æ–¥ –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤... –∏–ª–∏ –≤–æ—Ç –∫–∞–∫ —Å –≥—Ä–∏—Ñ–æ–Ω–æ–º –Ω–∞ —Å–∫—Ä–∏–Ω—à–æ—Ç–µ –≤—ã—à–µ. –û—à–∏–±–∫–∏ –Ω–µ –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω—ã–µ.
  • –°—é–∂–µ—Ç –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π. –û–¥–Ω–∏–º –∏–∑ —Ç–µ–≥–æ–≤ –∏–≥—Ä—ã —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è ¬´–ì–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏–π —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç¬ª ‚Äî –Ω–æ –≤—ã —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –Ω–µ –≤–µ—Ä—å—Ç–µ, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É –∫–∞–∫ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è —Ç—É—Ç –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—á–Ω–∞. –í –∏–∑–≤–µ—á–Ω—É—é –ø–æ–≤–µ—Å—Ç—å –æ —Å–ø–∞—Å–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –º–∏—Ä–∞ –∏ –±–æ—Ä—å–±–µ —Å–æ –∑–ª–æ–±–Ω—ã–º –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–º (–≤—ã –Ω–µ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ, –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –¥–∞–∂–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç —Å —Ç–∞–π–Ω–∞–º–∏ —Ä–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è!) –≤–Ω–æ—Å—è—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–∏–µ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–µ —á—Ç–æ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–∂–µ–π, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –∏ –æ–Ω–∏ –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ —Ä–∞—Å–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã –¥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–∞.
–ò–¢–û–ì–û
–í —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º, ¬´–û–ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—é¬ª –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞—Ç—å –æ–¥–Ω–∏–º –∏–∑ —Å–∞–º—ã—Ö —É–¥–∞—á–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–∞—É–Ω–∂-–∫—Ä–∞—É–ª–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ –º–æ–µ–π –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–∏, –∏ –≤—Å–µ–º —Ñ–∞–Ω–∞—Ç–∞–º —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –∂–∞–Ω—Ä–∞ —è —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é –æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è —Å —ç—Ç–æ–π –∏–≥—Ä–æ–π. –û–Ω–∞ –Ω–µ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–ø–ª–∏–≤–∞ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∞, —Ü–µ–Ω–∏—Ç –≤–¥—É–º—á–∏–≤—ã–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥ –∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç –Ω–µ–º–∞–ª–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è (—Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∑–∞—á–∏—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –û–∑–µ—Ä–æ –ê–Ω–Ω—ã, —É—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–∏ —á–∞—Å–∞! –ü–æ—Ç–æ–º —è, –ø—Ä–∞–≤–¥–∞, –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–∞–ª–∞ –≥–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å—Å—è –∑–∞ 100%...), –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∞ –ø—Ä–∏ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–µ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ç—å –∑–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω–æ–π –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–µ–π –ø—Ä–æ –¥—Ä–∞–∫–æ–Ω–∞ –∏ –±–æ–±–æ–≤—ã–π —Å—Ç–µ–±–µ–ª—å, –ø–æ–¥–∫–∏–Ω—É—Ç—å –≤ –≤–∞—à —Ä—é–∫–∑–∞—á–æ–∫ —Ä–µ–ª–∏–∫–≤–∏–∏ —Å–ª–∞–≤—è–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –±–æ–≥–∞ –≥—Ä–æ–∑—ã –ü–µ—Ä—É–Ω–∞ –∏–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–≥—É–ª—è—Ç—å—Å—è –ø–æ –∫—Ä–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –î—ç–≤–∞ –∏ –∑–∞–º–∫—É –ë–∞–ª–≤–∞–Ω—å–æ—à, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –∏ –≤ –Ω–∞—à–µ–π —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞—è—Å—å –Ω–∞ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –Ω—ã–Ω–µ—à–Ω–µ–π –†—É–º—ã–Ω–∏–∏.

Operencia: The Stolen sun is really a good game.

The combat system is turn based and easy to learn.
After the tutorial you need to create your character. You can chooses between 3 classes. In game you will find new weapons, powers to use.

There are many secrets to find. Check every room and walls because it is needed. I also love the puzzles to get further in the game.
The game use a campfire to save your progress. But to use the campfire you must use wood that you need to find.

Watch here the First part of the game:

Produit re√ßu gratuitement

So the game is based on Hungarian legends. As a Hungarian I can tell that they did a pretty good job telling these old stories, and they made me feel the same way, like when I 1st heard them decades ago.

But not only the story telling is great, the combat system, the tactis required for harder fights, and the puzzles, oh my god the puzzles are amazing and really makes your brain work!

I can only reccomend this game, even if you are not a huge fan of Dungeon Crawlers. The puzzle elements will blow you away.

Sans √™tre extraordinaire, les graphismes sont acceptables pour ce type de jeu.

Gros b√©mol qui m'a fait HESITER A RECOMMANDER ce jeu, la traduction en fran√ßais.
Je passe sur certaines tournures de phrase qui ne sont pas des plus √©l√©gantes, mais je pense surtout √† certaines recettes de potions (dont la composition √† d√©couvrir est bas√©e sur le principe du Mastermin) ou les contres sens de traduction les rendent infaisables (heureusement il y a les forums !!). Ce ci est d'autant plus inadmissible que ces probl√©mes ont √©t√© remont√© en avril... 2019 !! et que pour la sortie du jeu sur steam, un an apr√®s ce n'est toujours pas corrig√© !! Non messieurs les √©diteurs ce n'est pas s√©rieux.

Ce ci √©tant dit, revenons au jeu lui m√™me.
La difficult√© est r√©glable sur diff√©rent param√®tres, soit en facile, soit en difficile (il n' y a pas d'interm√©diaire entre les deux) et c'est le mixe de ces diff√©rent param√®tre qui donnera la difficult√© globale.
Pour cr√©er votre perso, vous avez le choix entre 3 classes, guerrier, archer, magicien.
Le jeu se d√©compose en plusieurs cartes qui sont assimilables √† des donjons.
Diff√©rents feu de camps sont r√©partis sur ces cartes, ils sont fondamentaux, c'est l√† que vous pourrez sauvegarder, faire les potions (lorsque vous aurez d√©couvert le chaudron, 2eme map) , revenir sur une map ant√©rieure, composer vos √©quipes (4 persos actifs / 7 possibles) et plus tard faire du commerce. Mais surtout c'est l√† que vous pourrez vous reposer afin de r√©cup√©rer tout vos points de vie, toute votre √©nergie et refaire votre stock de popo. MAIS ATTENTION le repos n'est pas gratuit, √ßa co√ªte une b√ªche de bois, et le nombres de b√ªches de bois n'est pas illimit√© dans le jeu. Utilisez le repos avec parcimonie, si non.... et c'est toute la difficult√©.
Petite astuce, √† savoir, vos persos r√©cup√®rent toutes leur caract√©ristiques lorsqu'ils gagnent un niveau et lorsque vous terminez une map et passez √† la suivante.
Vous aurez assez rapidement 7 persos √† votre disposition, de quoi faire faire quasiment 2 √©quipes, et comme les resp√©s sont gratuites il est assez facile de faire des √©quipes coh√©rentes. Autre avantage √ßa permet de reconfigurer vos perso en fonction des mobs et du Big bos de la map.
Ne dilapidez pas non plus vos potions, car pour en refaire, le repos est obligatoire.

La dur√©e de vie du jeu est plus que correctes si on veut d√©couvrir tous les secrets de toutes les maps (43 heures et je dois en √™tre √† la moiti√© du jeu).

Operencia: The Stolen Sun: Wie fr√ºher, nur in sch√∂n!

Bei Operencia: The Stolen Sun, kurz STSS handelt es sich um ein klassischer Dungeon Crawler in einem Fantasy-Szenario, welches mit einem unverbrauchten Mythos wirbt.

Der Spieler erstellt und steuert einen Helden und seine NPC-Begleiter, gleichzeitig deren drei. Sie versuchen das R√§tsel um den bevorstehenden Untergang der Welt zu verhindern.
Der Held kann verschiedenen Arche-Klassen entspringen, die der Begleiter sind fest vorgegeben.
Das Klassensystem ist wenig komplex, auch gibt es nicht ausufernd Loot, aber so manches Set zu entdecken. Das mag f√ºr CRPG-Hardcore-Fans zu flach sein, reicht aber vollkommen aus.

Jene angesprochenen Begleiter lernt der Spieler √ºber den Verlauf der zirka 20 Stunden dauernden Kampagne kennen. Alle verfolgen ihre eigenen Ziele, haben eigene interessante Hintergr√ºnde, die f√ºr so manchen Twist sorgen.
Wir bewegen uns dabei durch verschiedene klassische als auch neue Fantasy-Szenarien: Die Schlossruine, der verzauberte Wald, eine Landschaft aus Kupfer; Aus Kupfer? Ja, einfach unverbraucht.

Es sind verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade, auch in feinen Abstufungen, w√§hlbar, aber leider nicht mehr anpassbar nach dem Spielstart. Das w√§re gerade hinsichtlich der K√§mpfe mit den verschiedenen interessanten Gegnern, die von lachhaft bis knackig sind, w√ºnschenswert.

Das Spiel selbst findet selbst in der Ich-Perspektive statt, die Bewegung erfolgt ganz klassisch ‚Äûschrittweise‚Äú pro Feld, so wie man es aus klassischen Rollenspielen kennt, als auch wieder bei modernen Vertretern, wie zum Beispiel Legend of Grimrock, sieht.
Als Treiber f√ºr das Spiel wurde die Unreal-Engine genutzt, welche sch√∂ne bis wundervolle Grafiken und gro√üartigen Sound herbeizaubert.

√úberhaupt handelt es sich bei STSS √ºber ein stilistisch sehr sch√∂nes Spiel. Das Zusammenspiel von 3D-Grafik und ‚Äûgezeichneten Scherenschnitt-Sequenzen‚Äú f√ºr die Story passen ganz wunderbar.
Auch die Musik und schon angesprochenen Sounds sind sehr treffend und stimmungsvoll.

Allerdings wirkt manches, auch durch den angesprochenen Stil etwas statisch und kulissenhaft: Au√üer den Gegnern und etwas die Umgebung ‚Äûgeht‚Äú im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes nicht viel.

Schlussendlich f√ºhlte ich mich √ºber die Spieldauer, bis auf wenige Augenblicke (Stichwort Wein-R√§tsel) und die einen oder anderen K√§mpfe sehr gut unterhalten.
Hier haben die Zen Studios, welche einigen sicher wegen ihrer Flipper-Simulatoren ein Begriff sind, einen guten Job gemacht.


Pro:
    - Sch√∂ne Pr√§sentation- Gutes Gesamtdesign- Angenehme Spieldauer

Kontra:
    - Flaches Charaktersystem- Manche R√§tsel erschlie√üen sich nicht direkt- Schwierigkeitsgrad schwankt stark


Fazit:

Trotz einiger kleiner M√§ngel ist Operencia: The Stolen Sun absolut eine Empfehlung mit, f√ºr Freunde des klassischen Dungeon Crawler erst recht.


Kaufen!

„Åù„ÅÆÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØÊñú„ÇÅ„Å´Ë¶ã„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´Ë¶ñÁ∑ö„ÅÆÊñπÂêë„ÇíÂêà„Çè„Åõ„Çã„Å®Âèñ„Çå„Åü„ÇäÁßªÂãïÂá∫Êù•„Åü„Çä„Åô„Çã„ÄÇ

20 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
4 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
2
Non recommand√©
16.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 12 juillet 2020
Great voice acting, an interesting story, and a game I would have enjoyed. But they need an easier mode. Enemies that can spawn others in an unlimited fashion, enemies that constantly taunt, to the point that you can't target some enemies that just keep summoning others. Also, enemies that seem immune to most effects. One of the starting skills for the first party member has a poison effect. Great, but just about every enemy is immune. An exercise in frustration.

Also, no mage party members, so unless you create a mage character, there won't be one in your party.

Having said all that, the game showed promise, so if Zen were to release another RPG, I'd buy it. I wanted to like this one but the game needs more balance for players who don't want to micromanage everything.
 
scrubbrush

In conclusione un dungeon crawler coi fiocchi, probabilmente il migliore da un bel po' di tempo.

Actualmente soy un jugador exclusivo de VR, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• simuladores, Shoters, deportes, etc...., cualquier cosa que sea ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• gafas de VR, los juegos de monitor ya no me seducen. Pero hay que reconocer que todavia hay carencias en los juegos de VR en cuanto a variedad, pero realmente la industria no necesita desde mi opinion hacer juegos exclusivos, simplemente, muchos de los juego de monitor adaptarlos y que sean compatibles ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• la VR. y eso es lo que ofrece este Operencia: The Stolen Sun: un clasico juego de monitor para poder disfrutar en VR.
Asi que solo puedo darlmis felicitacuones y recomendar este juego porque jugablemente tambien se lo merece

Recommand√©
10.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 26 avril 2020
After 5 hours I think I know the loop enough to recommend this game. Basically, if you liked Lands of Lore 1 and 2, you will like this game. It's a very good one of those, which is a "good" thing. I haven't played a Dungeon Crawler that captured that old-school feel in quite some time. I didn't get it from Might and Magic X, which felt too combat-heavy and I didn't get it from Grimrock, which seemed to puzzle-heavy for my liking. This is just the right amount of combat, puzzles, and story and the gameplay flow feels very similar to the first Lands of Lore, which I loved.
 
Cabel_Blacke

+–†–∞–∑–Ω–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ –±–æ–∏ , –Ω–∞ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ —Å–≤–æ—è —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ —É –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤
+–£–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å, –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–º–∞–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –≥–µ—Ä–æ—è–º–∏ –∏ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –æ–±—É—á–∞–ª–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –≤–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –∫—É—Ä—Å –¥–µ–ª–∞.
–ú–∏–Ω—É—Å—ã:
–õ–∏—á–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è –∏—Ö –Ω–µ—Ç –Ω–æ:
-–õ–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω—ã–π —Å—é–∂–µ—Ç, —Ç—É—Ç –Ω–µ—Ç –æ–≥—Ä–æ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞ –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –≤ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥ , –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –æ–±–¥—É–º–∞—Ç—å —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â—É—é –ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏—é –¥–ª—è –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è. –í —ç—Ç–æ–π –∏–≥—Ä–µ –≤—Å–µ —á–µ—Ç–∫–æ –∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –Ω–∏–∫—É–¥–∞ —Å–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è.
-–ù–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–π –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä —Å–∫–∏–ª–æ–≤, –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤ –∏ –∞–π—Ç–µ–º–æ–≤ . –ö–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –º–∞–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ç–æ –Ω–æ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–æ –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏.
–í—ã–≤–æ–¥:
–î–ª—è –º–µ–Ω—è —ç—Ç–æ –ª—É—á—à–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –≤ —Å–≤–æ–µ–º —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ –∑–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –ø–∞—Ä—É –ª–µ—Ç. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ Lords of Xulima –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥ –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏ –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ–≥–æ.
–í—Å–µ–º –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º –†–ü–ì –ø–æ —Ç–∏–ø—É Might and Magic –ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ. –ò –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º —ç—Ç–æ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è –∏ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∏–≥—Ä–∞ –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ª—é–±–æ–º—É —Ñ–∞–Ω–∞—Ç—É –†–ü–ì –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–π—Ç–∏.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 avril 2020
Very smooth Snark in this game that I love, the characters are lively and enjoyable with great voice acting. I think my only major complaint is how Monster's can SUMMON other monsters that instantly act(More often than not using Taunt which makes them sole focus for attacks) and then they back and forth the Taunt skill making it irritatingly grueling to fight Bosses and Some encounters since the chip damage leaves you wide open to the heavy hits enemies can land.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 avril 2022
No grinding whatsoever, so things to discover and monsters to kill MUST be done in precise succession. Puzzles do not bring anything fun to the game. Some monsters are so OP, the fights becomes too long and too painful to bear. Randomization in fight are too ... random: you can kill a boss in 1 shot or it takes dozens and dozens of turns to do it. Truly not fun, and I started to play RPGs when Wizardry I came out in the 80s.... so so much for the so called "old-school".
 
Croix de Guerre
208 produits enregistr√©s
0
4 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
67.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 avril 2023
This game is an absolute gem. I haven't seen a REALLY good dungeon crawler since Grimrocks - and this is it. Finally!

However, the "mandatory" Grimrock comparison isn't really valid. In fact, tile-based movement is just about the only thing Operencia has in common with these two masterpieces. Which doesn't stop it from being a masterpiece in its own right, as far as I'm concerned.

So, what do we have here?

Exploration and looks.
So, movement is tile-based. But the camera is completely free: you can look around as much as you like, and sometimes, something gets placed in a "special" way. Don't panic: the game doesn't abuse it (or provides hints).

Locations are 3D and have multiple floors as well as different heights within a single "floor". Pits also exist, but they are few and never used to access anything that you can't reach otherwise. Occasionally there are elevators and other means of vertical travel.

All of it looks gorgeous and diverse. Music is awesome too, with a unique theme for each location - if a bit repetitive at times, since it plays constantly without pauses.

Party.
In Operencia, you only create your main character. The rest of your party consists of unique characters who join you as the story progresses. There are 6 companions in total, and max party size is 4 (main + 3 others). You can change party at campfires (universal "hubs" for everything from saving to alchemy and trading), but the story and narrative assumes that they all travel together. So, inactive characters get full experience and participate in dialogue.

There are no classes as such. Instead, everyone has a skill tree with 3 branches. Most (not all) of these are unique. What's NOT obvious about skills is that they do get more effective as you level up (e.g. get better success rates). There are also 6 attributes (strength etc). You get 3 points per level, but bonuses can also be gained via skill trees and, of course, items (up to +10 bonus).

There are also FREE redistribute buttons! Yes, you can respec your characters anytime, as many times as you like. If you play with hard combat, you'll probably have to do it multiple times. Leveling up "correctly" doesn't matter that much in the first half of the game, but things get a lot more painful later, and not everything can be "fixed" by items (especially if you can't even wear them).

Setting, story and dialogue.
Operencia has a mildly intriguing setting based on Hungarian (and other) folklore, with a tiny bit of history in the mix. Three worlds, World Tree, Sun God, dragons, griffins, fairy curses, stars from heaven in human form, Attila the Hun - you have it all. The story has most of the standard "unexpected" turns and revelations. But it's neither dull, nor confusing. Constant lighthearted party banter helps too (there's a lot of it).

Secrets.
If you are one of those taught by Grimrock to walk around wall-hugging, looking for hidden buttons - relax. There are just 3 buttons in the whole game, and they are hard to miss. There are some illusionary walls, which can also be noticed with relative ease because they are semi-transparent. Light sources located nearby make it even easier. Other secrets are either puzzle-based, item-based or artifact-based.

ARTIFACTS!
This is one of the best features of Operencia! As you progress, you'll find unique items which give you new abilities. You'll need them to progress, but they are also used for secrets. And a lot of these require artifacts which are obtained later in the story (sometimes MUCH later), so you'll have to backtrack to find them all. This adds a bit of a "metroidvanic" vibe to the game, which adds a lot to the fun, so I won't spoil any details.

Backtracking.
Old locations can be revisited once you finish the first 3. Then, you are completely free to backtrack, with just one obvious (and temporary) exception. The game does give you a lot of "no-return" warnings, but really, you can just ignore them. No matter what it says, you CAN go back. Only the final battle is, well, FINAL: once your start it, you win the game or you die (no post-gameplay).

Puzzles.
Puzzles are there. Not nearly as much in Grimrock and not nearly as challenging. There are standard ones which you've seen a hundred times and probably hate by now. There are unique ones. Some rely on artifacts. None are particularly hard, and the worst part is that the devs somehow managed to make a great old-school game without respecting their players' brains - so they made your companions give lots of unwanted hints, ruining about 90% puzzles which were easy to begin with...

Alchemy.
Alchemy is... weird. When you find a "recipe", instead you get a riddle describing various properties of the ingredients. You need to solve it by arranging these properties correctly. You don't have to collect the actual ingredients. You just get the potion with a limited number of "charges" (yeah, I know it should be "doses" - go tell the devs), which can be replenished by resting. Oh, and you'll need a cauldron first.

Saving and resting.
There are some autosaves (depending on your difficulty settings). To save manually, you have to visit a campfire. There, you can also do other things (more unlock as you progress), but primarily - rest by spending "firewood" (limited resource) to replenish your HP, energy and potions. Contrary to some of the game's wording, you DO NOT need to spend firewood to save!

Combat.
Unlike Grimrock, where you kite monsters in real-time on the same maps you are exploring, Operencia uses a classic turn-based system. You see a monster on the map, you approach, you switch into combat mode and the monster becomes 3-5 monsters... The only thing that matters before the combat is whether you approach from behind to ambush, or get ambushed yourself. Ambushing side gets an initiative bonus for the first turn.

In battle, enemies are positioned in 3 lines by distance: close, medium, far. This is unchangeable: killing the frontliners does NOT move the rest closer! You can attack anyone with any weapon (e.g. far line with a dagger), unless someone *taunted* you. The distance just scales the attack's damage according to its own "efficiency graph" (visible in UI).

Your party does NOT have front/back lines. The enemies attack whoever they want, the best way to prevent it (well, except AOE) is the infamous Taunt ability... Problem is - for the most of the game it is YOUR ENEMIES who spam Taunt against you! Only a couple of skills can counter it, and they have ridiculously high energy cost and cooldown, making a lot of fights infuriatingly hard, sometimes impossible without just the right setup. Hello unlimited respecs...

There are also rechargeable "party skills", but they are unlocked gradually as you progress.

Combat UI is severely lacking in terms of giving information. Tooltips mention "weapon damage" without ever saying what it is. Enemies are labeled "Elite" without telling you what it means (hint: you can't instakill them). Attack animations mix with idle animations, damage/immunity flyouts are quick and color-coded, so it's easy to miss what happens and hard to understand why: there is no combat log whatsoever!

Still, somehow, the combat manages to be quite fun between all the frustrations. I played with "hard" combat and had a good challenge, but never really got stuck. I even managed to clear out the final location with just one rest (right before the final battle), and I still had 8 spare units of firewood. There really are more than enough other ways to conserve and replenish your resources if you pay attention to all of the game's features. But if you just rest after each battle or two, I guess you'll run out quickly...

Good news: mobs don't respawn!

To sum it up: if you love dungeon crawlers, you should definitely play this. Operencia can be very frustrating at times, but it is totally worth it!
 
Bavovnyatko
