√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 avril 2020
A first-person dungeon crawler, much like Legend of Grimrock 2, but it is really polished, the monsters, skill, spell, and weapon combat are great, tons to explore, and it looks amazing. Top notch.

Please follow my curator page, Designer Plays, for a truly massive number of concise and honest reviews from a 25-year veteran Game Designer.

231 produits enregistr√©s

2 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
16.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 avril 2020
This is so good that it will appeal to many people who don't even typically enjoy dungeon crawlers. It's very intuitive. Looks nice with many appealing effects and unusual visuals. Sounds great. The story is actually not complete garbage, lol.

I wish I could hire other party members and create my own, but I don't hate the ones you're given, either. Overall, it's a very solid game.

Edit: I'm updating to somewhere between recommended and not. First, if you didn't make your character a mage, your damage output will be so slow that the game feels like a slog (fortunately, I did make a mage).

And even with a mage, combat becomes too much of a chore later. It's trading lots of misses, which is never fun, and everything takes way too long to kill.

I still did enjoy other aspects of the game, so it wasn't a complete waste. The potion making was my favorite thing in the whole game, it's a like a little logic puzzle. The "find the runes with the light" thing was pretty cool, too. Other items like the feather are creative and unique as well. For a sequel, I'd just want better combat with more damage from non-mages and it'd be a great game.
 
night4
0
6 personnes ont trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

Non recommand√©
1.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 d√©cembre 2020
I suppose the game is fun for the right person or the right expectations, however:
1. it is not suited for VR, which I bought it for.
2. You don't move freely, you move from tile to tile. No movement in combat at all.
3. If you dont have a good memory you will have a hard time with this game. Where did you find that puzzle which needed this object? Which stairs and floors are you done exploring? If you can't remember you'll have to run around and check. You cant put notes on the map.
4. The game is shallow, rather simple, there isn't much depth or content to it. Not worth the money IMO.
 
Cognitive

√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 mars 2021
Game is unplayable in VR if you have Valve Index or htc VIVE controllers. Between the two different control schemes the game half works on each :) Presumably, it must work for Facebook users, otherwise this isn't an actual game.

Nonetheless, impossible VR mode aside, the flat game is still very good. I already finished it on Xbox One and don't regret buying it a second time or the non-functional VR mode.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 mars 2021
Doesn't properly detect Index controllers, well sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.
It's completely unacceptable that the extremely lazy devs haven't had enough brain power combined to figure out something very simple like adding Index controller support. Have to refund this garbage. A pity though, when my controllers occasionally worked, the game was kinda fun. Sigh.
Btw, even using a GTX 1080, I got solid 90 fps using Index res 200%, so performance and image quality are really awesome - if only I could move, double sigh...

30.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 janvier
I was really unsure about this. Years passed while I was affraid of Operencia.

I've read the reviews, and most of them said that Operencia is not a really fun game.
But I think those reviews are wrong. I admit, that the graphics is not the best,
but other than that the puzzles are great, the story is lovely and the secrets are cool as well.
Maybe because of the preconception and but I really loved it.

If you liked Legend of Grimrock I think you should give Operencia a try.

A very fun DRPG that doesn't overstay it's welcome. Systems are just complex enough for the length of the game, and the puzzles are thoughtful without being too taxing. Makes me wish for modern remakes of some of the old Might and Magic games.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 6 aout 2023
Also es ist jetzt schon eine Weile her, dass ich es gespielt habe, aber wollte trotzdem nochmal meine Meinung dalassen. Habe gerade angefangen Legend of Grimrock 2 zu spielen, daher kam mir der Gedanke.
Operencia ist (meiner Meinung nach) noch besser wie die beiden Legend of Grimrock Teile (Welche nat√ºrlich auch gut sind).

Bei Operencia gef√§llt mir die Story bzw. diese Dialoge zwischendurch ganz gut, die Steuerung ist butterweich und die ganzen Funktionen und die Steuerung sind wirklich gut.

Ich kann das Spiel nur empfehlen, wenn jemand Dungeon Crawler mag ;-)

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

Recommand√©
22.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 26 juillet 2023
A solid first person dungeon crawler, though with a scope much greater than just the dungeons. Feels much less polished as the game goes on, as the combat grows increasingly annoying to deal with and certain areas begin to outstay their welcome.
I would highly recommend you play a Mage, as the companions the game provides are excellent substitutes for the Warrior and Hunter (warrior-type companions are plentiful).
Pick it up if you like the genre, if you are unsure then I would recommend a better first person dungeon crawler.
 
Humongous Idiot

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
30.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 janvier 2023
This is a really fun and enjoyable game. If you like the old school turn based combat, exploration and puzzle solving, then this is highly recommended, it took me back to my days of playing the Might & Magic series and even the Eye of the Beholder trilogy. I think this is a very well thought out game, the interactions between the characters is in depth and amusing at times, as you eventually have access to many characters, so that when needed you can form a strong party equipped for any situation, I also found the main story very interesting.
 
Kalto
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
36.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 29 novembre 2022
Why do I recommend this one?
I am Hungarian and this was made by Hungarians. Of course, they included Hungarian proverbs and tales from Hungarian literature. Let's say that Kelemen K≈ëm√≠ves was neither a woman nor a lesbian, but let's see this as a poetic freedom. The game is well developed, has a lot of content, is quite long and therefore not expensive.
Counterarguments:
Many places in the game are very difficult even on the easiest level! There were times when I failed to do it even after many retries. It's important to have the right characters and abilities right from the start or you'll be starting over.
 
garkas

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
25.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 juin 2022
I think it was a pretty fun game, with only 2 endgame issues players should be aware of. The game looks nice, it loads fast and has decent characters, even if the leveling up is not very exciting and the loot/shop items are uninteresting (with the exception of the set items). I enjoyed reading out the lore which is pretty rare for me. The game has the good amount of combat, puzzles and secrets.

In the final level there's a sliding puzzle which can't be skipped or reset. I lost 1h trying to solve it, and ended up following a 10m video on Youtube of a player who solved it. Developers should stop putting them in games, as they are the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• puzzle conceived. The final battle is a battle of attrition, but you can use direct damage skills (not AOE) on the special "thing" (not to spoil it). There is also a secret revive potion in one of the levels, it's better to find it.
 
Slimu

If you are a fan of classic dungeon crawlers or liked games like Legend of Grimrock, Vaporum and Bard's Tale you should absolutely give Operencia a try. I randomly came across it during the summer sale, tried out the demo and proceeded to buy the game before even finishing the prologue chapter. I was surprised how well this game is made. The only issue I have is that lot of the items you find or buy will be useless by the time u get them and some abilities aren't very viable. But I would still give the game 8,5 or 9 out of 10.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 12 avril 2022
Interesting alchemy "crafting". This game is light on combat and big on puzzles.
Lots and lots of secrets in every area.

Do you like grids and finding bizarre ways to open doors?

A unique artstyle, too. Painterly himbos everywhere.

Voice actors are great. I'm enjoying the banter as it goes.

Combat isn't hard. Even on 'hard mode'.

This game is all about the environmental puzzles and paying attention.

‚òê Bad

‚òë Good
‚òê Average
‚òê Bad

Score
‚òê Masterpiece
‚òë Good
‚òê Average
‚òê Bad
‚òê Awful

Comment
Story is awesome, Hungarian Mythology well explained and accurately portraied. The world is amazing to say the least, unique art style accompanied by great music, lore accurate as well. Unreal Engine has its flaws so the game is unnecessarily heavy to run, it is what it is. Gameplay hides interesting puzzles and quests, combat is unsatisfying, effects, skills, are well made but seem dull. In conclusion if you're looking for a great adventure with a never seen before scenery and don't care much about combat, this is it!

√âvaluation publi√©e le 22 octobre 2021
Generally a pretty decent dungeon-crawler hex-grid party based RPG. Sound and music are pretty good. Graphics are fine, depending on the area even pretty. Gameplay is fairly decent. Story is interesting and characters are likeable, if somewhat flat.

What ruined the experience for me was the unskippable dragon puzzzle in the end. I will likely not get to finish the game because of this. The other puzzles are not that hard to solve and are okay. But really why such a tedious puzzle at the end? Why? Who thought this was a great idea?
 
Deez Nuts

Recommand√©
11.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 20 septembre 2021
I'm giving this a thumbs up for the 60% discount; otherwise, I feel it's too expensive. This is a phone port, not designed for VR. Like most ports, it's absolutely better in VR, but it's still a port, and suffers from unintuitive controls. It can also be very slow - fine for a phone game, not so much for immersion.

The video and screenshots in the store are spot on. What they don't do justice for is the voice acting and story. If that's your thing, consider Operencia.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 8 juillet 2021
If you ever want to see old RPG classics in the style of "Dungeon Master" or "Eye of the Beholder" and similar, but evolved to modern 3D graphics, sound ,storyline, etc., Operencia is your game!
It was a really refreshing experience in an uncommon setup which was - to my knowledge - not used before. So if you are looking for a game with story, RPG elements, dungeons and puzzles, plus some tactical combat and a setting which is not overused, you will have fun.

Recommand√©
39.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 17 juin 2021
Opherencia is a good game with a few ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.
+The Dungeon Crawling Aspekt and the visuals are nice. If you like classic dungeon crawling go for it.
-The Story didnt catch me at all.
-The Soundtrack didnt catch me.
-The Characters are kinda boring.
-The Fights and the balancing are somewhat hard to get. Basically strength melee characters > everything else because having 200 strg gives you more dmg on melee then 200 int on magic. Roughe characters are useless because you need high agility but die in the first rounds. I made my character a tank with over 100 vitality. She was almost invincible against melee attacks and in the last dungeon the only reason why I still won the fights: Evasion is a pain.
--You get instant help with the puzzles from the characters which makes it to easy at times. But also sometimes i couldnt pass on without internet guide because I couldnt find that one single spot where i need to go/be/look at.
-----------
Its not a AAA Game therefor a fair deal. Go for it.
 
Tryerror
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
40.0 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 mai 2021
Operencia is a really nice dungeon scrawler, I enjoyed it as much as Dungeon of Grimrock 1 and 2.
The story, without revolutionizing the genre, justifies to go through beautiful sceneries (I played on 2D screen, but the game exists now in VR) and puts in place characters that enhance the lore of the game.
The combat system differs from what is usually done in dungeon scrawlers, as here we have a separate turn-based combat phase, like JRPGs. This gives a much greater tactical dimension than the classic hit and run.
We find all the classics of the genre: secrets to find, treasures to unearth and puzzles to solve, stuff to loot, the game is faultless and makes you want to finish it 100%.
Congratulations to the developers, I can't wait for episode 2!
 
PouleMoule

√âvaluation publi√©e le 7 juin 2021
An excellent game in grid based CRPG style. The story is fresh, the characters develop over time, and are well voiced. A few of the puzzles are difficult but none of them felt unfair. Free respecs let you try out many builds with little risk, and there's enough content for keep you going for a while.

Very wholesome game. In many ways it is better than HoMM X especially storywise. Characters have some depth and puzzles are fun enough. I think this is best modern game in this genre at this moment.

DeN_DarK
717 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
33.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 mai 2021
A good attempt at a modern/simplified take on a traditional RPG

Operencia: The Stolen Sun is a somewhat simplified take on traditional RPGs, such as the Wizardry, Bard's Tale, and Might & Magic series. Your party of adventurers will be exploring dungeons from a first-person perspective while fighting turn-based battles.

The game begins with you creating your own character, but from then on you will be unlocking new party members as you make progress in the game. You ultimately will unlock six party members, and once unlocked you can freely swap these characters in and out of your party of four active characters (including yourself). Characters differ mainly in their skill trees; each character has three branches in their skill tree, with each branch typically representing a "role" akin to those in MMOs: tank, healer, support caster, damage caster, etc. Skill trees contain a good mix of active and passive abilities, and your choice of abilities really does make quite a difference in how each character plays.

The game is extremely linear, as you progress from one dungeon to the next, with a boss fight at the end of each dungeon. You can go back and revisit dungeons you've already cleared to seek out enemies and secrets you missed the first time around, and the game provides a helpful counter on the map screen indicating how many chests, secrets, etc. you've missed. The dungeons are not particularly large, but they are designed pretty well and are generally packed full of encounters, secrets, and puzzles. Exploring these dungeons is definitely a highlight here.

Like most modern takes on this type of game (The Bard's Tale IV, Might & Magic X, Lords of Xulima), there are no random encounters and enemies do not respawn; once you defeat a group of enemies, you can explore that area hassle-free to solve puzzles and find secrets. Although I am not a fan of fixed, non-respawning encounters, this works fine in a linear game like Operencia. You can reset and reassign attribute and ability points at any time, so you will never find yourself stuck with a subpar party.

The difficulty level peaks early on and then quickly drops off from around the halfway point; this might disappoint players looking for a constant (or rising) challenge, but I enjoyed feeling increasingly powerful as the game went on. It ends with a great multi-stage boss fight that isn't very difficult, but feels suitable epic.

The game promises "a world inspired by Central European mythology," so I was disappointed to find that it's mostly your standard wizards and warriors slaying skeletons and dragons in caves. There is a real focus on story and characters in this game, but I found neither to be interesting; the party constantly bickers back and forth like a bunch of elderly couples stuck together on a cruise around the world, and the script is a 50/50 mix of wordy exposition and zingers that are hardly ever funny. Having said that, there are some nice environments in the second half of the game that look great and are pretty unique (the Copper Forest is definitely a highlight).

Overall, though, I enjoyed my time with Operencia. It's worth getting over the difficulty hurdle a few hours in and sticking with it.
 
newtmonkey
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

Not for everyone, but right for me.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 avril 2021
Old school style turn-based RPG, grid-based movement. Reminds me a lot of Might and Magic. I enjoyed it, though there are some unusual quirks.
1. I still have no idea how combos recharge.
2. There is a limit to the number of skills each character may equip, and only 1 potion each.
3. Instead of going places and meeting new merchants, there's only one in game.
4. No grinding, gonna figure out how to proceed if you can't beat the boss.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 13 f√©vrier 2021
I liked the game's universe based on Hungarian folklore and fairy tales.
Operencia is an old-school turn-based RPG, a dungeon crawler.
Music is good, puzzles and difficulty are challenging
Visually, it's ok, sometimes I felt, it could have been better, but it's ok.
Conversations are simple, and I'm not impressed with the HUD.
Anyway, I enjoyed playing with it, and I can recommend it to any RPG fan, especially for the ones who like old-school dungeon crawler, turn-based RPG games - other players may find it frustrating, or will be disappointed.

Du≈ºƒÖ ilo≈õƒá sekret√≥w na mapach idzie odkryƒá tylko poprzez zdobycie pewnych artefakt√≥w w p√≥≈∫niejszych etapach gry a potem powr√≥t na poprzednie mapy. Fabu≈Ça w miarƒô poprawna i przyjemna, zako≈Ñczenie sugeruje kolejnƒÖ czƒô≈õƒá (choƒá to wiadomo ≈ºe zale≈ºy od sprzeda≈ºy) Rozw√≥j postaci i towarzysze te≈º poprawnie - ka≈ºdy zapewnia inny gameplay i zestaw umiejƒôtno≈õci.
 
heolaerialis
397 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
32.5 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 d√©cembre 2020
I want to counter all naysayers who complain about the following things

1) No consumables in game, yes the consumables are not there instead you get limited use spells. I find that rather good design because in most games I tend to hoard and or farm consumables for the rainy day...and never use them anyway. Here they are limited use spells each character has only 1 slot so tough choices. And potions are not cluttering my inventory!

2) Respecing character stats and spells at will. I read lots of complaints about this too in many reviews. This seemed in the beginning very strange but this feature is actually integral part of the game. You just NEED to do it constantly to succeed so this is a part of the game. Otherwise some encounters already in the beginning would be very very frustrating. Later you can swap party members but in the beginning you have no other choice. I am enjoying tinkering my party members and changing their focus.

3) Complaints about puzzles. I find puzzles entertaining with some neat ideas and fun special tools. And it is hilarious how party members comment the actions of the protagonist.

All in all It is a fun little game with unique Hungarian lore, so you will hear genuine Hungarian names:)
 
mudakonn

The story presentation is very fairy tale like and the subtle Hungarian mythology elements gives the world of Operencia quite its uniqueness. I especially liked to listen to the character conversations around the campfire. Regarding the gameplay, Operencia revolves around exploring and puzzle solving and fighting with the fights being turn based where one can come up with nice combos from the skills of any of the four selected characters. All in all, I would recommed it to any fantasy rpg fan.

Good amount of loot and levelling up characters gives you a good amount of options on how you want the to support the party.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 26 novembre 2020
–®–∏–∫–∞—Ä–Ω—ã–π –¥–∞–Ω–∂–∏–æ–Ω-–∫—Ä–∞—É–ª–µ—Ä! –û–ª–¥—Å–∫—É–ª –∏ –≤—Å—ë —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ. –ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫ –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö—Ä–∞–º—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç, –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –º–µ—à–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ–≥—Ä—É–∑–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –∏–≥—Ä—É. –û—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –µ—Å–ª–∏ –∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ç—å –≤ VR. –ì—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ. –ó–≤—É–∫ —Ç–æ–∂–µ. –ù–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∏–≥—Ä–æ–∫–∏ –∂–∞–ª—É—é—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ—Ç—É –±–æ–µ–≤–∫–∏... –Ω–æ –º–Ω–µ –Ω–∞–æ–±–æ—Ä–æ—Ç –ø–æ–Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –Ω–µ—Å–ø–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –±–æ–µ–≤–æ–π —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã. –ï—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–∫–∞—á–∫–∞ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–∞ —Å –Ω–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ –æ–±–∏–ª–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ –ø–∞—Å—Å–∏–≤–∫–∞–º–∏. –ö—É—á–∞ –ª—É—Ç–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏–µ –ø–æ–≤–µ—Ä—Ö–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–µ–ª–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –†–ü–ì. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –µ—Å—Ç—å VR —à–ª–µ–º –∏ –≤—ã –ª—é–±–∏—Ç–µ —Ñ–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–∑–∏, —Ç–æ –±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ.
 
bob0
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
0.3 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 novembre 2020
The UI and experience are absolutely awful in VR. Opening cutscenes don't make it clear which way "forward" is, which is disorienting. Spawns a Windows Firewall prompt that can only be answered on desktop, which resulted in a glitchy pause screen over the opening (with sound effects) that I was _about_ to ctrl+alt+del out of as a softlock, before it sort of recovered itself. Opening dialog alternates between subtitled and not-subtitled. The game does not make it clear when you're frozen in place for a cutscene vs. when you aren't. Party members are invisible voices in your head. No debuff icons.

No indication which party member an attack hit, unless you're specifically watching the turn order meter instead of the combat visual effects. Action prompts are not reliable. Enemy status text is Z-ordered in front of the enemy even when the enemy model geometrically occludes it, which is a bad and headache-inducing look in VR.

A turn-based grid-based game in VR will always feel a little odd; that's okay, it's something of a novelty. But it would work _much_ better with a third-person camera, and a complete rethink of how to present information to a VR player. Most of the UI hovers in a flat plane in the "forward" direction, which sometimes becomes disaligned with the direction that combat is going in. It's got the exact 16:9 aspect ratio of a modern monitor, so this is clearly the screen edge UI of the flat view of the game. However, it's placed too close to feel comfortable and too far to the edges to be easily seen. A traditional RPG interface is difficult to design for VR; there are many different approaches and none of them are really satisfying, so it's a difficult problem to solve, but here it has also not been solved.

Probably okay in 2D except for the lack of subtitle configuration and possibly opening-scene weirdness (I don't know what's VR-specific and what's a general part of the program's behavior). I feel like this was a sloppy VR conversion and there's a lot of _potential_ here but the UI needs to be completely redesigned.
 
Kistaro
1,551 produits enregistr√©s

√âvaluation publi√©e le 25 octobre 2020
Old school in spirit but a very nice looking game. I loved the beautiful artwork and level design reasonably strategic combat and creative puzzles, The game is pretty linear which I didn't mind. There are few jokes here and there that are mostly funny and the game is long enough to feel finished but short enough to not get to repetitive, definite must have for anyone who remembers grid based games of the old days.

The only negative mention would be some puzzles (very few, not to spoil anything) that are quite annoying (if I wanted a puzzle game I'd get one) but the overall impression is still clearly positive.

Wuzaor
1,375 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
43.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 28 septembre 2020
As a dungeon crawler, this game is quite interesting, and the VR option (which I haven¬¥t tried) makes it even more so, mostly due to the puzzles and the secrets scattered all over the different levels that are not as unique as they could, but all of them paint an interesting picture.

Plot-wise, the game is clear, something has happened and the signs are telling you to go recover the Sun, the different characters form different stories that are connected. And in that regard, wanted to mention that this is one of the few games that explore Eastern Europe mythology making it extra interesting for those of us that know a bit but not enough.

Exploration-wise this game is a shiny gem, due to the full control of the camera, making the secrets hard but not impossible to spot exploring everything is usually welcome, and since there are no random encounters, exploration does not become a boring task.

Battle-wise the game is... unpolished. Initial levels are OK, but difficulty has many spikes that forced me to stop using the hunter MC since the damage output was not enough for the difficulty at the time, when the game keeps throwing you hp sponges in groups of 5 with not enough AoE in your team to counter or survive them. At the time I was a bit green regarding the game mechanics, so maybe it was my fault, but the Mage MC is just amazingly better.

Speaking of game mechanics, I do believe the game could use better or deeper explanations to help new players understand their skills/stats better.

Example of this lack of information is the way damage goes, every 10 points of the skill main stat (STR/AGI/INT) increase the damage of the skill, meaning that 27 STR is close to the same than 20. Another example would be that for archers, the melee weapons extra abilities (text in white underneath damage), are applied to long range attacks (and some of them even to spells (I am not 100% sure)).

Music is memorable and some areas have very soothing OST, cannot speak about graphics since my laptop can only run on minimum, but even if nothing was crazy impressive, it wasn¬¥t cheap either.

If you like dungeon crawlers, this is a nice one, if you don¬¥t, is still an interesting story, to enjoy as new players to the genre.
 
Clead HeavenHell
0

Muy bueno. Bastante innovador en cuanto al movimiento teclado-rat√≥n. Los gr√°ficos recuerdan a borderlands pero sin las l√≠neas negras tipo c√≥mic. Los rompecabezas progresan en dificultad sin llegar a resultar frustrantes. Los combates son por turnos sin desplazamiento, eso puede no gustar a los amantes del frenes√≠, pero no se tarda en otorgar una dispensa acompa√±ada de una sonrisa. Eso s√≠, el plantel de hechizos y habilidades no es muy extenso, pero est√°n muy conseguidos que es lo importante. En otros juegos en los que hay muchos, uno siempre acaba utilizando los cuatro o cinco favoritos. En RV es muy divertido, superando al fabuloso Grimrock. La √∫nica nota negativa ser√≠a el precio, puesto que la cantidad de horas empleadas y recursos que requiere programar √©ste tipo de juego no lo justifica, pero esperad a que est√© de oferta y... Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
1
Recommand√©
18.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 septembre 2020
Finally a classic turn-based RPG in VR. I love it. I really love this. I've been waiting for something like this since I first tried VR. I have nothing bad to say about it. It even seems longer than most VR content. I got through the first dungeon and it looks like I'm nowhere close to finished the game. It's great, because we need stuff you can play seated, relaxed and with a controller if you want. I want a hundred more games like this.

Anyone who gives this a bad review would give any classic turn-based game a bad review, because they're just one of those people who want action games or don't like the style of the classics. Finally a developer gets that we're not all the same so we can have some more variety in the types of game we can play. This is literally the first RPG I've played that's not an action RPG in VR after 5 years of owning a Rift and I'm not disappointed now. If you like classic turn-based RPGs, definitely get this. I hope we get a hundred more like it.
 
tempestmichael

Recommand√©
5.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 septembre 2020
Warm and Fuzzy!
This for me is like coming from the cold self-destructing world outside, and getting into a nice warm candlelit bath with a glass of mulled wine: A reminder of when games were simple, but well structured and interesting - and when life was too! Only now with updated graphics and man....VR!!!I never thought I would ever see the day when I could actually enter the game, and actually be in one of those old dungeon crawlers. I played through most of the game (on Epic Game Store,), and then bought it again on Steam and started from the top in VR. It is a whole new deal in VR - so immersive and so - well... enchanting (there is a word I almost forgot existed). The VR purists (of which I am, at times, one) will moan and bit-ch about lack of controller support (works just fine with a Xbox controller - get over it!), of the way the menus are not congruent with VR, How they should be able to crawl around in their VR den interacting with objects etc etc. Younger games, who were not brought up on Dungeon Master, and all though old grid based games, will not be able to re-imagine the magic of those games and will complain about the grid based movement.[one criticism that will be levelled, that I will agree with, is he lack of graphical options. Don't get me wrong, the game looks just fine - but not as sharp or detailed as the flat version, and I am sure my rig could squeeze out a little more fidelity.]But in a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• world, I am so grateful to slump back in a chair, leave it all behind and breathe a sigh of escapism. So, cast your preconceptions aside, immerse yourself and go with the flow - and you will get hours and hours of harmless escapism and joy from this. I am like a kid in a candy store with a big grin on his face - relieved of the burden of cynicism and criticism, I am free to just soak up and old school solid gaming experience, and old time story-telling in a whole new level of immersion. I love the game and love the studio for bringing this to me - it is (at this time) *just* what I want.(sorry for the lack of formatting - something weird on Steam side)
 
dunninger
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Non recommand√©
29.6 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 septembre 2020
Is this a game that could be the perfect purchase? Yes. Is it the perfect purchase? No. The game has amazing graphics. Perfect colours and characters that are ok. Music is a masterpiece. Great job too. But the game lacks of fair play. What do i mean. You are a great player and go smoothly into the game. You level up fairly good. You get extra moves and spells. If you have mana all is good. If you dont game nine over ten times wins. You wont stand a chance. Your basic attack gives 4 and 5 damage and the opponent gives four times more. In more advanced levels you will encounter enemies that stun you or frighten you. This means. You wont be able to move. Probably you wont be able to do anything from the first round. So, how do you recharge stamina? from camps. randomly placed in the maps. But is just only this? Nooooo, you must have find limited sticks or woods to rest, otherwise you must buy them. How many are there? 3 at most if you get them they spawn again whenever the game wants. So in the end you do crazy maths and economy to heal your mana and energy and still it wont be enough. What about the weapons armor and magical equipment. I am feeling sorry for the guy who designed those perfect swords and shields etc. Also the one who gave great names but the weapons and other stuff , especially those in the market are pretty useless. You are almost ending the game m and you get to fine a nice fancy sword. Is better than the one you have?? NOOO. So what is the point. This keeps happening in the most objects to be fair. not all. Saving is also a pain in the head. you can only save in the camps. Why?? Why?? and then there is an option save and exit? where will you begin next time? in the camp? in the place you exit? in space? where? I m seriously thinking of quiting the game and play something else.

Edit: i ve reached final boss. Totally inhuman. Bye.
 
Velerefontis

largelies
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
14.8 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 30 juin 2020
This one was a tough yes. It is sort of a blobber, but it really works more like a puzzle game. You can only create one character of your party and then you get to pick and choose from others as the game goes on (This is to help drive the story, but I do like to build my groups). Monsters do not respawn. You can't grind and get any better; you will just move along the same monsters killed as everyone else. Items slightly differ, but they are hard to tell apart. When you FINALLY get to see a merchant, the items available are capped per area. So, we are left with some kinda cool mobs and some neat exploration, but eventually the puzzles get pretty obscure (or I missed clicking some pixel). I have decided to hang it up. It was fun for what it was worth; I just wish it had more encounters and skills.
 
Corpselocker
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
18.7 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 23 juin 2020
As of the making of this review, I am still to fully finish the game.

It's quite enjoyable, the art style is nice, the lore is a welcome change from the standard Norse or Greek affairs that are so common. As mentioned by others the game has lots of dialogue and the VA's range from great to not bad but not good either.

As also remarked by others the combat "skills" are few in number and lack depth, but for a game of this length and where battle is more of a means to an end rather than the main attraction I think its as deep as it needs to be.

The last thing to be noted about this game is the reasonable business approach, a demo and not falling into the trap of standard pricing for games makes this game a steal and earns it considerable good will.

TL;DR Fun game, shallow combat but not detrimentally so, voice acting ranging from great to so-so, interesting lore and setting that's not the standard template and J√≥ska best boy.
 
The Anathema
239 produits enregistr√©s
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1
Recommand√©
39.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 27 juin 2020
POSITIVES:
- A modern twist on some of some of my favorite 80's / 90's first-person, grid-based RPG's like Might and Magic.

- Great writing. You really get to care for the characters and get a feel for them without it distracting from gameplay for too long. I feel like they have struck a great balance of dialogue versus actually playing the damn game. There are some pretty funny moments and characters tease each other like you'd expect of companions journeying together. There are no Mary Sue characters I've seen so far. One character in particular gets called out on a very immoral decision they had made, but it's handled the way I could believe human beings would react (not over-the-top or indifferent).

- They employ some very subtle ways of avoiding breaking the fourth wall. Where most games just say "Press J to open your journal", in Operencia it is explained that one of your companions is writing those journal entries. It's even written from that character's perspective with their mannerisms and sense of humor. Little things like that just add to immersion of the game and make you feel like the developers put their love into the game.

- Lots of puzzles and secrets to find which are mostly pretty clever and satisfying when you figure them out. I really like that the difficulty has multiple dimensions that affect gameplay rather than just a single slider. I'm currently playing my first playthrough with all difficulty settings set to normal except combat, which I set to hard. Beyond a few encounters where the difficulty spikes unexpectedly, it feels just right for my first run.

NEGATIVES:
- Despite there being an entire screen on your character sheet with quite a few stats which seem straightforward, there still seems to be some math going on behind the scenes that you can't really quantify. For example, you are told intelligence makes your spells more powerful but the game gives you no way to quantify this (it just shows you some of the related stats that are increased like critical damage / change, energy, etc). There are three numbers for physical power, defense, and magic power, but it isn't explained whether these numbers are actually being used for calculations or if they are just a way to summarize your stats. There are definitely items which read like they should make your spells more powerful, but the magic power number is lower than another item which would seem like it should be more defensive.

- Some mechanics could use more explanation (or just be explained earlier). The ability types (Sun, Wind, Moon, Star?, Some temple looking thing?) are little icons in the ability descriptions, but it didn't really make that point very clear. These fill up these party abilities which you start getting before the game even tells you about them. I figured out they were there about an hour before the game bothered telling me "Oh, yeah, there's this thing down here that you've been using for a while already, but I waited until now to actually tell you about it."

- Large enemies (pretty much every boss) don't fit on the screen if you are using an ultrawide (21:9) monitor. It doesn't interfere with your ability to target them, but there is some helpful information that appears above enemies that just gets chopped off when they are too tall. I just pretend it's an extra level of difficulty that I can't see bosses' remaining health and it hasn't bothered me too much. This is so far the only thing I've seen that doesn't work as intended on 21:9 aspect ratio, so it's definitely handled better than a lot of other games I've played at least.

- Despite the dialogue being well written, some of the voice actors are very uninspiring at times. Some of the characters have consistently great voice work. Some of them have their ups and downs. One particular character is just annoying to listen to and sounds like someone trying to role play a goblin in their first ever game of D&D. It's still way better than anything Bethesda has ever put out, so I wouldn't let this affect your purchasing decision.

OVERALL:
Fantastic game! I'd give it an 84%.
 
Bun Bo
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile

√âvaluation publi√©e le 16 mai 2020

Die Texte sind nicht wirklich tiefgr√ºndig und detailliert, aber gut und einfach zu lesen! Die Prise Humor tut auch hier gut. Das Kampfsystem ist anfangs nicht wirklich herausfordernd wird aber mit zunehmender Spieldauer schwieriger. Der Endgegner des letzten Levels hat mich dann auch wirklich 10 Anl√§ufe gekostet. Fast alle R√§tsel sind f√ºr mich l√∂sbar gewesen, bei Dreien war der Blick in einen Walkthrough notwendig. Bei einem R√§tsel (ebenfalls letzter Level) h√§tte ich noch 5 Stunden herumrennen k√∂nnen und w√§re nicht auf die L√∂sung gekommen. Das Spiel hat mir hier keine Hinweise gegeben. In Summa sind die vielen guten R√§tsel aber ein deutlicher Pluspunkt und wesentlich besser gestaltet als bei Bards Tale 4. Positiv herausheben m√∂chte ich das craften von Tr√§nken. √âvaluation publi√©e le 13 mai 2020
Absolut gro√üartiges Spiel mit ungew√∂hnlicher Story und Setting basierend auf ungarischen Volksm√§rchen und Mythologie. Ich war auf der Suche nach einem Spiel, das so √§hnlich wie Legend of Grimrock ist und ich bin wirklich begeistert, weil ich so eine hohe Qualit√§t gar nicht erwartet hatte. Hatte mit dem Spiel mindestens genauso viel Spa√ü wie mit LoG!

Im Kern ist es ein old-school Dungeon-Crawler allerdings mit freier Kamera, so dass man schnell vergisst, dass man sich eigentlich nur kachelf√∂rmig fortbewegt. Die Grafik ist super-schick und hat einen fabel-/m√§rchenhaften Look. Am Skillsystem finde ich toll, dass es nicht unn√∂tig komplex ist, sondern sich aufs Wesentliche konzentriert. Trotzdem ist es sehr variabel, so dass man st√§ndig √ºberlegt, was man noch ausprobieren und optimieren k√∂nnte.

Die Level sind ein ganz gro√ües Highlight. Operencia hat ein ganz eigenes Art-Design mit 12 abwechslungsreichen Leveln. Mal erkundet man ganz klassisch ein d√ºsteres Dungeon oder Grab, mal erklimmt man einen Weltenbaum, dann findet man sich in einem Wald wieder, in dem alles aus Kupfer besteht... Sch√∂n auch, das immer wieder R√§tsel eingebaut sind, die meiner Meinung nach genau den richtigen Schwierigkeitsgrad haben. Sie unterfordern einen nicht, sind aber auch nicht unn√∂tig komplex. Wenn man kurz dr√ºber nachdenkt, kommt man eigentlich immer drauf.

Genial ist auch der Humor - fast jeder Itemtext ist ein Lacher, die Charaktere der Party ziehen sich st√§ndig gegenseitig auf und auch viele Questbeschreibungen sind ein Br√ºller. Das Spiel nimmt sich nicht wirklich ernst, nimmt daf√ºr gerne mal RPG-Klischees aufs Korn.

Fazit: Wer ein kurzweiliges Dungeon-Crawler-RPG in einem interessanten Setting sucht wird mit Operencia viel Spa√ü haben. Die Spielzeit ist ordentlich bemessen: Ich habe in jedem der 12 Level 3-4 Stunden verbracht, bis ich jedes Geheimnis gel√ºftet und jeden Schatz gehoben hatte.

√âvaluation publi√©e le 14 avril 2020
Fairly nice game. Well thought-out, very few bugs, and pretty smooth to play.

My one major gripe is that the narrator (Elia) gets FAR TOO QUIET! If you have the game at a normal setting so you can her the main characters, you'll notice you lose out on many of the words from narration! Elia just gets far too quiet to understand! Sometimes it's okay because her words are on the screen. Other times, forget it! You can't understand what she's saying without turning your sound way up. And by the time you do, it's too late! And when you do turn it up to hear her, and a different character suddenly talks, you'll be blown away by the volume of their voice!

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
29.2 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 11 avril 2020
Very good indie dungeon crawler.

Graphics are nice where it counts (in the game), comparable with Grimrock 2. Cutscenes are hand-drawn well enough. I only found the loading screens very bare-bones (Times New Roman-like font, no borders around the text elements. I think this is something the devs could easily fix and which would give the whole game a more cohesive and less amateurish look (which it deserves).

Sounds and music are well done, as well as the voice acting. I also like the fresh setting based on Hungarian folklore, even though I found the story itself rather mediocre.

Gameplay is excellent, striking a nice balance between combat, exploration, puzzles and party management. Some new ideas in here, which I really appreciated: I like the "logic puzzle potion crafting" a lot, as well as the fact that you can re-skill and re-distribute attribute points for characters at any time. Game also has a metroidvania-feel to it, as you can return to earlier levels to access secrets with new abilities.

I'd say price should be a tad (~5 $/‚Ç¨) lower but even at the current level, you get good value for your money. All in all, strongly recommended for fans of - and vastly superior to - Bard's Tale IV (DC) or Might & Magic X.
 
khamsun
2,967 produits enregistr√©s
0
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
46.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 9 avril 2020
Great world building

Bought the game on the day it came out on Steam, played it for 45 hours with two hard difficulty settings on. I had a great time!

The game looks beautiful. Turn based combat feels solid, and paced well and responsive. Music is also not bad. Story is intriguing and interesting. Artifact system (puzzle solving mechanic) is brilliant and flavourful.


A few things I didn't like about the game...
Some puzzles and secrets are not so well made, not very clear or not enough clue, although I managed to find most of the secrets in the game.
Sometimes voice overs are not easy to understand with gigantic hall reverb effect. And, some sound effects in combat are too loud, not well balanced.
I got 3D motion sickness partly because the camera movement is always stuck with the mouse movement, unlike other games such as Legend of Grimrock in which you need to hold your mouse button down to look around. However, this free camera movement does make the grid based world much smoother and thus the game almost feels as if it isn't based on the grid.
Very bad Japanese localization, sadly. I turned the Japanese subtitle on for the first level, couldn't bare with Google translate copy and paste.


I would say it is a buy if you are a fan of the genre. 7.5/10
Looking forward to the sequel.
 
Cosay

0
Recommand√©
42.4 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 5 avril 2020
Wonderful game!
I have been playing this type of RPG for 30 years, Dungeon Master, Captive, Knightmare... the recent Legends of Grimrock 1/2, Vaporeum and many more.

Operencia is a pure gem!

The mouse-controlled camera is absolutely fantastic. Sometimes you forget is a "grid game".. feels right.
The combat system turn-based is against the classic concept of this kind of games, but solve the problem of the "grid dance". It is nice, can be improved, but it is very nice.
The classes leaves you many spec choices. There is not a single perfect party. You can mix the party in many ways:
Party composition, class spec, equipment
And the characters you don't choose for your party still follow you and participate in the cutscenes...

The cutscenes!! What a wonderful job they made!
They are well made, hilarious, engaging! Outside and inside the combat. The cutscenes dispel the sense of loneliness that these games always have.

I have finished the game with 100% achievements on the first run (No autosaves, No map, Hard mode)
My main party was (characters names spoilers):

Mage (Fire/Ice)
Csilla (Heals/Thunders)
Mezey (Tank/Support)
Kela (DPS/Summoner)

Seriously, buy it :D
 
DLX

1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
48.0 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 3 avril 2020
An entertaining, old school grid based dungeon crawler set in beautifully crafted, evocative environments. The graphics and music are impressively coherent and create a great atmosphere. The devs and artists did justice to the Central European mythological setting, there's just enough lore that it doesn't become a lecture. The characters are fully and well voiced and chatter quite a lot. Controls are straightforward, movement feels very fluid and free despite being grid based. Gameplay is linear, I haven't encountered any side quests yet, and the puzzles so far are very simple. However this gives you a constant sense of progress, every action advances the story. Combat is turn based and well balanced, most enemies feel challenging just enough to be interesting.
 
leiric

√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 avril 2020
Ich war lange auf der Suche nach einem Stimmungsvollen Dungeon-Crawler wie es Anvil of Dawn zu seiner Zeit war.... und ich bin f√ºndig geworden.

+ klassisches Dungeoncrawling
Kachelweise Fortbewegung ist dank der fl√ºssigen Grafik ein der freien Perspektive mit der Maus nicht anstrengend oder l√§stig

+ solides Kampfsystem
Kurz an die gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftigen Symbole gew√∂hnt und schon geht es los. Dank guten und kurzem Tutorial kein Problem. Schwierigkeit kann eingestellt werden und fordert etwas taktisches Geschick bei schwerer Kampfeinstellung - aber alles machbar.

+Stimmungsvolle Umsetzung
Dank brillanter Grafik und voll vertonter (derzeit nur englisch) Charaktere die ihre Rollen ganz klassisch vertreten, bietet ein erfrischend bodenst√§ndiger Humor f√ºr Abwechslung und macht Lust auf mehr. Die Charaktere sind wirklich charaktertechnisch gut gezeichnet.

- Kleiner Skillbaum
Jeder Charakter scheint einen eigenen Skillbaum zu haben und selbst gleiche Charakterklasse unterscheiden sich zwischen den Charakteren. Dennoch ist wenig Auswahl und man hat kein gro√üen Spielm√∂glichkeiten. Dennoch ausreichend f√ºr den Rollenspielflair - f√ºr richtige Rollenspieler wohl etwas zu d√ºnn im Detailgrad.

- keine deutsche Sprachausgabe
Trotz fehlender deutscher Sprachausgabe ist der Dialog per Untertext nachvollziehbar und kann im Journal nachgelesen werden. Die Sprecher sind recht schnell wenn man selbst ein langsamer/fauler Leser ist wie ich - aber der Umfang ist selbst f√ºr Lesemuffel geeignet.

Fazit: Der Kauf ist bei dem Preis durchaus zu empfehlen.
 
Wip
0
Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
1 personne a trouv√© cette √©valuation amusante
0
Recommand√©
5.1 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 2 avril 2020
This is an incredibly charming little game that seemed to come out of nowhere, and it's been making me really happy. I grew up playing the Wizardry and D&D dungeon games of old, and right away what caught my eye about Operencia is the ways that it tries to set itself apart, while still maintaining that oldschool vibe. Dungeon games tend to be about exploration first, character progression second, and story a distant, distant third. While this is a "dungeon crawler" in the most literal sense, right from the get-go the game distinguishes itself by introducing a rich mythology and narrative, which does a great job of setting the tone. This is a very story-driven game, with the campfire being a prime storytelling device, which really helps to add context. Another thing setting the game apart is the constant witty banter between you and your party members, which is really refreshing. Lastly, the art is absolutely gorgeous, and what they've done with the visuals is really impressive. Things up close are rendered in great detail and texture, but anything farther away becomes progressively "storybook" like, like an illustration in an old book of fairy tales, which is definitely intentional. As you're moving, objects and scenery gain more and more detail, and the transition is almost seamless.

So far I've been very impressed with this game, and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys oldschool RPG's, but with a modern twist
 
Whiskeyjoel
385 produits enregistr√©s
0

Personne n'a trouv√© cette √©valuation utile
0
Recommand√©
0.9 h en tout
√âvaluation publi√©e le 1 avril 2020
Produit re√ßu gratuitement

In this video I take a look at Operencia: The Stolen Sun, a turn based RPG game.

Initially it was a little disappointing to have such a great graphical environment with free look via your mouse but a classic RPG movement system that only allows you to move via a grid system forward, backwards, left or right. But this is the type of game it is supposed to be and the great graphics and the free look are just a bonus so I quickly decided to enjoy it for what it's meant to be, a modern take on these classic RPG titles. In that genre it appears to excel, with a great story, graphics, and strategic turn based combat. I played the opening sequence in the video and had a great time. The opening sequence has you playing the King and Queen for an epilogue so you are very powerful and take out enemies easily so you can learn the ropes but once it's over you create your own character and start the game as a weak beginner stuck in a cell. I had to end the video there because it was getting too long but it was really getting into a good story.
I think this game is very well made with fantastic production quality so if you‚Äôre into RPG's you might want to check it out.
